5Z-3tcM07Pyc4mOF2Rjt6Q.review_text: I could say this place is great because of the nook and cranny seating.  Or the twisted psychedelic Alice and Wonderland on meth (which is saying something, ain't it?) decor.  Or the huge selection of brews.  Or the $4 pints of Pyramid Hefeweizen.  Or I could just go with the fact that it's name repeats itself and is spelled in a not quite normal way.  Seems fitting.

GF3VQ7kla79wT6v3ZwZPOA.review_text: No hard liquor here, which I'm cool with because I keep it real with beer (they have tasty beer concoctions -I like P&P). A good happy hour, friendly staff, and an eclectic crowd depending on what time of day you come.   I recommend to come here on mushrooms if one would ever decide to embark on the journey- the decor is already trippy and if you add some good music, good friends, and a cold hefeweizen, it's quite an experience.  weeeeee

ZZfJg3PeZdAxTMc2PpkTrg.review_text: I can't believe i havn't reviewed Noc Noc yet.  I remember when i first moved to SF, walking down Height St. passing this little door with the freakiest things in the window.  I was a little intimidated to see what i would find inside.  i can't remember when i first went into Noc Noc, probably with Kentardo some random night.  But it was like walking into some Tim Burton/Road Warrior mash-up nightmare.  I loved it instantly.   I still don't go to Noc Noc too frequently, but I'm never dissappointed when i do.  i don't mind that they don't have booze, they have a good selection of draft and bottled beer.  It's never too crowded in there like Toranado or Molotov.  And the seats are all different and wierdin their own little way.  Just on Friday night me and Coxy were lounging low on one of the floor cushions, with some persons butt almost in my face, great night.  And a little known fact: On Thanksgiving 2007 I found my karaoke power glove on the floor in the Noc Noc bathroom, now i can't sing without it.

dz6sEfGbyynVKtLEk-nDmg.review_text: I will always and forever love this bar. I have had so many great times here... its chill, not pretentious and the music is usually pretty good. I smile when i think about going here.  The owner is super nice (at least i think he's the owner..older guy w/sweet stache) I also love going to this place after toronado, while that place is great it can get a little nuts....so MUCH MUCH love to the noc noc

mm5JYVteYCuUuNwoT29qcg.review_text: Cool funky little place to hang out.  My reason for loving this place is a little sad.  I was bar hopping in the area when my dinner didn't agree with me.  I was about to head home since I only live about 6 blocks away when somebody overhead my situation and recommend that I head over to Noc Noc.  This place has individual bathrooms!!!  This is my backup spot when Toronado is too crowded.

OxDmQ3RJWQSV9AnJd0MqAQ.review_text: I've been to a lot of irish pubs, sports bars, and the like. They're a lot of fun, but perhaps a little homogeneous for my taste.  Noc Noc will put the 'hetero' back into your night by serving up an experience like no other. Consuming magical fungi won't be necessary, the ambiance should do the trick all on it's own.    No hard alcohol keeps it from the 5 star rating.

9LKB5kk3NagRSUE2bSCoig.review_text: I love noc noc because I feel like I've actually stepped into the movie tank girl when I'm there.  The decor could not be more funky and cool.  I'm not a big drinker so can't really rate the drinks but much love for the atmosphere!

U1RoSy4Hcydcj5FgZ3gWkA.review_text: A really great place, the motif is crazy like Alice and Wonderland, definitely Tim Burton style. The drinks are good and fairly inexpensive. The owner and his son were there when I came with a few friends, and they were very friendly and suggested what to get to drink. I really liked this place and will be coming back soon!

pR1zHvaWixOCPTEsbsRiRg.review_text: The men that run this joint are so funky. They rule! I love the decor and all that it implies. It is trendy but it is a true San Francisco bar no matter where you are from, you will think that! You must go there once while living here. They only serve beer, wine and sake, so if you are into much harder drinks there is always across the street!

9Jpgb5atYlEAuZNVKuIpWA.review_text: I started going to Noc-Noc in 1990, and lived right across the street for 10 years. It was like my living room. The weekends here are not so great, because it gets filled up with lil' yuppies, and non locals. Just too crowded. I love the beer selection, and taking over the island with my many friends from the hood.  Ramaht is my friend, so I'm kind of bias in my rating.

ORf0NEGHNkyHzmFE4MOxWw.review_text: Love this bar!  One of my favorites in the city. It's a gem.  Decor is so original and unique, like no other place anywhere.   Beer is delicious, and I'm not even a big beer drinker. Black and tan is good, and the apple cider ale or whichever, OMG fucking amazing!  I miss Noc Noc, it has been too long. I'll be back I promise.  Bartenders are nice and talkative. Tip them well bc they're cool.   The new bathrooms are good, they old ones were cool but I'm liking the cleanliness of the new ones.  I love you, Noc Noc!!

dp9DXeFzzD_u_8SA70Hr5A.review_text: Its a cozy, dark, small and hot place with free beer. I went there to a Couchsurfing Meeting, the music was weird, but I had fun! Is Great if u go with friends.

5WlF0WZAnkDcys9zAcWWPg.review_text: Good beer selection. Hard to find space to sit. I remember trying to come here underage. They're good about not letting that happen. Sucked for me but whatever. The inside is like something you see out of a scary scene in Alice in Wonderland. I wasn't even drunk or high but it sure felt like it with all the weird stuff you see. It's a trip but fun nonetheless.

iF-Nz3c7ickNeCBx0Ha8mA.review_text: Good drinks. Even thought I'm not to keen on sake, I always drink too much while Im there. Be prepared to possibly sit on a floor.

kIg2NBWP91M-O8zymKxvBQ.review_text: Growing up on a farm in Iowa, it's what I pictured a bar in the Lower Haight would be like.    If I was on LSD.    And for that - I thank you.

B7ecAeAIrXg7sgmabS38pg.review_text: This place is just absolutely rad! Like an alkee Disneyland for adults! Great beers, graffiti bathroom (clearly an SF thing) and it feels like you are in some kooky cave with crazy tall chairs, rounded walls and just decor chaos going on! I loved it and you will too if you know what's good for ya! Yeah, i don't even know what that means?

kcczx52Tejrnm3i3SbLFSA.review_text: If you're a corny 24-year old wannabe modster who wants to hear yourself ramble your own corny lines, this is the place for you!   The rest of us, hit the Toronado, Zeitgeist, or the Page.

ILz8ApVEgTqbv5LnC6PyuA.review_text: I like the little nooks and crannies and interesting seating, and the fact that they have good beer on tap. The music was perfect the night I was there and the bartender super friendly. Any lady that can hang here is ok in my book...

JAfqlk2Oqd3_uett1SQIUQ.review_text: Noc Noc is a bar version of an English muffin. The bartender is exceptionally nice. This is a warren (as well as a muffin) with chambers, nooks, connecting tunnels, crannies, tree roots, dripping butter... Okay, no dripping butter.  It's so easy to find a private section of burrow in which to talk. You can hear the voice of the person talking to you. And that person can hear you. 'nuff said.

zpXqbJQ2CT4PsUBTy30DbQ.review_text: This is going to be my new favorite hangout in the Lower Haight.  ONe of my good friends just moved to the Haight, so we thought we'd venture over to this hood for a couple beers after work.  Started off at Toronado and then used the trusty iPhone to find this place next door...  WOW! the artwork is INCREDIBLE.  I felt like I was in some sort of fantasy movie.  It was pretty chill and the music was outstanding.  It's definitely got some world beats and electronica going on.  I loved how it wasn't too crowded either and pretty easy to talk to the people you're with.  We also ended up meeting two really great guys who we chatted it up with for a bit.  One is a DJ there, so that was cool.  I'll definitely be frequenting this place more often!

_SVAW_bwFx3G2tDqmsmOBw.review_text: Noc Noc looks like what would happen if you trained a bunch of first graders how to weld, saw, paint and otherwise design a bar.  It looks like something out of Fraggle rock, like where Gobo used to go to get wasted by himself.  Seriously though, this place kind of trips me out.    So let's pretend you aren't really looking at the design, like maybe you haven't been drinking for the past 3 months and you're coming to Noc Noc for your first beer.  I give this place credit for having excellent beers on tap, and even more credit for having some really good bottled beers (Duvel, Delerium), not to mention they don't charge you ridiculous amounts of money for them.  While I realize it can be construed as pretentious, I did enjoy that the sign near the front of the bar said something to the effect of "No Miller!  No Bud! No Coors!  Try something new!"  They also carry some St. Peter's brews, which are delicious (i recommend the organic ale) and come in 16.9 oz bottles.  On the flipside, I'm not crazy about the design.  Maybe I'm not artsy enough.  I find a lot of the seating undesirable for a conversation with a group bigger than 4 unless you happen to nab one of the few seating areas that would be good for that size group.  Otherwise you end up in weird positions where maybe two people are sitting while everyone else avoids blocking the walkways in the bar.  I usually find that while Noc Noc can work with more than 4 people it usually seems best for 2 -3 people.    This place is definitely worth coming to if you're looking for variety in your beer selection, but it may take you some time to deal with the design.

42KLEHDWDDr0-zajOq6bbA.review_text: This place is alright, but a bit overrated. It's not really like something out of a Tim Burton movie which people like to refer to, it's just a bit quirky but worn down and poorly designed. The bar staff are nice and friendly however.

dF9DauP27z5pZRns-AGcPw.review_text: Pretty cool/wierd joint.  A fun place to diffuse. The decor was just plain old crazy ass, but I mean that in a good way. My sister and I asked if there were any more seats and the bartender arranged seat cushions on the floor. The DJ was spinning really good hip-hop which I don't always listen to, so that was cool. They had saki, and a good beer selection but I was boozed out, so I got a sparkling mineral water. When It was closing time they were playing Novelle Vague and other chill stuff like that.

H7I6AKkYu-1jemA5cEVu4w.review_text: Sure - unique, strange, creative, and imaginative - but all that didn't make this place a nice place to enjoy a drink.  Is it worth a visit just to check out what everyone tries so hard to describe?  Not really.

MniM4s3_274LU2isiu8n0Q.review_text: What night did we come out? Thursday  How was the line? No line  What did we have? 1 Pomegranate Mimosa 1 Hefeweizen Champagne  How was the crowd? Average Looking  How was the scene? Social  What's the demographic? Equal crowd of men and women  What's the ambience? City Folks, College Bodies, and A Few Hipsters  What kind of music was playing at Noc Noc? None  What's the noise level? Average  Will we hang out at Noc Noc? Yes

ZMMOMP5kLoXWcm3keolHCA.review_text: Headed down Haight in theory calling it for the night, led by our local guide, a group of us stopped after passing Noc Noc...   He noticed.  "You want to go in there?" he half asked.  "It's an interesting place.  Alright." And we headed into the hallucinogenic nightmare that is Noc Noc.    Immediately a friend asked me, "What does it say about us that we all wanted to come into a place like this?"  I confessed that it reminded me of a place I went to once that was, in all honesty designed to look like the inside of animal on the inside.    Mostly a beer bar (with some good picks at that), despite an interior that is more like the more terrifying coffeeshops of Amsterdam, Noc Noc certainly was an interesting start to the night.    I suppose par for the neighborhood.

_pIG1_s6Bzymn1zeyLjBHQ.review_text: I can deal with different. I can even deal with bad music. But I can't stand spending time in what looks or feels dirty.  I don't mean "dirty" as in "eww, look at those two stains on the carpet!" but dirty as in, "WTF is sticky on this chair?" kind of dirty.... like, is this pee, water, or beer on the floor kind of dirty... and add to that music that is odd and oh-so-loud, plus a place so dark that it feels just spooky.....I noticed there was some strange artwork on the walls but damned if I know what it was since it was too dark to actually SEE clearly.    I can barely  give it the two stars I am giving.  OK, so it's not my scene, but I am okay with that as long as it has some other appeal.  Can my friends and I sit around chatting?  No... too loud.  Besides, chairs are dirty, floors are wet because.... well, I don't know why but it was wet.  Lean up against a wall?  No... dirty.  The plus was that it wasn't crowded.... but then why would it be!!!!???  Put it this way. If there was a half-thought out bar at the outskirts of hell with people who had to hang out until judgement day to figure out if you go into the burning fires of hell, or could shoot up to heaven - - - it'd be a place like Noc Noc.  I give this place one star, but add in one additional star for an allegedly good selection of beers.  If the aura had put me in any mood to actually take a look - I might have seen this myself, but the minute I entered, any desire to party/drink faded and by the time I slowly walked across the strangely wet floor, I counted the minutes until we could leave....  To each his own, yes.   This place is not for me.

kK996Gx3ZoR7Avd5WILFEg.review_text: Noc Noc has a special place in my heart; As far as I can recall it was my first regular spot; The first place where bartenders and regulars recognized me, it was at that crooked plaster and sheet metal table in the middle of the bar where I first learned to drown my misery in alcohol. I cut my drinking teeth at noc noc. I also learned a whole lot about music from one of the DJs there. In '97 there was no better place for an awkward music geek.   It had been about 10 years to the day since I'd set foot in there. At first glance, very little has changed; Dark as ever, same arty 80s music video decor, still beer & wine only, the same blend of electronic & avant garde from the DJ booth. I think Rahmat is still running the place too.  But some things have changed, for sure. The couches are cleaner, the bartenders aren't as friendly as they used to be, and the homeless guy with his dreads on a stick isn't milling around offering to tell tourists 'the story' for a few bucks. ('The story' was this aboriginal sounding creation myth that involved characters named after whoever was in his audience at the time.)  I don't know if I want to go back now; you just can't go home again. I think that this has been the most useless self indulgent review I've written so far. Sorry about that.

p0ZVT8wjQdVJ0ao_KB-pLQ.review_text: Noc Noc is a wonderful place for locals and visitors! Locals can enjoy lots of familiar faces and friendly staff, while visitors can gawk at the wild imagery everywhere. The design of the space is intentional, but looks like a mash-up of dreams and nightmares: Lots of dark spaces, walls and furniture covered with (generally tasteful) graffiti, comfy couches, wooden chairs. The barstools are carved, tall, wooden pieces that are fixed to the floor, so it can be a challenge to get in and out of your seat. But it's worth it, because the taps and cooler always have great beers (local and exotic) to try. It's a small space that can get crowded, but I've never seen it so crowded that a seat wasn't available. Definitely worth checking out if you're in the Lower Haight!

Y4pi0BFOfbohaQnxLfs8DQ.review_text: a good place to grab a drink after a day of shopping further up haight.  the music is set at just the right level and the ambience is dope.  A cross between an Amsterdam smoke shop and a typical dive bar creates the hybrid of Noc Noc.  Check it out if you want a chill place to throw back a few drinks (sake too) from a bartender who knows his stuff.

XNrekEXiKAp36OLBLrHtHw.review_text: Once you're eyes adjust to the dim light with blacklight accents- you will be wondering, "did I just stumble into Delia's art studio or into the Netherworld- in which case I want to know where I can find Juno's office.  This bar has a delicious variety of beer on tap and a fun menu of beer mixes. Try the P&P or the Snakebite. They play a good mix of songs and the crowd isn't rowdy like Toronado and definitely not like Molotov's.  Definitely try it out- you'll want to go all of the time- just don't say "Beetlejuice, Beetlejuice, Beetleju-"

_WL08-344n6xqOX4dXrtRQ.review_text: Wow, what great happy hour prices! $3 for all the beers on tap (and I'm not talking about coors, bud, miller). I had a $3 Guiness and a $3 Brown Lost Coast.   Very sweet and attentive bartender.  The decor in this place rocks - very creative welding and just all around funky.  I'll definitely be back to this place for another beer.

1cX_Wvc3HZHGW813_VJLhg.review_text: what a bunch of ninny's most of the previous reviewers are.  no pbr??  an ok beer selection??  no juke box??  what, are you crazy? of course there are no pbr's, the beer list contains lovingly chosen yummy brews, there might not be as many choices as the toronado next door, but that is because 85% of the beers and 100% of the people there are cock sludge.  as far as it not being an accepting environment, in think it is fair to say that you can not judge the many by the few. some craphead is likely to be anywhere, any night, dont blame the space... do you get mad at the street you were mugged on, or the mugger?  This place is awesome, incredible live dj almost every night( i think) you just have to peek thru secret slits to see what he or she is up to at night. this place is almost never crowded and every night ramad(man i forget the owner/best bartender evers name) and the beetlejuice atmosphere make it super fun. watch out for the magic stools though, they can take some getting used to.  why should every bar be the same, there are so many on that one block that being the same as the rest would be a bad business practice, and if you want walmart style beer, you probably need to head back to the marina and leave the rest of us alone.  get a draak. get some sake. have a great time.  (dude let me bring pizza and cakes in there for my birthday party, and even brought us napkins and things)

z0VeO0sZzO8loCHuEPlKtA.review_text: Sometimes I feel like I might fall out of the homemade chairs, but, despite that fact, this is my favorite robot-spaceship-cave bar in all of San Francisco.

wQXRDOf7Wnu6K1cKO_bjzg.review_text: Wow, this place....where do i begin.  How the hell did i ever end up in this distant planet?! I felt as if I was inside the belly of a roaring volcano, inside The Star Trek Voyager, all inside an African Voodoo dungeon/lair.  I had this crazy beer called Delirium and it got me feelin pretty weird, then i stepped outside and greeting me was a homeless man who wanted to sell me his mixtape.  I listened to his mixtape and I don't know if it was the Delirium in me, but his flow was pretty dope!   I shoulda bought his mixtape.

kUFWgt_uAZxdKC9XrrcJug.review_text: Feeling lonely for home, we wandered into this bar with the same name as the lovely Noc Noc in downtown Seattle. Instead of tator tots we found cider & sake specials, $3 beers, and a kick-ass bartender named Liz.   I suppose the decor is pyschadelic because of the neon, darkness, and trippy furniture. A little silly, but we here for business. We were here to drink.   Excellent deals, and Liz was just awesome. In an empty bar we chatted up the bartender, then got to know the usual clinetile that drifted in on a Wed afternoon.  The outline of the bar is set in the sign which states "No PBR, MGD.." & such. Love that.  We had the best time & went back the next day, but sadly missed Liz. Don't know if everyone would have fun...but we did!

O3lp6qMUzzhDzAl0O-dLWw.review_text: Totally the eclectic little neighborhood dive. All you can do here is drink. The trippy house and downtemp, etc music playing when I am there just sets my mood.  It's like walking into a cave where the Aboriginal and "Beetle Juice" trains collided head on. I like a good beer. A good cheep beer is even better. This is a great place to meet peeps before a night out or just chill for a loner drink after work. But don't walk in here to pick up a hot girl or guy, it's not that kind of joint. The PPP (Price Per Pint) is excellent. Never mind the boarded up front window at this moment. I heard the contractor totally FUBARd that job. Thanks to Jill from MoreSuper for the intro to this place. I will be back many times I am sure.

hpYmAHWl2aWZRoNkUsUmhA.review_text: If the Noc Noc is too dark and dirty for you, then please hop back in your cab and return to the Marina bars where you belong. This is a much beloved beer-lover's dive and Lower Haight douche-free mainstay.

Idt3DCI4wO7vHl9sUWoRjQ.review_text: huge beer selection including local breweries and imports from around the world. prices are very reasonable especially during happy hour. bartenders are known to play a game of backgammon or chess with patrons. decor makes it feel like you are trippin even when you are sober. you can bring in food including amazing pizza from mythic next door. over all its my favorite place to enjoy a pint in the city

RlF51AcnoQyOuCw9rosMAw.review_text: i felt like i was at lydia and beetlejuice's wedding.   i liked it.

Kz1YTeNziSfVJBMKuA_aTA.review_text: I used to go to this place a lot back in the day,  even before I  moved up to SF from the Peninsula; went once a year ago, and I still like it.  I drink hard liquor sometimes -  but I usually go to Noc Noc to drink up their supply of plum wine.

uYaCeEzEHtP7Wz7RxdlUpg.review_text: Great happy hour, Bartender Andrea is wonderful hooks up the drinks!! Highly recommended ;)

INB2_iiyysmYmnKXsM1uvA.review_text: Years ago (I'm not telling how many), Noc Noc became the 1st bar I ever went into, ordered and hung out in. [way] Back then, it was dark, loud music and always interesting people to befriend.  Fast-Forward to 2009, I stumble in and not much has changed! LOVE this place! Great service, always a good crowd, good prices and 99.9% of the time, great music delivered by in-house DJ's !  Thank You NOC!  Ya make me feel like Norm :)

aK7inPBz8gEyfa0m-NSoEA.review_text: Noc Noc is a great place in the lower haight to meet up with friends. It has a great beer selection and the staff is always friendly.

ekGZOsYf7lAOpQlD_j8t5Q.review_text: If you're tired of the normal pub style decor you might dig this place. A day of drinking and wandering around we ended up here. The door said they opened up at 5 but we went in a little earlier as we asked if he was open and he said sure come on in. It was only us for awhile until a few others came in. This was my first trip here, but I would go back. They have a good beer selection as well.

SdEFHl6uGFOTtOxtxi3h9Q.review_text: I would easily say that this is my favorite bar in the city - hard to drag me anywhere else these days unless my friend pressure me to leave Haight street.    So interesting and unique - the music is always very on point (gorillaz and David bowe to mention two) and the staff are really, really great people. They are always happy to offer a sample of anything on tap and they are educated on what they are pouring you.   There are a handful of seats right at the bar and the lighting is low and non-intrusive. It feels like a cave in some areas with small nooks to sit down in and feels like it was decorated by Tim Burton.  It is definitely a spot to bring a friend or two that want something out of the ordinary sports bar environments you might experience elsewhere in this area.   No PBR, Coors, or Bud, thankfully.  Instead they have a huge selection of craft beers on tap and a fridge full to the brim with tasty Trappist and rare selections.   Definitely stop in and have a drink - sit down and enjoy what I consider to be SF's coolest and most unique bars in the Haight, maybe even the city. Also - awesome happy hour deals!  Always at least two $3 choices.

vqB-OkXBzMKUmrCfF6OC_A.review_text: this bar is pretty interesting, definitely dingy. the last time i visited this place me and my group had an interesting experience (hence the 2 star rating)... some crazy-ass chick crawling around on her hands and knees around the bar (including the bathroom floor), would not leave us alone. She was on something and really freaking annoying. we ended up leaving when she tried to put her hepatitis infected hands on us, she definitely didn't understand personal space boundaries. someone should have kicked her out of there, wasn't our job though! try it for yourself, maybe your experience won't be as odd.

U54hWdSMcQhqZK4PIDnwjQ.review_text: This spooky place! Probably one of the best bars to go to when really stoned. Even if you aren't stoned, the decor and lighting might make you think you are. But you probably are really stoned, and this is the perfect place.  Anyway, great beer selection. I enjoyed a Green Flash West Coast IPA, which unfortunately isn't on tap in as many places as it should be. $4 for a pint of this during happy hour is fine with me.  Lots of cool seating and a few somewhat private areas that make it good for small groups. Music is loud, and the great tunes selection generally fits the vibe of the place.  4 stars mostly because, I understand it's a beer bar, but I usually need at least one shot of tequila to call it a successful night at the bar. The fact that I can't do that here prevents me from staying all night. But, its a great place to go when stoned!

t5Lm2vXjF4nqgEN0gOZKJg.review_text: Mr J is angry at the world. To say that NocNoc hates gays is the most ludicrous thing I've heard. Does Mr J realize how many of the DJs are gay? Does Mr J realize the owner and son are the most compassionate, friendly people you could hope for? The same goes with the staff. The NocNoc isn't a Zeitgeist with a feigned roughness that adds character or an in your face attitude. This is a place where everyone is welcome.  It's sad to read yet another obnoxious bitter review on Yelp, but I'm used to seeing this in the later days of Yelp's success. People like Mr J would be far too easy to have their accounts removed should I feel so motivated, but I believe in assholes and opinions. Sadly this asshole's opinion is so unfounded and completely fabricated.  Amazing place run by amazing people. NocNoc is a rare fixture in an ever changing neighborhood that has managed to transcend stereotyping and hate for damn good reason.

BZKa-cgM2FplOu6VndHzKA.review_text: This place has a sign that says "No Bud, no Miller, no Coors." My kinda place :) Great assortment of decent beers. The bartender I assume is the guy who owns it, and he's really nice.   Looks like the inside of someone's brain, warm and dark and comfortable with weird cave-painting art and cool seating options. We went pretty early, around 7 or 8, and it was relatively quiet, but by the time we left an hour or two later it was starting to fill up.   Only downside is I'm pretty sure they have no hard liquor :(

CSeWID1TbPxeFwaLRATjfA.review_text: After walking by Tornado during the barley wine festival with my dog I realized it was way too crowded to go in there so I ended up at noc noc.  Crazy weird decor and lots of little nooks to sit in with friends. The bartender knew a lot about beer and told us that she is a fan of aging beer, something I had never heard of before.  I think I should spend more time at this place.

0jKUiR_neIQynEKz44pMWg.review_text: Very low-key and inviting neighborhood divebar in the Haight. Inside feels like i'm in beetlejuice land due to the interior, or perhaps the patrons wearing costume? It is the night after halloween after all! Drinks here are cheap and the servers are nice and accomodating! It's a tiny place so if you have a big group coming here, prepare to be dispersed. My only gripe is the weird smell coming from take out food that other patrons kept bringing in. Yes! They allow you to bring in outside food here! So the group adjacent to had had pizza and caesar salad and some garlic bread...so guess how the smell came to a mix in such an enclosed area? All in all, this place is great to get your drink on, plus they were playing awesome tunes from different genres!

_yntN5c3jV9gBWUfAhOp0g.review_text: Scary on the outside, but awesome on the inside.  I don't remember what the beer situation looks like, but I don't think they had a whole lot on tap.  Didn't spend a lot of time there, but it seemed to be a pretty cool place.

WMptLxONE7g3fZFDyGjzSg.review_text: The only appeal of Noc Noc, as far as I can see, is that they don't card. And they probably don't bother carding because they don't have hard liquor. They don't have anything on tap, either (I think.) They just sell beer and bad sake and sugary hard ciders and stuff. Perhaps they have no liquor license. They do have an interior that looks molded out of a cave, if that cave were in a hipster Disneyland, but is that worth not getting hard liquor for? To me, the answer is no, but Noc Noc is usually pretty crowded. And not just with eighteen year olds, but with older people too. If all this sounds appealing (which I don't quite get why it should) than Noc Noc is for you. I would prefer to go to the sausage place next door.

IYmw8q8C-lTb3kMucoHy4Q.review_text: Like a rad mini-rave revival for grown-ups who aren't really into raves anymore. Live DJ spinning actual vinyl (not a macbook), tucked away in a tiny cave in the back.   As someone who isn't overly into dance music nowadays, I still really enjoyed my time here. We found a place to sit, never had to stand shoulder to shoulder, bumped elbows, or had drinks spilled on us like most other respectable bars on a Friday night. We sat in a booth area in the back but noticed cushions for floor seating next to us and traditional bar stools around the middle.   The interior decor is a little Fred Flintstone discovers a black light. As the night lingered on, the crowd went from sparse locals to a bit of an SF State crowd.   Excellent beer and sake selection. I live down the street so proximity is a bit of a factor but I'm excited for my next visit already. Just can't believe it took me so long to try it.

XbOve7rrtBOC6sLs_ZpWsg.review_text: I like it here. I was there on a tuesday night around 11:30pm and it was dead. So, on the upside we got to sit in the front window and enjoy the people watching. The decor is really off beat, dark, twisted and unique. Beer only option. Bartender was nice and helped me find something I liked that I hadn't had before. yay! Would like to go back when there are more people and music.

UCHWdP_T8mv58wavR1raaQ.review_text: This is a lounge full of character. It's like stepping into a whole new world full of magic and wine and beer. The bartender is a sweet heart.  If you are looking for a fun place to grab a drink and be merry this is the place to go. Nothing bad to say about this place. You will meet new interesting people and I promise you'll want to go back!

HsH9FHDlxDTy8BOuTsWJKg.review_text: I walked in and was blown away with the funky decor but then this is haight afterall. I like that this place looks so cave like but there was like many cavemen and cave women artists who went on a mad brainstorm here. So colorful and dark. The bar is super tiny with bar stools that have super high backs which is kind odd because it blocks the view of the bar. Nonetheless, this place have character and the music is good to dance to. who knew this place serves sake bombs with large glasses of beer?!? O.o And oh, love the fact  that the DJ is hidden in another room but you have slits to peep in. Only down side is they don't take credit card. Bah! How does one get their drink on without carry a wad of cash?!?

0MZEc6n0FXLt9eg_BbH2Pg.review_text: If I were to spend an evening with Hunter S. Thompson, I would take him here. A great space in the lower haight. Most of the times I've gone, they've been playing good music. There's a decent crowd but I can still get a drink. I love to sit at the bar and take over the thrones. Great beer selection too.

uVfD4YYBR2KXr70KDYWtag.review_text: Freaking great bar, love that they carry old rasputin!

n4meBjksuA8ocbOtom8uIA.review_text: If you're into Belgium and German brews, Noc Noc has you covered.    This place is really dark, so it's not always easy to appreciate the awesome one-of-a-kind decor.    The movies they show sometimes are really cool, almost as cool as the crowd - the Haight is becoming one of my favorite hangouts in San Fran.  BTW, I was here onetime when one of these speed dating crews had a gig going on.  God knows why, with the music blasting and the limited space (they over booked the event, those greedy bastards!) - this is a great space, but not for 70+ people who are trying to make intros to each other in under 3 minutes flat, going hoarse over the blaring music, tripping over the stools, over each other, etc.  I felt sorry for the suckers who dropped $$ on this, especially the guys, but I digress.

7AyYMgEOf6AMcD2dg3xuqg.review_text: Ive been told to come here cuz Im an unfiltered sake nut. They do serve a couple good brands and have a decent selection of others. We came on a cold slow day so we had the place to ourselves. Kinda nice (and slightly creepy due to the decor) The whole place is shrouded in black-light and all of the walls glow and have florescent artwork. Some even 3d. all said Id come back here, maybe on a busier night to check the vibe full. Minus a star for cleanliness. The glowing ambiance is cool, but you still should dust it.

NqlXmevVUjFkYGux2evROQ.review_text: I havent been here since college, but I still love them for being the bar that threw me and my friends out. Well, it was really all one friend's fault - first he lit up a joint in the middle of  the bar and when the hot bartender came over to tell him to put it out he grabbed her and starting kissing her. Guess it was no surprise we were ejected! To think, he now owns a popular SF bar....

Ff_GmTwLSRlrHLsFcO4H7w.review_text: It should get 5 stars for the bartender Miranda alone.  Then I remember I have to subtract three of them because a fat guy like me  can't fit in their stupid bar stools.

Ct456aEICzDfn03MHZCzsw.review_text: Go to this cave for a drink with a cave man. Why doesn't the countergoil wear an acrylic leopard skin toga? Her goth shirt and jeans just were sending out mixed messages.

0aJLwGXBVIe6a99f4lxOmA.review_text: This place is something else.  The interior is crazy with low ceilings and cavernous walls with random things hung up.  C.D.'s review said it was like drinking in a weird Tim Burton movie, and I think that's pretty spot on.    We got there early and got a little table to ourselves in a nook near the door.  To be honest, I didn't think we were going to drink much or stay long.  We were kind of tired and looking for a chill night.  Plus they didn't have liquor (only beer, wine, and sake) and I think that's what we were looking to drink.  But big bonus points right off the bat for having my favorite Allagash Black on tap.  That is one fine beer and, for some reason, so rare for me to find.  I'm not really sure what happened or exactly when it happened, but things turned around pretty quickly at some point.  Once we decided to get the cheap hot sake, it didn't stop flowing until well into the night.  We had a great time.  The bartenders were nice as were the other patrons.  The bathrooms were pretty icky though, so prepare yourself.

SXV2iuaLjGYb5DX8OgwjtQ.review_text: It was ok once in a while, when I could walk there. I wouldn't exactly wait for a cab just to go to the noc, though. Except on monday nights when DJ Carlos RIPS THAT SHIT UP!!! Plus its cool when the hot disco bitches show up.

oTpmi6DjCotg0htLaETemg.review_text: Noc noc is something out of a Tim Burton movie. I am still drunk off the sake from last night.

q2cGMOPz43FpEvFzhW2D9w.review_text: Went last night. Almost had a seizure from the decoration. From the looks of the receipt I just removed from the pants I wore, beer was a little pricey. Oh, and I also remember the bathroom door not really closing. Think I had 3 or 4 walk-ins. 1 or 2 is OK. 3 or 4 is excessive. Will go back next time I'm in Lower Haight and not eating sausages.

BdYPc-MOmkwYjjersFiTIQ.review_text: This place was very relaxed, great staff, and not over-crowded. It is a great place to hangout and have beer and wine only. The visual appeal is really awesome and isn't overwhelming. I really enjoyed this place.

6paXMXLywWl3Hafmab4JEg.review_text: Blacklight. Beers. Colorful wall art. Good for an acid trip or a seizure. Still cool, though.

7_-2KvVJ-kJpSqfKIOT3ug.review_text: I shouldn't even be allowed to write a review for this spot:  I am not hip or young enough to appreciate its vibe.  The inside looks like a play-dough exhibit gone wild or, alternatively, an art installation piece stuck to the walls from the Whitney bi-annual.  The whole interior makes you feel like you're under water.  I kept thinking about the movie "the life aquatic" for some reason.   They have a sake selection, taking their dive bar into the Asian genre by a few shots, if you're inclined.  I bet they have fun music on weekends too, but they didn't have much during my short visit.  I can't rate it 4-stars.  2-stars seems too low except for decrepit non-hipsters like me.  I say 3, but if you are under 25 you may think 5.

3c3w_jRC2PwrA2MmC7ChGQ.review_text: I really want to like this place, but its so dark and uninviting.  It would help if they put little lamps around the seating areas so you could read the Guardian during happy hour.

a4r7b9qJI_1HwfVul-ns5A.review_text: Wednesday  night outing... We opted to go to my friend's spot: Noc Noc. From the outside, it looks like a total dive bar and any other time I probably would have been a little weary of it. However, I trust him and he's a fan of this place. For a Wednesday night, this place was pretty popular. It's small, but there were probably at least 25-30 people inside. We ordered a couple beers at the bar and went to go find a comfy spot to sit.   The interior of this place is like a cave! But a tripped out cave! Graffiti everywhere, seating in random places, high back seats at the bar, and a black light by the window. Crazy, right? We found a spot in a cozy booth by the window to chat and drink our beers. Soon afterwards, we noticed a crowd of about 8-10 people sit in the booth next to us. It's a bit hard to describe, but essentially, these booths were completely separated except there was a gap in the partition by the window. So, when leaning up against the window, you could turn to your side and converse with the people in the other booth! The other group had ventured out to get donuts and brought them into the bar -- pretty cool idea. So, somehow we befriended these people and they passed us pieces of the different doughnuts to try.  As we enjoyed ourselves, the bartender came by to check on us and see how we were doing. When we finished up our drinks, he came by again to see if we wanted another and collected our empty cups. We declined, since we were finishing up for the night, but it was good to see he could handle the place all by himself and still provide great service.  We bid our new found friends farewell and headed out.  This place is definitely a cool bar I would go back to in the future. The beers were good, the atmosphere is a combination of hipster and cozy, and the crowd it attracts is a group of young and fun-loving people!

3ZrjvKpBvez2uHzvDNxa_g.review_text: Noc Noc reminds me of this coffee shop I once went to in Amsterdam called the Dampkring.  But that was a long time ago and my memory is suspiciously hazy so it might not be an apt comparison.  Its similarity to a certain coffeeshop notwithstanding, Noc Noc is probably my favorite place in the neighborhood.  It has one of the most inviting atmospheres I've ever experienced in a bar.  The place is just so damned *playful*, it makes me want to spend hours discussing things no one really cares about and plotting secret revolutions.  I HIGHLY recommend trying the Black & Pear (Guinness and pear cider).  It's not for everyone, but I find the combination really soothing.  It's one of the few alcoholic drinks I ever get a craving for.

UspnrHsJen58iyn7zQ9v7g.review_text: Super chill spot that plays different types of music.  No frills.  Great service.  Close to Muni Rail.

4zR6eWgeyaFHuBCMn1JFPg.review_text: I felt like I was inside a brain. And it was awesome.

UrB_TkxQ6dhkclyuvL4iRA.review_text: easily 5 stars in my book. they have a fair selection of beers and was pleasantly surprised at the belgian beers they had. too many choices sometimes overwhelms me so this was nice.  the bar itself is def cave-like. the darkness made the house music playing very soothing. i had a good time. it wasn't too crowded, i liked the music and there are plenty of things to look at to keep you distracted there. a perfect go-to neighborhood bar.  i heard on persian new year they had a buffet of free persian food! now, what kind of bar does that?!

PwQBWbXrfbp4wh3HaYIEfA.review_text: Love this awesome lil' funky bar in the lower Haight.  Super good times here for a chill and fun atmosphere.   Blood Orange drink highly recommended!

YPM4OnKm39CStg1JRHNXIA.review_text: This is your bar on drugs: yelp.com/biz/make-out-ro… but THIS is your bar on the Brown Acid: yelp.com/biz/noc-noc-san… I love this 'Beyond Thunderdome' classic 'only-in-San Francisco' bar.  But it's more special if you only visit every once in a while, you gotta be a complete sicko to make this your regular watering hole.... even though the draft beer selections are all right on. Ok... maybe i'm sick enough that if I lived closer, it would be my regular watering hole. While not having quite the over-the-top experiences casanova Matt C. had here... yelp.com/biz/noc-noc-san… ... I did carry a passed out Yelper home from this bar many moons ago.  Don't take the brown acid man.

Om7G6SRI1mQ6Xh0UiMQYWQ.review_text: I generally refrain from reviewing bars I've only been to once.  However, Noc Noc made such a positive impression on me that I feel the need to post a review, after I stopped in while on a trip to San Francisco.  It has quite possibly the coolest, weirdest bar decor I've ever seen.  A Japanese artist apparently designed the interior, and it reminded me of the waiting area for the next great Disneyland ride.  While other yelpers have adequately described the interior, I'll give the bizarre innards of this pub my best shot:  it looks like a spaceship crashed into a hobbit hole deep within the forest, and the hobbits worked around the wreckage to create a cool bar and lounge featuring the most eccentric art they could find.  The beer list is top notch (I love their sign that indicates no Coors Light or PBR is served), and during my visit, they had not one but two sour beers on tap.  Laura (Lara?) was my bartender on the Sunday night I spent within Noc Noc's comforting embrace, and I must say she was one of the friendliest, most knowledgeable bartenders I've yet encountered.  She really made my friends and me feel welcome - and her alcohol recommendations were top notch.  I can't wait to go back next time I'm in San Francisco.

fsgQfAchMk5XuPx4_GcwDg.review_text: Like previous reviewers have stated before me, Noc Noc has sort of a Tim Burton/Nightmare Before Christmas feel to it.  It gives it a totally different vibe compared to other bars in the city.  One of the owners/bartender, Sam, is such a nice guy.  Drinks are decently priced.  And there's this woman who comes in selling tamales. Never tried one...yet!  However,  heard they were quite tasty.  One day, one day...

mkxCw6GsMZDu-44_aCQTHw.review_text: I came here Saturday -- pretty early on now that I think about it. My friends and I wandered in here during Santarchy -- and the place wasn't too crowded (but again, I think it was early) and was memorable.  It had a cool trippy sort of bettlejuice meets alice in wonderland feel -- in a wonderful way.  Not in a "puke in your face" kind of way.  The people here were all really nice.  I ended up talking to a really awesome couple that didn't seem to mind that I suffer from verbal diarrhea when I've imbibed a bit.  We talked about relationships, sex, dating, working, traveling, and bacon.  I would have talked to them forever -- but they had a bacon Hanukkah party to attend -- and that's just really cool.  I wonder how it was.  My friend informed me we were leaving.  I looked at the bar and realized there were two undrinked.. .undranked... undrunked... pints of beer.  I had enough sense to not drink it myself -- so instead I took them to some other jolly santas and offered them the drinks.  I really hope they don't have oral herpes now. =(  Oh, and I vaguely remember to note that they had good music on. then i got distra

vgwdQ0fpDZdoTidJuwYq7w.review_text: I stopped patronizing the Noc Noc when it was one of the few bars that still allowed smoking, it was too small and I'm not a fan of the smoky treats. However, now they have Miranda behind the bar and she's simply wonderful. I like to sit on the thrones at the bar and chat away, reminiscing. The bar is like an old shoe, in a comforting and fabulous way.

FMVQUpa5g5EQsPEzuBMpDg.review_text: Reading other peoples' reviews, it seems hard to describe the theme they're going for here. Yes, it's like a cave inside. I'd venture the Flintstones meets Beetlejuice. Either way, it's a cool place to grab a few drinks and stare at the walls if your date/drinking companion just ain't cuttin' it with the conversation. There was a pretty large selection of drinks, although it's pretty much beer ($5 draft), a selection of about 5 wines, and some sake? I thought the selection of beer was decent, although there was an inordinate number of ciders on the menu. And sake? Maybe in lieu of liquor? There are quite a few spots to grab a bench or seat, although the bar is somewhat hard to access, but the bartenders are pretty chill.

eih3X8OYVNpPGt9AqWBVCw.review_text: It's like...so trippy and fun here. Definitely the decor is something unique, I think it really messes with your mind the moment you get here.  I got the Snake Bite, which is a perfect combination of apple cider and beer (so cheap too). The people in this bar are really friendly, and I'm not just talking about the staff. Maybe it's the SF vibe, but I definitely liked it. The owner of the bar even came over to talk to us about how he started the bar and asked us how we were doing. That's good service :)

BmxqEeNmHW2b2nju1vMhmQ.review_text: For a very long time, Noc Noc was the only bar in SF that completely ignored the ban on smoking at bars.  Depending on your taste, this is either a complete abomination or pretty cool and subversive.  It's a teeny bar so if you roll in 6 deep you may overwhelm them.  Seating is scarce but the friendly folks who frequent this dive aren't bothered if you need to smush up alongside them.

USZ6XUarw563pg1ON8TaVA.review_text: Great place to go with friends!   Friendly staff/bartenders Great selection of drinks Awesome music Interior is trippy! Truly one of a kind in the city Worth Checking out

sjXDLpvcrMldagWJJDlBTQ.review_text: Super chill place to grab a drink when Toronado is crowded (or when you just don't wanna deal with the vibe there).  Happy hour = $3 or $4 beers depending on what you get. Their selection is decent for how small the actual bar area is.  Every time I walk in, I feel like I've just entered a David Lynch movie. Kinda sexy, if you're into nooks and crannys and such. Definitely not in the loungey way though.  Super friendly service and patrons.

btUugfufQAe-QD6gC_Ckmw.review_text: Felt like I was in one of the hipster bars of the East Village in NYC.  Loved it!!!  Alas, what a contrast to the plastique lounges of Vegas (which I also enjoy, more on an - 'I'm amused' level), my newly adopted hometown.  :-(

d1VXeXMq67_QgdvWY1tcKQ.review_text: Embrace the weirdness. You'll either love this place, or haight this place. Therefore, it's very likely that you might read my five-star rating and think this is a one-star place. And we can both be right, and also just be different people.  The drinks are great, a very solid selection of quality beers on tap, lots of sake, and wine. You get used to the lack of hard stuff pretty quickly.  The interior is like nothing you've ever seen. There are funny-shaped chairs, some on the floor, weird movies, pictures, and music. But I think it's pretty awesome.

cDAdfpWUkpP9BB_aW4qjbA.review_text: As Ivana says: Tim Burton.  Think of it like walking into someone's nightmare but then finding out this twisted reality is home to a lot of just really happy people.  I almost found myself tripping over things, be it the people sitting on the floor cushions or the sculpted benches.  You know how sometimes you go to someone's house and you pass a sculpture that becomes a "conversation piece"?  Mmm, the entire place is pretty much a conversation piece.  So grab a beer (because that's pretty much all that's on tap!) and chill out with the locals!  Times visited: 1

6mKZil1ppEG0CZM2JlskoQ.review_text: Dark, trendy, fun vibe. Little nooks all about to sit. A place I like to stop by when I'm in the 'hood.

wGmfD_eB9-BuWHrmf3-bJQ.review_text: I fell in love the instant I walked into this place. Flintstones meets Batman Forever. It's dark with stone and wood all around you, yet it still feels comfortable and friendly. The bartender was sweet and the selection of beer was not huge. But it was a case of quality over quantity. When I'm back in Frisco, I'll will try to make it back.

LrdgsXGn7lP2sN98FKVX4w.review_text: Love Noc Noc, but what happened to the DJ nights? Thanks to one of the owners, Samson, I used to have a late afternoon spot on Fridays for a while when I was between jobs. I dropped in for a drink recently and was informed by the bartender that they don't do DJ nights at all these days. That decision surprised me -- it's always a nicer, more unique touch to have a DJ selecting tunes for the evening than to just put your ipod on random. And it was never too loud to make conversation with your friends. I miss the regular DJs, each of whom seemed pretty entrenched in their weekly rotation. What happened?

vW9kDUZbsSONrajEc2UQXQ.review_text: 5 stars for what it is. It's a unique SF bar and it's good at being just that. Here are some words that come to mind when I think of NocNoc:  space Q (the restuarant) Indian Narnija leather Beetlejuice, Beetlejuice, Beetlejuice Haight St.  Friendly bartendar, bathrooms so clean it's like your mom just cleaned 'em, interesting decor, good music--eclectic mix but not too weird (whatever that means...)

t4LQe1vSa6qmWzbDfPGb6Q.review_text: I fucking love this place and not just because I used to live on top of it.  Rahmad (sp?) and his son Samson are the coolest fucking bartenders in this city. Forreal. Most bartenders think that they own the place, but even though Samson and Rahmad literally DO own the place, they are down to earth human beings.  It's a beer and wine only bar, but they got cool "cocktails". Sake is always a good choice. I personally believe that the big booth in the front with the window is the best place to sit, talk and people watch. You never know what will walk by on Haight St.  Anyways, it's a typical Lower Haight establishment, which means that it's fucking dope as hell. So get here and give Rahmad a handshake for me.

Qrza-_Tu6MCBYZ4B1M06pQ.review_text:
I'm unsure what compelled me to take my newly minted San Franciscan friend to this bar, but I felt that somehow she would connect with these people, that she would feel right at home, like in her old neighborhood...Beverly Hills.  NO ONE SAID I WAS A GENIUS PEOPLE.  
  Anyway, she was totally bored out of her skull and sent me eye bullets the entire time, but I was totally into the freak show parade and the horrible costumes and the guy with his snakes, really, like snakes, not trouser snakes, but you know like snakes.  Maybe I'm a little circus freak inside, but WHATEVER, the Noc Noc is F U N.

rbAk94nCTe-_PTCR52tN0Q.review_text: what an odd place okay priced beer, nice crowd. it is not too noise for a conversation. and fun for midnight people watching. can get crowded at the weekend. otherwise, good choice.

1cI6RYkKUnzIZpVILf9edQ.review_text: What a cool bar.  One of the trippiest places i have ever been inside.  With seating like you have never seen.  They also have alot of great beers on tap and a DJ.  Tin on the Roof and an aquarium in the corner.  No Hard A....

ra3OzaxpILytSjHRRKoT8g.review_text: I love the Noc Noc.  It remains one of the all time great bars in San Francisco and for no good reason reminds me of a David Bowie concert, circa high school.  Last time I was there, someone I went to college with came up to me and said, "you look just like Laurel B., but you are too young to be Laurel B."   Sigh.  The end of a perfect evening.   (I don't think he was drunk.)  That was the night that the BF and I had a business dinner with his colleague from Australia, we went to RNM but the BF bailed because an arsonist set fire to the building next to his, and his apartment building caught on fire.  Rising to the occasion, alone but valiant, I entertained business colleague in fine style (cocktails, wine, heard all the secret work gossip) (!), and we wound up at the Noc Noc.  BF:  not so happy when I got back home.  Something about a fire, and what was I doing out with some other guy until 2 a.m.?  So much for self-sacrifice.  But the Noc Noc was as great as ever.    And the firm paid.  For it all.

CJKrqZ3yTmmVpa_6xZeMHw.review_text: What a random yet oddly enjoyable place. The beer is cheap, and its sane enough to carry on conversations with your friends. Parking blows, but its the Lower Haight so I should have known what I was getting myself into. I agree with the crappy bar setup with those gigantic chairs getting in the way and also the lack of normal-ish seats. We powwowed on the floor, ewww, sticky.

HshIhF76Uea0-2ht_KUisw.review_text: I recognize that this place is on Haight, and judging from the peeling paint, it's been around a while.  I must conclude that someone, amid a demonic encounter with LSD, ravaged this place by what seemed at the time justifiable interior design, and then fled the scene to avoid the flesh-eating penguins.    I'm just not quite sure what else to think while sitting in this cave with spikes on the walls and torture-chic furniture.

YKiNwTS1Ye6hK3FzYV5UrA.review_text: Very cool, unique, funky decor with high back chairs, misc tubing and cushions on the floor.  Great for coming in with a group and hanging out with a cold one :-)

582iTyqKkoHeBFPMJuQEJw.review_text: Great bar with just great beer on tap and in the bottle.  I'm so glad I have Noc Noc so close to me to be able to call it one of the local haunts for me...it is also nice to take my out of town guests too.  If it original by SF standards imagine what my friends from AZ or the midwest think...so far they've all loved it.  Seriously, a great place to chill and get away from the Toronado scene (which I also love but totally different mood) and embrace your inner mole-man self.    This would be the type of bar the Morlocks would frequent from Wells's classic "The Time Machine."  I have to say it is my second best cave bar experience.  The first being  a real cave, with a bar, in Prague, that was once used as a bomb shelter, and now as a jazz bar...and randomly seeing Branford Marsalis play a set.

rJ5mJ18V-2fjW_5OkeHnng.review_text: It's definitely unique....it definitely feels like a cave and the bartender was nice enough.  However, no jukebox and NO LIQUOR....seats are weird....bar stools are even weirder....and no cheap PBR.  I'd rather brace a night with the Sid Vicious wannabes and crackheads and dealers at Molotov's across the street than Noc Noc...sorry....for all those people that found it a totally surreal and trippy experience.

i7kEmwperz9uhs38RfguWg.review_text: One of my very favorite bars--also seems like one of the few bars where strangers talk to each other, especially if you stand at that center table. I've been bought drinks here, had female friends make new "gentlemen callers," and I  really like the owner. I prefer the harder stuff but if I'm sticking to beer, this is the place I prefer. I like that it's dark and trippy--I'm a Lower Haight "denizen" and this place feels like the epitome of what my hood should be. Oh, it's the oldest bar in the neighborhood, from what I know.

WI9UJah3bVB258wzEIh34A.review_text: I have vague memories of going to Noc Noc at some point over the past four years to hear a punk band.  I could be mis-remembering this, but I also could be remembering correctly.  Aside from this "mebbe I went there once" time I have not been to Noc Noc again until last night.  And, I didn't even have a drink there last night.  Let me explain why - considering I may or may not have been to this establishment during operating hours and have never bought or been served a drink there - that Noc Noc gets FIVE stars (ten, if I could give it ten.)  Picture this: Big Saturday party somewhere in the Mission.  Party ends, no one can get cabs.  There is one sober guy (Fong you rule) amongst a sea of drunks.  The sober guy takes pity on me - who really just wants to go home and go to bed, as opposed to continuing to party as everyone else seems inclined to do - and, says "I'll give you guys a lift to X place where you - girl who wants to go home - can catch a cab back to the Avenues; and, you - three people who want to continue to party - can continue to party... but, FIRST I need to stop for some food."  Fair enough, sober guy with the car gets food.  Totally kosher with everyone.  Apparently, less kosher with the universe, as the first pizza place we try is closed.  McDonalds is closed.  Popeye's is closed (we actually didn't check - we just went on the assumption that if McDonalds on Haight was closed, Popeye's would be too.)  There is no Taco Bell with in a thirty mile radius (which is probably a good thing.)  At this point we are seriously considering either the Lucky Penny or eating one of the people in the car.  Then we find that  [Insert Name of Pizza Place Here] next to Noc Noc is open.  So sober, hungry driver and drunk, hungry friends jump in line to grab a slice and I go in search of a bathroom, as all the vodka and cranberry juice from the previous evening of partying is causing me to dance around like a five year old doing the pee-pee dance.  EXCEPT: It's almost three in the morning and EVERYTHING except for the pizza joint is closed.  I am about to cry, I have to go so badly, when I see the door to Noc Noc is still ajar.  I timidly knock (shut up) on Noc Noc's door and say, "Hey would it be okay if I came in to use the bathroom real quick?"  I fully expect a "Fuck no, drunk girl who has to pee, we're closed."  But, instead - like a gift from God, Allah, the Earth Goddess or whatever you believe in - I hear the voice of Rahmat (the owner of the bar) saying, "Sure, go ahead."  Not only does Rahmat let ME use the bathroom; but, he lets two of my drunk friends who are also doing the pee-pee dance use the bathroom.  Rahmat is the most AWESOME person on the face of the planet.  I promise you, I will be returning to Noc Noc and giving them my business (once I'm done with the whole three months of sobriety thing) as the awesomeness of Rahmat indicates that it will be a choice place to hang out.

OWnYWg8L67W-moQJkjrXPQ.review_text: This place is perfect for the Haight.  Very artsy and burningman-ish with their decor.  All the artsy metalworks and cool bar stools..  I felt right at home here as I felt like this was truly a San Francisco Bar.  Not sure if you would really see a bar like this anywhere else in the world.  They were playing some cool electro beats when were there and they had a nice selection of beers.  Stuff I had never tried before and I Always like trying some new stuff here and there....  HAPPY HOUR DEETS:  5:00 to 7:00 p.m. nightly Draught Pints $3.00

GqAWZId7sUGylHljDFbe2A.review_text: i like. at this point in my life i think posh floor seating is cute....maybe not so much when i'm older and rocking a bad hip or something

wqMxXNiA04dynT-U1WEZSw.review_text: Of the bars in San Francisco I have spent the most time in, the Noc Noc beats all of them by at least two fold. Ramat is the nicest person in the universe. The beer selection is great, and you never have to worry about how cool you're dressed, or what the bartender's mood is.  Thanks Noc Noc for facilitating my debilitating alcoholism.

y1PQeeaBdvoh2K3YnSJIZA.review_text: This place is weird.  The paint is weird, the decorations are weird, the chairs are weird, and the bathrooms are weird.  I kind of liked it.  They had a great beer selection and the happy hour prices were ok.  The bartender was friendly, but he seemed more interesting in talking to the regular than helping anyone else there.  Not really a big deal.

mOTQg_FtBcHO7NXulhq3hg.review_text: Noc Noc reminds me of one of those cave themed carnival rides from those school field trips where you're supposed to write a report on some sort of crazy ass science exhibit at the local fair, but end up running around getting high on candy and daring each other to rail fluorescent yellow pixie sticks.  You know, one of those shitty ass rides with thinly veiled names such as "Ted Tinstones Amazing Adventure" and "Pirates of the Mediterranean," that are usually filled with meth heads who jump out of paper mache crevasses to yell boo at hapless 3rd graders who are probably too busy gorging on corn dogs and cotton candy to notice.   With its cave themed atmosphere, Noc Noc manages to preserve the better thematic elements of the carnival ride while disposing of the rickety-ass cars and a payroll filled with screaming carnies on meth.   Mind you Noc Noc may very well be filled with screaming ex-carnies hopped up on meth, but that's part of the charm.  I love dive bars and consider this place to be one of the best in the city.  Extremely cheep and good selection of beer, aforementioned cave-themed decor, and a highly random crowd makes this place one the better options in the city to get wasted on the cheap.

K-NT_xHy7q779oSPLCyvNQ.review_text: Wait... Noc Noc is a dive bar? No it's not! No place this into self-image could possibly be considered a dive bar!   Plus, dive bars don't publicize their wine lists -- come on! And they serve BOOZE. Not just beer and wine. Okay, okay... And sake.  Ha ha! Ha! Ha! Ha...  Okay, Yelp -- update the classification there...  Noc Noc is weird. It fits into the Lower Haight. Wait again -- did I just call the Lower Haight weird? Yep -- I guess I did.  I always think I should be doing drugs in there, and I wouldn't get bored as quickly as I do. I'd find the cavey atmosphere and the weird, low furniture and the runic graffiti a lot cooler and and more visually stimulating than I actually do.   But alas, since the arrival of my gray hairs I've packed up the drugs. So they should at least sell the sauce, so I can get drunk.

ccQG0zctVkWkaFju732KxA.review_text: This bar is dope. I'm pretty sure everyone in San Francisco knows it as " that dark dingy dive I went to when I was underage" but I think it's fantastic. I recently rekindled my long lost love with this place after not having visited it since I was 18. They only serve beer and wine I think, but the wacky psychedelic atmosphere makes up for the lack of booze.  It's a nice place to go with a small group to hang out and relax with a beer. It's usually pretty empty, and the crowd is mellow. The DJ hides in a cave by the bathroom, and as far as I can remember plays pretty decent jammmz. Me gusta mucho!

d99BEHPP8VCU04RamEWnxg.review_text: I've never been so excited to walk into what appears to be a dark cave. We passed by this place a few times hesitant to head in, but the allure of glow in the dark magic drew us in. Plus anytime i can get a pint of hoptimum for 6 bucks... yeah I'm up for that. The bartender was cool and didn't card me and my wife... almost everyone else does so naturally he holds a special place in my heart now. Seriously though you should go in purely for the ambiance. I would love to see almost every other type of establishment decorated like this. LSD inspired designs on minigolf! common that would be amazing. anyway aside from my pointless ramblings I will definitely be back to noc a few beers back

CLkeY_rv2JUcfaf9UuVS7Q.review_text: That's an original, interesting and unique bar. This is a great place to have a drink, especially during happy hours (until 7PM).

ZSretWXlve11q9hP6SrScQ.review_text: noc noc. Who's there? Orange. Orange who? Orange you glad you came to this awesome bar in the Haight?  The Noc Noc is weird. I LOVE weird. It's like walking into one of Jim Morrison's mind trips. You're drinking cheap beer in a cave and staring at all the colorful art installations on the wall. This is a "dream" you'll want to always remember.   Live weird. Die weird. Embrace the weird.

59QzQ3-dmOD1USV2hQpwkw.review_text: For no good reason, this place reminds me of the enchanted forest abode of Woodsy Owl. In the grand scheme of things, I don't know if that's good or not, but for me personally, I love it.  Seems a little bit more laid back here. I always have problems the few times a year I'm out in the Lower Haight. Never at Noc Noc, though.  Guess Woodsy has a calming effect on people..

R5Tps94zfW_Bu55DkkVTjA.review_text: Coolest bartenders this side of the 'ssippi.

jy-YyFaGgbzuoJe6nMBDYw.review_text: Fun times. I love Bingo night.....only downer...I am always hurting the next day at work.

vxR_YV0atFxIxfOnF9uHjQ.review_text: Staff are really nice.... lots of beers, and wine available.   I was a little scarred to come because these couple of streets looks sketchy and I feel like my car is going to get broken into, but it turns out it's relatively safe.  There are other bars/club/restaurant which keeps the street lively.    They close and shut the doors at exactly 2am, so last call is at 1:40ish.  They come around at 1:50 to make sure you finish your drink, then lights and music stop at 1:55, for you to hit the door at 2.  They have this process down... I guess they just want to go home.  It's ok, it's probably time for me to go home too.

BzsL4Un6x4_zNq3CXA71Tg.review_text: Oohhh. . . looks like we got some lovers and some haters of this place. Well add me to the lovers list. I like the trippy decor, good tunes, and hip, but not so-hip-that-I-suck crowd.

CYUMdxejQSTWrUDNMXE4SQ.review_text: It's time to leave for the airport to head back home to L.A....but let's squeeze in one last beer!  Our friend takes us in to Noc Noc and it was like walking into the Beetlejuice movie.  The bartender was really nice and surprisingly did not have a "too cool for school attitude" for this dive bar.  We ordered 3 pints and when he said it was only $9, I thought, wow, that's cheap.  We find a cool little corner to sit in and chat, when a few minutes later, the bartender asks us if we want another round before Happy Hour was over.  "Happy Hour", I thought?  Ohhhhh!! That's why the drinks were so cheap!  Ding Ding!!  We politely declined, and I realized it was Sunday.  Happy Hour on Sunday....how can you beat that??   Such a cool little spot to have a drink with some friends.    Extra note:  After 3 days in San Francisco, I realized that dogs are welcome in the bars!  Don't even need a leash....that's en extra perk for me....and my 2 little Chi's!

OfoCUjyec9C2kcxXaJ4HBg.review_text: I luv u Noc Noc I luv u Noc Noc I luv u Noc Noc I luv u Noc Noc I luv u Noc Noc There, one for each star. Ramaht, you are the man! Thanks for being so good to all of us over the years. D.J.  Stereo Steve is also the man. D.J.s really make this place stand out. I had Tuesday nights myself here for years. Todd is there in my place and gives his sets the passion they deserve. He is also a great guy. Say "hi" and tell him Josh sent you. Another cool thing about this place is that it is the ONLY bar ever where you can discuss religion, politics, death, taxes, or whatever and nobody ever gets offended or heated. What a bunch of mature adults! Please name another bar where that happens. I dare you.

K9UCL5zroxiczuS4iZTSNw.review_text: Super funky and fun.  Reminded me of being on the playa.

w9buQhEHs8-gTadBnKWX7w.review_text: I love love loved this bar.  Nooks and cranies everywhere!

8pONVRF4HDD9ynt5lCynTQ.review_text: Warning: If you go to Noc Noc, you will probably start making out with someone in a dark corner. Hopefully it's someone you know or at least find remotely attractive. My date is devastatingly cute to begin with, but the nonexistent lighting and  Garden-of-Sin vibe at Noc Noc made me me feel like a bad, bad girl. Before I knew it, I was half-naked and giving lap dances left and right. Ok- that part may have only happened in my head. But for realsies, AK got a little handsy and it's because Noc Noc makes you feel like you've died and gone to hell. And hell is sexy. At least to me.  Drinks are strong strong strong too. Which may explain more of my bad behavior as the night progressed. I probably need an exorcism now. I think they do those in the bathroom at Noc Noc. Because that shit was tore up. Apparently the girls at Noc Noc pee standing up. Because there was plenty of pee around the toilet seat and on the floor. I know because I slipped in pee, hit my head/shoulder on the wall, and got some on my dress. That's nasty. Minus two stars.   Run of the mill Lower Haight crowd and bartenders who won't smile or make you feel welcome but who will get you as intoxicated as you want to be in a timely, efficient manner.  My advice? Bring someone you want to make out in the dark with and use the restroom at a neighboring establishment.

cCPjASKs5YpMB4BmN2oSZg.review_text: Such a cool dive bar. Very good beer selection. Good prices - and they get lower during HH. Bartenders are cool and attentive.   Totally unexpected to be there. I met up with a h.s. friend and her husband, who moved from a conservative town in the South to live nearby for a year. Last stop for her birthday.   The funky layout means there's always room for another small group to stand or maybe sit. Interesting decor can't help but sustain conversations and the overall vibe.

L5OCs5ri6Wrtpfru5IGuaQ.review_text: This is for sure one of my favorite bars in the Area. Usually after getting the job done at Toronado next door, we stumble over here for one or 2 last beers before wandering around to find some shitty pizza to satisfy our drunk munchies. Aside from the fact that it's just a really cool looking Tim Burton-ish cave/bar, the crowd is always way chill and it never seems to get TOO crowded. I've always been able to find somewhere to sit comfortably without wanting to violently murder anybody.   The last time I was here, we'll just say I was feeling a little 'euphoric', and I couldn't think of a better place where I wanted to just sit and space out and enjoy a nice cold beer. I felt like I was literally in a Tim Burton/Henry Selick movie (which, if anyone knows me, is basically my dream in life.) Needless to say, it was a pretty good night.   I definitely suggest swinging by here if you're in the area and want a change of scenery from the usual (and a cold brew, obviously). You can't go wrong.

t-X7Y7HzEwgrF5IGSamhOw.review_text: Best lounge yet. Get to know the locals and you'll fit right in. Cool calm and collected place and never a dull moment unless your looking for a club scene. Parking in the city, well that's an issue anywhere in SF, expect to be walking a few blocks if you don't get lucky. Nice place to play bored games before the rush hour between 9pm-10ish. Convenient food next door Mystic Pizza and Rosamunde sausage grill to sober you up. Beer selection is limited to the best 40 beers and has some favorites like Chimay and Piraat. Hot/cold Saki selections are also available recommended nigori sake! The music is unbelievably nice drum n bass, trip hop, indie is the main selection. Usually a nice crowd of people and will get packed for a bit after 10pm on Friday and often Saturdays, which makes for good times. Definite must visit more than twice to get a feel for the place and make sure to say hello to the owners  and bartenders very nice people!

PGhZ1VreIUCE8tUKCqsW3Q.review_text: I was hunting for new places to bring friends and visitors to the city and in google search pulled up Noc Noc. After reading the website and reviews I thought it may be an interesting place to check out.... So I did  My first impression when walking in the door was "wow what a cool place"  The only way I can describe it is like the Disney Polynesian resort on acid? I mean that in an entirely good way, cave like feel, with lots of detail, patterns, textures and lots of nooks to chill. I commend the brave and TOTALLY unique design of the bar. The feel of the bar is def a local tight knit group of people that know each other by name. The patrons are extremely friendly have a sheek, urban, hipster feel, willing to make a toast to a stranger and converse. Beer and wine alcohol only, but I was impressed by the web site's descriptions of their unique specialty drinks. I'm hoping i caught the bartender on an off day because he really lacked in salesmanship skills. I informed him its my first time at this bar and told him I'll try anything. Trying to pull information about what to try seemed to annoy and tire him so I gave up and settled for the snakebite. Did I say settle? It was really no settle, it was fantastic and I thoroughly enjoyed it. I would have rated this place much higher if I had decent bartender input, I'm sure he's an awesome guy and all but please sell your products.

UKsBKla6IjgOeKe_UC5Dbg.review_text: Dali meets Disneyland:  There aren't too many bars like this in the world. Everything inside is hand crafted. the designer (whose name eludes me after forever) deisnged this space and Zip Zap hair salon about a block away by curving huge sheets of copper above the bar, sweeping concrete benches and booths, and jutting wood seating at the bar. Someone painted over the copper years ago, but its still beautiful.   I love grabbing a non-filtered sake (about $9) and hanging out with a friend. Great cheap happy hours (i believe $3-6 beers) and the bartenders are great.   I remember being here one night in the front booth with a galfreind (we were both married but separated) making out, and a homeless woman came in chatting us up saying you are such a nice couple. Are you guys married? Well yes, yes we are. But, but  not to each other.

K4g2p31gIE392nZYtu0tAg.review_text: Very interesting decor. It gives a whole new meaning to the word "dive".

p6ucyVInOdbf1-jlwz1Vcg.review_text: I don't get this bar. The people who work here are pretty great and that's where it ends. I hate the ambiance. It feels dirty and sticky and the music is too loud. The place is just all around uncomfortable for me. I like the people who work here and I like the people who go here. But I just don't like the bar itself.

hj7U5xIeohSoryeV2yVvRA.review_text: I just can't get enough of this spot. I also have been requested to write how I describe it in person to my friends, a "post apocalyptic Flintstones."  Oh, and after much seraching I found the song deep in my library. But I did hear another song last night that now I have to go find . . .

Eypq5gLLjCapBVVnMw_MyA.review_text: this place looks like a wacky metal cave videogame end level bar thing bar somethingorother. Good beer selection and I dig the vibe.

BhxQ8TaALaHVZbr5PmXZyQ.review_text: This is by far the coolest bar I've been to in the city. It's fun and cool and could be good for groups or if you're just with someone you like. This was the first time I tried a flavored beer and totally liked it. Definitely can't wait to go back again.

Jx1xPacSQzOZd83f2T4xVw.review_text: This place is the worst! it's always so dark & cold inside - yes like a cave -  which isn't what i'm looking for in a bar. always super weird in there....I agree with Yan K.'s description - but am only going as far as one star on this one!

ugk0g6vyv2XavpoTaJSy6A.review_text: Happy Hour specials always make me happy.   Loved Noc Noc! It was a great place to hang out before dinner. Our bartender was super friendly and helpful.   There's a lot of seating and also the bathroom is clean. Don't think I need to say more.

FKoyQFVYOHd-7n7FfqEicQ.review_text: i like the decoration a lot - it feels like a city bar...and nice beers too...

Zcg8WQHGP8kLAIMfbvfgUA.review_text: This bar is really strange. I felt like I was in alice in Wonderland. I walked into a room thinking it was the bathroom and it was full of like 10 dudes and it looked like they were snorting or doing something. The guy quickly ran outta the room and pointed me to the toilets as he was paranoid as hell.  I would love to say though that the beers were cheap and reasonable. it was also next to Rosamunde and that Pizza joint so this definitely has its advantages.

qHapx_-gi1Joa0qOjnQ2Qg.review_text: the Noc Noc is freakin' legendary.  A couple of times I've been treated to some great DJs spinning obscure 80's, Echo & the Bunnymen, Ride, and the Stone Roses. The beer selection is quite nice and the owner is awesome - dude always has a smile on his face.  The crowd can get a little "black hoodie" for some, but it's actually rather tame.

jMzmali07h-XH1YpiiM3AA.review_text: my most memorable night here, my friends and i went outside to smoke and suddenly, we were singing crystal the crackhead happy birthday while she kept asking us for a dollar and telling us it was her birthday. we mustve given here like $10 all together before she humped my friends leg.  needless to say, we were VERY drunk. this place is AWESOME! great selection of sake and it looks like a small cavern of tim burtons brain...

Qt6t6i4RDbgXIOg6EXUbvQ.review_text: how many times has beetlejuice been mentioned in reviews of this place so far? i'm too lazy to look. i bet it's a fuckload.  but when i say it reminds me of beetlejuice, i'm definitely referring to that cracked out little midget on howard stern. i'm pretty sure everyone else ISN'T.

f6iRA1UBcdPv1x3mDhvdyQ.review_text: weird. funky. fun haight bar. usual price - usual selection.  i dig the noc noc vibe. took some folks from austria here & we all had a great time talking about linear induction.  linear induction & monkeys ... well, not in the same sentence.    also not in the same language. i was talking about linear induction & monkeys. they were muttering some sort of arbitrarily glottal, medieval & gutteral tongue.   i don't understand wacky lingo.  we all had a good time

VCYtRcED5pBCZBwhEUI8Nw.review_text: Noc Noc is kind of the perfect bar to black out at. ^I'm really going to lead with that.  I feel like it's a judgement-free zone?
