Or maybe I just happen to end up there really drunk and often? I asked the bartender what I wanted to drink, visibly wasted the other weekend, and he recommended a bottle of sake. So I bought a bottle of sake... and blacked out. Thanks, Noc Noc!   Everything here is super cheap and the inside feels like someone made a dark bar out of your childhood tree house or Pee Wee's Playhouse. There are fun, unique nooks to sit at, drinks are super cheap and they take cards.  There really isn't a particular crowd it attracts either. Noc Noc is kind of for everyone.

Mdfl-U6LvKjZbczs4HTFWw.review_text: This place is a funky, lower haight gem. I love taking out-of-town guests here as it's so unlike any other place in the city, or elsewhere. The decor is psychadelic, the seats/tables are comfy, the specials are cheap, and the beer selection is good. AWESOME happy hour ($3 beer till 7). I really should come here far more often than I do. Pretty much the only problem is that it can get crowded Saturday nights, but all of lower haight is crowded then. Always a good time!

hP8by2q4mgfQEvvhfChcbQ.review_text: You are strolling down the street in the fantastical Haight neighborhood looking for a good drink. You find yourself acknowledging your place in this great city, all of your favorite neighborhood digs and you find yourself wanting a night filled with a bit of unique flavor: enter Noc Noc. This place will take you off your feet and make you feel like you are having a great trip in the midst of a Tim Burton film. The tall chairs, unique array of seating, vibrantly colored walls, astounding crowd, and incredible DJ are often just what the doctor ordered. I can't get enough of the black and tans and obsessing over the DJ through two tiny windows in his or her cave of wonders.

PFlQ4rYQF9GTF2WK5B1s1Q.review_text: I've only been visiting Noc Noc for one month, but I already feel like part of the furniture.  And when you see the furniture, you'll realize that you have to be a little bit odd to fit in here.  Erich von Daniken meets 1,000,000 BC might be the most apt description.  Throw in a bit of another famous Swiss loony, H R Giger, and you've got Noc Noc's decor pinned.  A live DJ and no jukebox, no mainstream American beers, and no booze are some of the other more obvious non-decor related unique selling points.  The bar staff are exemplary, the regulars are fascinating.  My only complaint, more related to Lower Haight than Noc Noc per se, I guess, is that the bar's character changes completely over the weekend when large numbers of youngsters descend upon it with the sole intention of getting completely plastered.  But it's at times like those that you'll appreciate the presence of the other regulars, and you can all hunker down and complain about the youth of today ... ;-)

Ox8NO6IwNej6ElAbn07oJg.review_text: Fun crowds. Funky carved wood decor. Hippy decorations.  Highlighter colors and backlight. Great rotating beer selection, and wines. No liquor. Great bar staff.

bA6sFAZTIc5ddwpnB_WJUw.review_text:
Where else is such an ecclectic assortment of beers to enjoy under a wild-things-are-meets-the-aviator canopy of homemade airplane wings and trees, tiles, mirror fragments.
  Be afraid, be afraid.  This is what will happen when the hippies inherit the earth.

9r1PUIjVRypAC5pwuhzkrA.review_text: LOVE. THIS. STRANGE. PLACE. LIKE. TIM. BURTON'S. ALTERNATE. UNIVERSE.  Sweet Mary of Virgins, I'm so happy when I score that nook on the other side of the door; a control pit it is... the perfect place from which to observe my favorite bar's delightfully grassed-out patrons.

ZIEZrBO3JLFuqhvmlk-eIw.review_text: This bar is what comes to mind when I think "dive bar in lower Haight" :)  I walked in and felt like I was in an asteroid or something! My friend frequents this place and has people guess where the DJ is. Nope, not behind one of the shiny one-way mirror looking things near the entrance, and nope not on the ceiling next to all sorts of strange decorations! You'll have to check it out yourself to find him :)  I had an interesting concoction with ginger and sake. It was really delicious!! Try out their drink specials, the bartenders are awesome!   I think it was really late when we got there because we had no problem finding seats. At some point I think an outside vendor lady with hot dogs walked by because suddenly my friends were all eating hot dogs hahah.   A cool spot, I would definitely come back!

Re0D5snuHFN9ycAfC-aglA.review_text: The decor leaves little to be desired, but it's what makes this place what it is. And while their beer selection is dwafted by Voronado, this is a good option when seating is unavailable there.

1vT-1gtksBsx14uKi7UsbQ.review_text: I don't understand Noc Noc. As a child of the 90s, I can't help but feel like I've stepped into the underground world of the Lemmings or that I've ventured down in Fraggle Rock. You kind of feel underground, unless you work your way into the nooks along the front window.   As much as I don't understand it, I also love it. Noc Noc is a great beer bar in the Lower Haight and offers a reprieve from a few of the sports-oriented bars or the divey nature of Molotov's. Noc Noc is not fancy, but t has quickly become a go-to if I find myself in the neighborhood at any time of the day.   There's nothing but beer, wine and sake here, and furthermore, there's "no Bud, no Coors, no PBR." Instead, you have Allagash (my personal favorite), Chimay and Lagunitas. They also offer several Black and Tans, combining the best of beers and ciders (try a Snakebite.. Cider + Lager. Doesn't have the requisite blackcurrant as if you were in the UK.. but... it'll do.)  The space is pretty big and spread out, so that you and your group can always find a place to hang out. The aforementioned nooks by the window serve as booths, offering you privacy from other bar patrons, and/or perfect street-watching of passers-by. I've popped in on a random weekend afternoon, finding respite in its cave-like ambiance. But I've also been in the evenings, and while the crowds favor the evening hours, I never found it difficult to find space.  Overall, this is a place that I don't understand, but will keep trying.

gieoMmiYCqd3tcqGbmIwPQ.review_text: It's certainly an interesting setup. Basically its a bar based on the Flintstones decor. I felt like I was in some 80s movie with the neon signs over the cave paintings. Beer is good and cheap but seating is difficult and the bar itself is tiny which can make it difficult to get the bartender's attention. The music is loud but you can shout over it. You know, that kind of bar.

n9j40NJNoehiV4DRN-z2QA.review_text: My fav SF bar. It feels like an 80s lower east side junkie bar. It's perfect and I love the art.

5mG2ENw2PylIWElqHSMGqg.review_text: It was a dark and stormy night.  OK, it was a balmy (65 degrees) January day on Haight Street and we wanted to check out the local watering holes. Our 21-year old son pointed us at Noc Noc, a curious, dark cave of a bar on a noteworthy block (barwise) in the lower Haight.   Were the strings of lights leftover from Christmas? or was it just part of the oddball decor. We warmed our hands by the fake fireplace, took a few looks around the dimly lit and weirdly decorated intereior, and grabbed seats at the bar.  Seventeen draft taps stared us down, with a menu offering beer drinks like Black Racer (a Guinness/Racer 5 black & tan) and Uncle Pat (Guinness & cider). Andrea, our cheery bartender-ette  was both fun and entertaining! The ample 16-oz pours were $1 off during HH (until 7 pm daily).  Noc Noc is another one of the reasons to check out the lower Haight! Its bars and restaurants are as good or better as in the more touristy Haight, and you'll find more locals and less traffic.  Plus, at $15, you can pick up a souvenir T shirt that will let all your friends know you visited hippieville Haight St!

2XbQIi87ySz7KSOI4RgCuA.review_text: We were going to go to Toronado after work on a Friday for a couple of beers before dinner, but it was packed to the gills and we ended up at Noc Noc.  I had forgotten what a cute place it is with it's funky decor and interesting (in a good way) seating areas and chairs.  The high-backed chairs at the bar are really cool and unique!  The decor reminds me of a bizarrely decorated cave or grotto.  I think if Fred Flintstone and Barney Rubble were going for a drink, this is exactly the kind of bar they'd dig.  Prices were decent ($4 for a pint of Hefeweizen).  Music was bordering on being a little too loud, but at least it was a good variety.  I got confused by the bathroom (the second one didn't seem to have a lock), but it might have been the decor that was throwing me off.  Fun place to go if you're in the neighborhood and want to have a beer and a conversation with a friend.

J74LahNA2VsmpTQpYPTneg.review_text: Lots of good beer on tap, including a few varieties from Anchor, Speakeasy, and New Belgium, and the fact that they only serve beer and wine keeps things generally chill.  As previously noted, the music was loud, but not any worse than anywhere else, in my opinion; and I liked the cave-like, Beetlejuice-esque decor.    I don't know for sure that the people who run the place are from Eastern Europe, but I'm going to stick with pronouncing the name the Slavic way -- like "notes, notes".  (The word "noc" means "night" in Czech, Polish, Slovak, Russian -- obviously the Cyrillic version, but it's pronounced the same -- Croatian, Serbian, and so on.)  And you gotta admit, that oozes with street cred when everyone else is saying "knock, knock."  ** Conveniently located near The Wiggle for your bicycling pleasure!

9IYZc_sX7v939OhRGDjj-g.review_text: A fun place to visit, but wouldn't want to hang out here. So if tim burton desgined a bar, I imagine it would look alot like this place.  Always fun to stop in for a beer and check it out everynow and then but there is no way I could be a regulat here.  The seating aragements are cool I have to admit, actually everything is cool here even the prices.  It is just a wee bit nerve racking if you spend to much time here.

-FQ9txCSUC7xrUZeuDXXHw.review_text: I'm no where near trendy enough to comment on all the decor here and how it is post-apocalyptic cool or whatever. But this bar is awesome, again not necessarily because of the decorations/lighting/etc - but because of an awesome drink/beer selection and because of the owner/son that tend the bar, teach you all sorts of interesting facts about life, and share drinks with you.  I've never felt more at home at a bar before. Now if i could somehow just wedge a bed in the cockpit of the plane i'd be set.

hRt0yvtG_mMvNgi7jYia-A.review_text: I like the look of it, but I wasn't in the mood for beer (your only choice besides questionable wine and sake). I'd also be a little anxious if it were more crowded because it was really dark and a shady area. The bartender was nice and the beer was cheap.

xUCE8kUOndbYS7DFIkqT2g.review_text: This place reminds me of Beetlejuice's house. As opposed to Beetlejuice's house, my house reminds me of the place where I go to cry when I realize I have nothing left. Both of the places I've mentioned have a great beer selection.

MRZ5YvV64jSVrlkRAXcTjA.review_text: Nice bar, Nice people, and awesome beer! people who really like beer should go there and try "la fin du monde" = "then end of the world" beer... it is a really really tasty beer ! one of the best you can find :)

4hN_0-9l0gffb5rOu6OAtA.review_text: NOC NOC has one freaky awesome vibe.  It looks like Tim Burton designed the interior with reclaimed furniture and midnight black walls.  Their tap selection is far superior to many other bars and is rounded out with a few wines also.  Plus, they have a good selection of bottled Chimays and lambics at cheap prices.  I was surprised by it myself, but NOC NOC is a great place to have a chill time.

upDDTKY4LgrowjeWkcy7sA.review_text: I know people who LOOVe  this establishment.. a lot.   I  love some of these people who love this establishment a whole lot, so I have given this place a few tries.  The lowdown is that It's a loud, dingy, dark, hipster divey kinda bar right in the heart of the lower haight. Great, if that's your sort of thing. I guess it's not mine. I tried.   In the end, I feel so-so about this place. I'd come here for a drink or two if someone suggested it, but I wouldn't be the person suggesting it.  P.S. They don't serve hard liquor here... a beer and wine kinda place.

zyCUBfCjEidb3nMbUDWyfA.review_text: This place has always been my #1 favorite bar, with all it little nooks and crannies, its the best place to chill out, get to know someone, or get intimate with your significant other - over a glass, or two, or three... of Chimay, of course! The dark industrial decor reminds me of what you would find in east Berlin - I hope that never changes. Because this joint is so unique and unlike any other place here in SF, I give it a well deserved 5 stars. No more smoking allowed indoors however, you'll have to join the bums outside for a cig or head over to Amber. And if you are in need of a set of Chimay or Duval glasses, the owner is kind enough to sell you a set - that was how I procured my first set of Belgian beer glasses.

x4PpZdE81L3vjL5qrGqH4Q.review_text: Beetlejuice! Beetlejuice! Beetlejuice!    If you've been here, you know what I mean.  When I walked into this place, I thought for a second I had cracked my back and released some of the latent LSD living in my spinal cord.       Tim Burton inspired for sure, with little nooks and crannies to settle into in various dark corners....actually, corners is the wrong term, because unlike most human establishments, there aren't really any parallelograms living here....it's very much like a cave, and that's cool.    The DJ played an interesting mix of music that was just cool enough to catch my attention from time to time, but not obnoxious enough to be annoying.  Well done.    The crowd was a random mix of people that filtered in and out throughout the evening.   It's apparent that Noc Noc is more of a pre-party place than a final destination...the flipside to that is, if you do stay there all night, the crowd constantly changes so it's like you're going to a new party every hour or so, without the effort of actually going to a new place!  Sweet.   Even though it was a Saturday night, it was busy but never crowded...pretty much perfect.      Between this place and the beer lover's paradise Toronado, I think the Lower Haight might become a fairly regular destination for me...just gotta find a good place down there that serves liquor for when I really want to hurt myself.

ZO0LU4unvbD7p32aTDQiIA.review_text: This place is weird.  One person we were with said it was like Beetlejuice, another said Alice in Wonderland.  It looks like an aspiring artist was awake for 72 hours, went to the junk yard, went to Noc Noc and started hammering stuff on the wall and ceiling from the junk yard.  When we first arrived there were "normal" songs i.e. N.E.R.D, Kanye, etc....then they started playing angry metal/electronica and some girl in a long bohemian skirt started twirling around non stop and dancing by the door like she was on acid.

XaMwHlRaUfsSjBewVAbiQw.review_text: A friend recommended we go to Noc Noc when we were in the area. I asked him what to expect. His response:  "Have you ever seen the movie Beetlejuice?"  That pretty much sums it up. Lots of interesting colors and architecture to be had here. In fact, it reminds me a lot of The Alley over in Oakland. There's lots of good brews on the menu too -- Jolly Roger, Drake's IPA, Stella, all that fun stuff.  It's pretty solid, but I didn't really see too many people hanging out for a long period of time. Seems more like a come 'n go type of place.

kDVaqOGEqDUiuUe3TiF0DA.review_text: A friend and I went in for a drink and were rudely treated by the bartender who did not card us and had a grim attitude. About halfway into our beers, a "regular" there invaded our conversation and gently commented that "our kind" wasn't welcome in the bar and he suggested that we leave. I cannot believe that in San Francisco there are still people that are homophobic! The bartender did nothing to help. While we nursed our beers, the rude guy then went to get 2 of his intoxicated and ignorant friends to come over and intimidate us to leave.   This place is unique but beware, it's very homophobic, unfriendly, and dirty. Not to mention the beers are overpriced and the staff is lousy. We did not feel comfortable and that's not cool because we were paying customers like everyone else, and this is San Francisco, for crying out loud! Yuck!

mB7-4x5aj_nn1lIzEs6Kaw.review_text: Love the Noc Noc! Possibly my favorite bar in SF! The weird decor is fantastic, and there's a cool vibe in the place. Plus it's in the middle of Haight, so a great stop for bar hopping. Always a fun time at the Noc Noc.

396n7OXqnOzTDad_3pkMYw.review_text: I love this bar!  It's my new favorite neighborhood bar.  The atmosphere is really unique and fun.  The bartenders are always friendly and helpful with beer selections.  Happy hour rocks!  $3 draws! Everyday! They even put out pretzels sometimes to snack on.  I take all my out of towners in here when they visit!  To top it off, it's dog friendly!!!

zhMY628j23fJJzbzHhfOcQ.review_text: It's been years but I walked away with pretentious and trying too hard.  Maybe I shoudl give it another chance.

R872fZFQmb9WPi3UaNkvew.review_text: You remember the old "Simpsons" episode where Homer eats a Guatemalan chili pepper and then starts to hallucinate desert landscapes, and Johnny Cash appears in the form of a coyote and instructs Homer to find his soulmate?  The Noc Noc's interior is like that chili pepper.  Sheriff Wiggum describes the pepper (a "Quetzlzacatenango") as being "grown deep in the jungle primeval by the inmates of a Guatemalan insane asylum," and I think the same could be said of the "Tim Burton meets Timothy Leary" lysergic cave decor here. This is where you go when you want to ingest pure mescaline and achieve altered states like William Hurt. Or, if you're not into reforming your genetic matter via hallucinogenic drug intake, drink some brews and hunker down in a dark, shadowy corner.  I wish more bars took the incentive to make themselves bizarre art projects like this.  All that's well and good, of course. But I gotta say that I don't really like hanging out in Noc Noc. I don't know if it's because the other people are boring, or if the scene is too "Haight-y," or what...but I usually drop in here for a single drink and then leave.  Just a quick pint, a private nod to the interior decorator, and I'm gone.

8FTmY9S9oLjM4Hb8RGOeDQ.review_text: Hamat & Sam are some of the most friendly people I've ever met. I have traveled to  Egypt & Tunisia & I KNOW ;) My 1st st trip to north Africa was in High School in 78.....quite unusual & it ended up being a fantastic trip for us. We learned so much in a very short time & as always we had fun in between. Im not going to indulge........ Hey, as we say in Denmark; det er fanme fedt..... Noc Noc is absolutely the only place in SF where you can do anything within moral norm's....capice..it's a cave for f... sake & I love it...

36LgEtwt6ROhrCtuPjfRmQ.review_text: I once heard a friend describe the Noc Noc as "the bar that looks like the inside of alien intestines."  It's a great divey, Lower Haight haunt if for nothing else but the decor alone. It's dark and trippy and helps create a specific mood. You can sit on pillows on the floor or in the dark recesses of the bar.  Some nights you can even still smoke inside.   The bathrooms can get nasty sometimes (but that's why you love it) and they don't serve hard liquor: only beer, sake, and wine.

9mKAM33kb7JoA06qBrDioA.review_text: If Tim Burton ditched the film scene... this would be his bar. This place is somewhere between Halloween Town and Beetlejuice Neitherworld. Excellent fun, in spots and stripes... sans the hard liquor.

5Hkq3zLeGzATXSapSPDwgA.review_text: The Old watering hole. For a beer only bar with sake, this place is great. The decor is worth the visit. Just make sure you get there before it gets crowded.

gosNE62t1GQnbdITjC2bBg.review_text: Everybody's got their own interpretation of the vibe that Noc Noc has. It is indeed Tim Burton-esque....but to be more specific, this place just screams Danny Elfman to me. Which makes sense because the two artists are forever collaborating. Spooky, yet goofy.  They have some great beers on tap and I love the whole arrangement of the bar. I also find it refreshing that they only serve beer & wine.  Now, if only they had Oingo Boingo nights once a month, then I would be set!

plOtZruZJ-rxF7VCgeS40A.review_text: Nifty place.  Just drinks, and not a huge variety, but that just makes it seem all the more focused.  Great atmosphere.  If you're in the mood for a strong beer and an interesting crowd, it's a good place to be.

VkSK6i_6pqAsoo8aP8DUFA.review_text: Sometimes I can be a real dick.  I know it's hard to imagine with such a sweet face and bambi-esque eyes, but really, if I'm in the mood to be a prick I'll be as vindictive as I possibly can be.  So the other night when Aussie Chipotle and I went out, I ordered him a bottle of La Fin du Monde...which translates into "The end of the world."  And rightfully so!  This shit goes down great, packs a whopping 9%, and gives you the worse fucking hangovers known to man (well, not THAT bad, but still).  Thank goodness the noc-noc is around...great beer selection, the owner has had a fascinating life, and where else can you pretend to be inside a b-2 bomber?!  And to be able to get a huge Australian drunk with a surer-than-i'm-going-to-hell (a.k.a. guaranteed) hangover...what could be better?

aipoRF-bcAF_EJh6ZMwH6A.review_text: Noc Noc is kind of freaky, in a cool way. If Mars were populated and had a capital city, this would be one of its swinging night spots.  I like their beer selection and the staff is nice. What it's missing is the cantina theme from Star Wars.

IPy3uJllYJmFcZwYJ0kujA.review_text: Ah, the Noc Noc.  What a great little hole in the wall establishment this is.  Good beer selection with an ample amount of tasty Belgian's on tap and in the bottle.  Check their website out for details of what exactly is on tap and in the bottle.  Sake and beer as well, but no hard stuff can be found here.  Often the Toronado is just way too crowded and if you don't have the patience to put up with the crap service there, you can usually find a seat at the Noc Noc.  They have a small DJ cave and I have spun records in it.  Really small, but there's a couple dusty technic 1200s and an older mixer.  What else do you need?  The range of music I've heard in here is quite vast, encompassing just about everything.  The quality control on the DJs is minimal as if you are friends with the owner's son, Sampson or drink and talk with him in there, you could get invited to spin there.  The sound in the place is ambient - it is not a place you go to focus on the music, really more to socialize and drink.  The decor is wacky and a bit psychedelic.  A unique place to say the least.  The bar stools are really different - see the pictures to see what I'm talking about.

DTWtZJAIPMrZJwUJV0DJmQ.review_text: Shatangi first discovered the Noc in the late 80's and it has not changed a bit since. Nice place to hang with a few friends. Good beer selection. Rockin furniture.  Shatangi told you

wUtx2M5OpyZvyBYm9Im7HQ.review_text: 'talk about some sweet fuckin ambiance!  this place is a haunted house without annoying rattling chains and people trying to scare you (although the hipsters scare me anyway).  this is a psychedelic scene the likes of which Tim Burton would sit rapt in awe, beer in hand.  you should totally check this place out if you are bored with sports bars & bland ass watering holes-- and the bartenders here are top notch.

vbxvCjVpJcteR9sB0kN6Bw.review_text: This place is eye opening. Great deals on beer, okay music, nice bartenders, very cool place to sit back and relax with friends.

YCQvJY812RXJ_L1zYFJ5rA.review_text: This is one of my favorite dive bars, ever. Even though they don't really serve hard alcohol, and my drink options are limited since I'm not a big fan of beer, I alwas enjoy coming here. Why? Because this place has A LOT of character and attracts some pretty interesting people. Besides wine and beer, they serve sake, and if you smoke, you can smoke in there, too, although I didn't see anyone smoking last time I was there so they may have cracked down on that. They play great music, too, the majority of it being electronic-ish ambient and rock (Squarepusher, Aphex Twin, Radiohead's newer stuff, Bjork).

uRtrQFRnOI33GwQ3PA1dVQ.review_text: This is all you need to know...  -No cover -Great music. -Good prices on drinks. -Great atmosphere. (Its like being in a Tim Burton movie) -Friendly staff. -They accept plastic.  -Pizza conveniently available next door.   Highly recommended for a good time!

j7y_PmbmDA0jNNA1TnhAXA.review_text: Very atmospheric! Nice people and interior. The will bring any food for you from places around.

Fz3y-d7Ru7wMRnPuwG-OLA.review_text: When i was in HS, there was this girl who wore silver spandex 3/4 length shorts as normal pants. Like, with a tshirt tucked in. Her tshirt was incredibly tight, and she had been sent home a few times for encasing an anatomy lesson in synthetic materials. My point? Too much of a seemingly decent thing can be irritating and obnoxious. Noc Noc, this is you. Im all for fucked up visuals and something quirky, but jesus friggin crabcakes, you may as well put up a sign that says "Were a weird bar! No really? Look how weird and zany we are!" This bar screams for attention worse than a blue-haired 13 year old wiith a terrible nu metal CD collection. And if im gonna be in here looking at this 90's era Tim Burton reject set, im gonna need to get drunker than just fucking beer and wine for crissakes. Get some Fernet all up in here. Oh, and DJ HopAroundFromGenretoGenre? Stick to a flavor. Part of being a good DJ is following a groove. Going from trip hop to gabber back to drum and bass just sounds like fucking noise. I did give it an extra star because they have Speakeasy Big Daddy IPA on tap. For that they even get a little tickle behind the ear.

gLke-4oih1t7urvoQAENcQ.review_text: Smurfs, Beetlejuice, and the Flintstones would love this place. Neon lights are the main illumination and there are strange cave paintings everywhere. Seats by the bar are thick and serrated and there's a weird body pinata loomin' over you as wait to get a drink. Place is pretty dim and strange, but I kinda liked it.

aVAAzlIdfXT9LZ4ICIgSBw.review_text: It reminds me of Nightmare Before Christmas in there - I love it!   I have fond memories of making out with a really cute guy there when I first moved here, so it holds a special spot in my heart.   I like the bartenders - they are chill and play good music. Beer selection is great -  la fin du monde? I was totally sold. More bars should have Canadian beer.   It's not somewhere I'd spend the whole night but a good stop on the Haight/Divis bar crawl.

D01KrKs9izEdoT0Eh4i4rQ.review_text: Pros - Great beer selection - The bartender's are usually pretty nice - Cool and weird ambiance - They take credit cards  Cons - No lock on the men's room door

Ml9EY3cA-8np9D9h5v9sqA.review_text: I know it is simply difficult to believe, but I have spent *alot* of quality time in this place. Many hours that would likely be the equivalent of several weeks (oh God, maybe even months) in the space time continuum. My credit card (and the ex's credit card for that matter) has also spent some quality time being used here. Things I love about Nocs: the fabulous bartenders, the crazy crowd, and the oh so fresh Franziskaner and Framboise Lambic. Things I don't love: dodging the local (and loco) crack addicts that come in to use the toilets (watch your purse, ladies) and freezing my ass off in the winter... and the summer, for that matter. Despite that, this little cave holds a special place in my heart.

0ejF-MepAoO7MjvNZg8MGQ.review_text: This Pee Wee's playhouse of a bar is in a neato part of town (toronado is just paces away).  The decor is great if a bit dizzying.  I have noticed a ton of youngster in there (like, high school), but they seem to stay out of the way of us career fuddyduddies.  the beer selection is good.  and, as a fuddyduddy, my misanthropy tends to blind me to friendliness in humankind; but these guys are truly nice.    the seating can be a bit awkward if you're in a group of four or more, but whatevs.  this place is all right.

_p85hjFgp0rbHdKX1JLPLQ.review_text: Why the hell do I keep doing this? Noc Noc does not belong on Yelp. This place is simply under the radar. It doesn't give a shit about one or five stars or anything in between. It doesn't want to be cool or get popular, it already had its heyday 15 years ago. So consider this an anti-Yelp Yelp.   This place is always chill, there is always a table open. People are allowed to bring their dogs and food in - nobody cares. The crowd is always salt of the earth, LH style. The happy hour has $3 drafts. Mythic pizza is next door and you can bring slices in as stated above. It represents Lower Haight to a tee.  The music is the best part. It is seriously eclectic and good. Every single time I go there I hear tracks that bring back memories - the good underground tracks - everything from ambient to experimental to metal and punk. You cannot see the DJ's because they are hidden away in their little pod getting stoned. Don't even think of making a request because they will kill you.  The space, as mentioned before, is one of the most unique spaces in San Francisco for sure, and possibly in the US. It is straight out of Blade Runner meets Aliens meets Mad Max meets the Flintstones on acid. It is dark and dingy and weird and you feel like you are in some underwater world in the post apocalyptic future.   Actually, I take it back; the part about the anti-Yelp Yelp. I just went to their website and they make mention of Yelp so party on..   PS don't go there.

KivTl6k7urUMhPqPj-MDaQ.review_text: What a quaint place!  By "quaint," I mean "Dark, Creepy, I-feel-like-I-dropped-acid."  Serisouly, this place looks like something out of an Alice in Wonderland nightmare.  You have 2 seating options: awkward straight-backed bar chairs or couch cushions on the floor.  Wait, are those stalagmites or stalagtites?  What do you call it when they connect?   They do have sweet bartenders, a nice little beer selection, and were playing a sweet mashup playlist the night I came.  The dutch door is a nice touch, except when they keep it open and let the 40 degree cold blow in.   There are some little nooks perfect for awkward bar making-out, of which some of the patrons had taken full advantage. Not a place worthy of its own trip to Lower Haight, but a unique gem to stop by if you're around.

VHdY6oG2JPVNjihWhOooAQ.review_text: "And now it's time to play. Hip hip hip hip hooray!" - The Fraggles Noc Noc is where Fraggle Rock (en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fr…) would have hung out in their downtime, in between Fraggle Rock sets....if they boozed it up (cause we all know they were smoking up) and weren't in the mood for flaming zambucca shots. Bobby Trendy's macabre-obsessed cousin  could have easily decorated Noc Noc... blindfolded. It's interior looks like someone did a couple of whiffs of something and found some inner Burning Man persona and deco-puked all over the place. And that's not necessarily a bad thing, It's different. Noc Noc gives you something to look at. It's artistic and fun. Borderline "special." Noc Noc takes takes majlis style seating to a new level. Their low cushioned floor seating reminds me of mandatory carpet story time in elementary school; picking at carpet lint, while I listened to the Little Engine that Could. Noc Noc's seating is similar,  intimate and relaxing. Their window alcoves are also fun spots to hang out, and are perfect for ( I stress small) group conversations and people watching. And they have a live DJ. A big plus right there. But athough Noc Noc has its unique charm, it isn't really my kind of bar. It lacks the warm atmosphere that I love about the Page Bar and they don't serve hard alcohol.  They only serve wine, sake, and beer. I've heard their wine and beer are solid, but it seems surreal toasting wine at Noc Noc, and  I have trouble finishing and appreciating beer lately. The last time I finished a bottle or pint of beer...I was watching a new episode of Project Runway. It's been awhile. Additionally Noc Noc does get loud, and if you're perched on the corner of a table, you just get bits and pieces of stories. Friend "Yeah....he..........finger!" Me "what?" Friend "And she....stuffed.....pie!" Me "what?" After playing conversation mad libs for a good half-hour, hanging out with the smokers outside of Noc Noc, becomes a welcome break. Sigh of relief. Ears open. I can understand everything. And it's always nice to get some light, because Noc Noc is dimly lit. Sigh of relief. Eyes open. I can see everything. But... ... even though Noc Noc isn't where I'll take my weekend tolerance, if you're with the right people, and are quick on the claiming of seats, it has the potential to be a cozy and fun pre-gaming spot.

TNy96ZeoTMjj_uaTFXBitQ.review_text: Noc Noc is a gem of the Lower Haight.    Sure, it's been around a while so it's not part of the latest trendy destinations; but that's also a plus.  This means if you're early you can enjoy happy hour with a seat, which is good since it's a small space.    And what a space - like a cross between a post-apocalyptic cave and UFO crash site.  You really have to see it to believe it.  There's also a pretty eclectic set of music playing too - prepare to be surprised by dub, electronica, britpop, jazz or anything in between.  There are always a good selection of tasty beers to be had, along with wine or sake.  Be aware there's no liquor though - it's beer/wine/sake only.    If you're hungry, get a sausage from Rosamunde and bring it in - the staff are fine with that.  Long may this dark and unusual place continue!

aIUyQ1nePT0WE4hAbSukfg.review_text: Good environment with comfy seating. The door was left open most of the time, which made the aisle seats a little too cold to sit on. But in general, a highly recommended place to hang out around that area.

iLjMdZi0Tm7DQxX1C1_2dg.review_text: What an odd, yet cool little little place in the Lower Haight. The interior of this place looks like something out of a Tim Burton movie. Overgrown chairs, funny little nooks and crannies, and bizarre music playing in the background. Makes for a fun little detour when hopping along ho-hum dive bar after ho-hum dive bar.  They only do beer and wine, but I love how they mix it up and do things different than other liquor-less bars (the Squirt and sake concoction, for instance). When life hands you lemons, make some Mike's Hard Lemonade, ya dig?  It's pretty small, so seating is at a premium. Being that the Haight (more upper than lower) is pretty well known for their deep-seeded quirkiness, it's completely expected that a place like this would exist in this neighborhood.

jXZJSNfogoDoCE4531RQFw.review_text: Randomly rolled in here one evening whilst hopping from bar to bar.  Ordered a beer but then decided I needed some sake.  So for like $8 I got an entire bottle that ended up being several shots......or something like that.  It was one of those beer, sangria, sake, whiskey nights.  So after I landed again, I just remember having fun at the Noc Noc.  I'll go back if I can find it.

2pPNxXnyh6EDUuBJVuoQmA.review_text: "Knock knock!"  "Who's there?"  ..... I try to come up with a good punchline, but the beer has gone straight to my brain. My friends and I laugh anyway.  This happens over and over again throughout the night. Silly drunks!   The interior of this place is like stepping into a dream (or perhaps a nightmare). As others have mentioned, it's whimsical and downright mesmerizing. You can't look away from all of the eye-catching details. It feels like being in a cave that an artist has been living out of for a year. Definitely very Tim Burton-esque. Worth a visit just for the aesthetics.   They have incredible Happy Hour prices, so I suggest getting there before 7pm to take advantage of that. They serve lots of tasty beer, by the glass and in larger bottles to share. A few sake options, as well.   Some guy in a Minor Threat t-shirt drunkenly shouted at us to have a great evening. He might have even been cute, but in the blue lighting, in a drunken haze, everyone looked beautiful.

amH97PB5Yk_AZAabksFyWw.review_text: Noc Noc is TOTALLY like fraggle rock...  but with beer.   Anyway, the bartenders are super nice! I ordered a Lagunitas Gnarly Wine and didn't like it, I should have sampled it first... Anyway, the bartenders were generous enough to pour me a different beer that I was more familiar with, no problem. Thanks Noc Noc!

bbs-pWDt6n2zQCWim7QsqQ.review_text: Only tolerable on a weekday when it's got mostly neighborhood people in it.  Avoid weekends when the "destination" drinkers arrive.  Not my favorite beer selection but there are a few choice I like so you'll have to decide for yourself on that.  Super dark, original decor, though some of the seating is a tad uncomfortable.  Don't think about how filthy some of the softer seating probably is. Friendly bartenders, good service.  Music is often a high point in this joint, always a good DJ.

YGfWXlF23VVk5HLKfoKNtA.review_text: Being a resident of the lower haight area, I certainly don't have a shortage of bars to choose from. For some reason, I always end up finding myself at Noc Noc even though I can't say that it's my favorite bar in the neighborhood.  There are some advantages this has over the others though. For one, it's usually the least packed of all the bars so that is always a plus if you are on a date or want to actually sit down when you're drinking. Secondly the staff is usually friendly. It's also dark in here which I like and lastly, the decor is anything but boring. It's like you walked into a Tim Burton movie set.    Now for the bad and reasons why I think this bar could be so much better. The music here is almost always terrible. It's usually some kind of world beat or electronica...If you're into burning man then I guess this would be your kinda place. But it's not even the type of music they play that bothers me as much as it is the VOLUME. The place could be empty but they will always have the music blasting at the highest volume possible. I really dislike this about the bar. I think there is no reason for the music to be that loud. And the creepy DJ area is weird too. You can't see the DJ's and it would almost seem like they should just have a ipod hookup somewhere.   All that being said, I still think it's better than some of the other options in the neighborhood.

wkwQ6iaqK8_tMNA_CXgowg.review_text: If you like cougars and people under 21 with really loud music, go here. For bars, I go elsewhere. I know there are those who go out to have a bad time, so I am glad places like this is a good Tool shed for the community.

X6OFs7eSk2WORoZ4O6GSMA.review_text: Relaxing, fun atmosphere with friendly service and delightfully individual furniture. Not always the most *comfortable* furniture, mind. Fun, quirky interior, and a rare bar with NO televisions.  Good selection of sour belgian beers, and the only place in SF I've seen Hobgoblin on draught.

Ya_jdCMfALaBZBLSWG1fXQ.review_text: Want to hang out in a techno-den of inequity? This is the spot. A good place to begin the rollout of bars throughout the night.

atMtLR9LUc_BtvuW5sRKVg.review_text: Noc Noc rules. From its strange mix of jetsons + flintsones -esque decor, to its wide selection of beers (no hard liquor, sorry), to its light up policy regarding cigarettes, this is one of my favorite bars in SF.

3akJeEsFat0chiv4BCfR5A.review_text: This place is funkay. And it's dark. You could also potentially step on all the people shoved into the nooks and crannies. At least that's what it feels like. Oh, and it's loud so you have to yell. But they have good beers- ones with cool labels that you try to read while squinting and leaning over the bar.   Just as a sidenote, if you sit at the two person table adjacent to the bar there's an airplane window-sized hole in the wall in between. When it's slower, your next beer/money exchange with the bartender could potentially happen through that little window and you never even have to get up! Whuht?!  It's also a good place to take lots of ridiculous thizzface pictures with your friends. I've heard...

iUeZhkI0OK0BisakOkb3pQ.review_text: Not enough right angles, gives me a headache. I mean the furnture is cut on every angle you can imagine. It was interesting the first time I walked in but it's more clever than comfortable.

h_Cn2H6l7U7wtM_WDli8vA.review_text: some of the best times i've ever had in a bar happened here, so i'm a bit biased. that said...  i like that they only serve beer, wine, and sake. no overpriced cosmos == no yuppie douchebags who drink them.  i love the decor. it's been described as "a plane crash in Zaire".  the dj on tuesday evenings, Toddot, always plays good tunes. again, i'm biased (he's a friend of mine), so take my opinion with grains of salt.  the bartenders are friendly.  and if you get the munchies, there are plenty of cheap eats within a short stumble.  the lower haight wouldn't be the same without the Noc-Noc.

i7lEtGBHmUJNXt6pTtjxYg.review_text: For some reason I always end up here in the afternoon.  We're always the only ones in the whole place - probably because there are so many bars to choose from in the area.  They've got great happy hour specials. The decor is .... indescribable.  It's like a cave with random sh*t all over the walls.

wo38nW_JbXC4m_zlaN86wQ.review_text: It has a while since I've been to this bar, but it brings back fond memories of college and biking with my friend thru the park late at night and going down steep hills and arriving into the haight, then riding back from the haight and almost making it thru the park, but falling off my bike hitting my ass on the pavement and laughing.  this place is really awesome.  you walk in and you feel like you are in a cave.  Sometimes they have a dj that plays background music.  one time i was here with my friend and after we had beer, i put my empty beer bottle on my head and started to dance for her.  my friend started laughing and said to me, "do it again! do it again!"  so i did, and the bottle fell and broke into many pieces.  this is when the bartender came over and said sternly, "who broke the bottle?"  my friend told him that she instigated the dance, and he said "bend over i will need to spank you." she bent over and he slapped her ass!  it was absolutely hilarious! we were laughing so hard.  he left, then later came back and said, "i need to spank your ass too.  i don't want you to be left out."     It was such a memorable and fun night

XhaDy7gAnLCtnAsmmh4EfQ.review_text: All I have to say is Instant Favorite. We just moved and  I guess the lower haight falls into the category of places that are walking distance, so we came here after a long day of carrying boxes up two flights of stairs.  Our original destination was Toronado, but it was pretty crowded and I at that moment the idea of having to stand up at a bar seemed like a nightmare. So we went next door to noc noc, ordered some delicious imported beers, and relaxed our tired feet.   The interior is probably one of those things that you will either hate or love. There is plenty of inventive seating, with awesome bar stools, cushions on the floor for the conspicuous, and some other low seating. Overall the music was loud enough not to have to hear other peoples conversations, but quiet enough to be able to hold one of you own. This seems like a good place to come with a small group of friends and just hang out, definitely not the place to go trolling.

sR0I3N5q58Ne5EysyvZkPw.review_text: I've been here twice with a group of at least 4 people and each time we have walked out of the place feeling good (I guess it could've been the alcohol but that's beside the point).  I feel like Jabba the Hut and some characters of Star Wars would make this place just a bit cooler, but of course then the place would be too cramped as it doesn't fit too many people.  This is a perfect place for a pre-funk because of the cheap drinks and eccentric people, music, and atmosphere.

L-GQph-9IrXoKbvGJgz3uw.review_text: you know, noc noc reminds me of a tim burton film. it feels like nightmare before christmas in there. i've had some good times here for sure. surreal times. some good one on one discussions and some rolicking good times with a big group. a good neighborhood bar but not really a place i go regularly. you know what though? they have gluten free beer here. i think it's made with sorghum. i tried it and actually liked it better than regular beer. that's pretty rad.

ygh1FAM5zmfWFeKsV6wJRg.review_text: This is a decent little hole-in-the-wall bar.  The decor is pretty cool--it makes you feel like you're in a Tim Burton movie.    I think you have to make sure you get here at the right time, although I'm not necessarily sure when that "right time" is.  4 friends arrived around 10:20 on a Thursday night, and they didn't have to wait for drinks.  I arrived around 10:35, and was waiting 3,4 minutes for a beer before I got sick of waiting, and decided to come back up after I finished my naan wrap.  (I think they do let you bring outside food in--I saw another group with pizza boxes--so that's pretty cool.)    After the drink line thinned out 15 minutes later, I ordered a snake bite--apple cider & beer--that was pretty decent.  I wasn't completely blown away by this bar or anything, especially having to wait so long for a drink, but it's a fun little place for the thirsty Thursday kick start to your weekend.

B7h5tzLovCvxJQZk8T5w9g.review_text: If there was a nuclear war and we were all forced to live underground then I hope the bars of the future will look like Noc Noc.  Obviously I'm not wishing nuclear war on anyone, especially myself, I'm just intrigued by the idea of living underground and I think Noc Noc makes a decent stab at it.   The light fixtures ooze from the ceiling, walls and partitions are randomly placed, and they have a decent beer selection.  But it's not so creepy that you expect to see Golem or Yoda eating cockroaches in the corner, which is good because no bar should have that kind of creep factor. Added bonus is the fact that Noc Noc is within hurling distance of a pile of other watering holes so that the drink:exertion ratio is kept to a minimum.

yMmWN4BNNCKPvOi7PMKHvg.review_text: Noc Noc is great! The first two thoughts that that came to mind were Encino Man and acid trip. The funky, eclectic decor instantly made me smile and left me wanting more.   They have a ton of seating and great little cut outs to get cozy in. The black lights, the artwork and the funky dance music really make this a fun bar. The night I was there they were playing a Charlie Chaplin film; I love the juxtaposition of the cave-like walls, black lights and old black and white film!  The actual bar itself is small and surrounded by awesomely huge, wooden cut out chairs so you have to do a little maneuvering to get a drink. They have a great selection of beer and wine but heads up, they only serve beer and wine. I wanted to try something new and the bartender that tended to me was a very kind and friendly older man who picked just the right brew for me; I don't remember what sipped on but it was good.   It's in a great location and it's easy to get to which may explain why the crowd had a nice mix and I was able to meet some cool people. I really like Noc Noc and definitely foresee some more good times at this place.

7XvUlAuIRF9IhWAvlr5U7Q.review_text: Came here for a penis and vagina party. Seriously. It was my buddy from work's release party for his Big Coloring Book of Penis's (Penii?).  This was the highly anticipated follow-up to the Big Coloring Book of Vaginas. The bar is totally cool, funky and cave-like.  Go check it out.  Note for the alcoholics, I think it's beer and wine only. Minus 1 star for the stupid tiny bar setup that makes it slow and difficult to get drinks. For those interested, you can buy the coloring book here: amazon.com/Big-Coloring-…

0uGCXyliMAKwcRT-hJe5oA.review_text: Noc Noc is probably my very favorite spot in the Lower Haight.  The decor is refreshingly wacky and "doing its own thing," dark without feeling unwelcoming. There are a number of little sitting areas where you can fit 2-8 people comfortably, some with windows facing the street for good people-watching in the funky neighborhood.  The Tamale Lady stops here regularly, and you may also bring in food from nearby restaurants (Rosamunde and Wing Wings are my favorites).  Noc Noc doesn't usually get too crowded, and it is emminently welcoming of dogs. The bartenders are friendly and the bar accepts credit cards.  On a chilly SF evening, you can get hot sake here, and warm yourself up right quick.  Keep an eye out for the Hobgoblin beer, a tasty draught imported from England, which they get from time to time (though I haven't seen it recently).  I found an Alpine IPA there a couple weeks ago that was delicious, hopefully we will see more Alpines here now that Alpine has been acquired by Green Flash. (San Diego makes better beer than the Bay Area :( )  The only thing I wish for Noc Noc is that they would fix the little TV in the ceiling on the way to the bathroom. When it used to work it was a cool black & white delayed closed-circuit that brightened up the space a bit and added some intrigue.

43LbYHo7O9yhaPD4hRWkrw.review_text: this place is like walking into a scene from beetlejuice or something else equally as bizarre. it's a fantastic place to go, especially because they let people bring their dogs in. and the "no bud, no miller, no coors" thing makes me really happy.   my recommendation: try a p&p - half pear cider, half pyramid hefeweizen

V3p52WztoOGGvPXsfGYypg.review_text: This place is the best place for a cider in the city! The relaxing, comfortable vibe pulls you in. Enough room for any group of people to grab a beer or cider with friends! You can even sit on the floor next to electric fire.

kzkAXy9mJS6gMljzC4xGXw.review_text: Awesome decor, dank ass beers, and dope beats. Nuff said!

4Ev2ab9JLlbaZbwI0jPuRQ.review_text: Great dive bar, awesome beer selection and a totally unique experience. A very funky/hip place, highly recommend.

eO4IGqrqByvaUxBuTl7Hpw.review_text: I love this place. If it's around five o'clock and I'm in the area, I'll drop by for a Newcastle at the Noc Noc - pints are 2.50 from 5-7. I love the look of the place (the time or two I've been there at night it's a bit too dark for its own good, but while they're still daylight to creep in it's fantastic)... It feels like something a bunch of art students would put together, and I mean that in the best way possible. Everything's rough and organic and scrappy, very handmade and recycled looking -- and I do mean everything, from floor to ceiling. And yet I find all the seating and such really very comfortable, and pleasant to interact with.  Music's always been good, service is pretty good, prices are right. I've established a tradition of drinking only Newcastle at the Noc Noc, and vice versa, so the short selection doesn't really mean much to me.  Not the sort of bar I'd make an evening of, but a great late-afternoon prelude to whatever it is you will make an evening of. Also a great place to stop off with some friends and play board games (they have a ton, just ask at the bar).

3qMnJT5k3sSA565d7N4r6A.review_text: Oh Noc Noc, how do I even begin to describe you?  This small-ish bar on Haight is a great place to grab a drink with friends.  Be warned though, it definitely gets a bit loud.  The decorations are quite eclectic (read: borderline creepy :P) but they are fun to look at.  You could come here 100 times and always discover something you hadn't noticed before.  They have a decent amount of seating and a great beer selection so if you are looking for something with a bit more character than Toronado's, come on by!  My favorite memory of Noc Noc is going there during SantaCon and seeing a guy dressed as the robot from LMFAO's music videos dressed as Santa!

qCrAu3LAbj4zkDYVST2efQ.review_text: Who am I kidding with 4*'s - I live here!  Hot sake, chimay, and a cave-like feel. I can't get enough of this spot.

b4M9lkCHWg3FtS1uTMjxiQ.review_text: Thought this place had the most excellent atmosphere- the wonderful Iranian owner informed me it had hardly been touched since the 80s apart from the extension into the store which was bought up next door.  Excellent range of beers, great happy hour deals (lots of sake and beer involved). Top of the list for places I must return to in SF.

Jph_YiKlWPqW9USS2Ih7-A.review_text: Do you have a fave oddball sci-fi movie?  Have you been to the set?  Come here, it's even better!  For a place this size Noc Noc has an astonishing selection of beverages.  This isn't a "full bar" but then cocktails add a layer of pretension to many cool places.  The beers on tap are fantastic and they are amply complimented by a great bottle selection.  There is also sake and soju should you care for something different.  If you're undecided about your delicious drink the bartenders will help you and can introduce you to some new favorites.  It's a great place to chat to a friend, or to invite a group for tasty beers, intriguing ambiance and  a genuine SF bar.

pcQ2xH7oXRJIWLetfBgJPg.review_text: Love this place next to the snobby, unwelcoming Toronado. Looks terrible on the outside, then you get in and it's all cavey and unique and cute with a range of pretty much every beer you might want (especially Belgians). People who frequent this place are also friendly, you can share seating areas and maybe even get into a conversation with you neighbors. Every time I've been here, have had nice, lushy conversations that make me feel closer to the folks I'm with. Don't miss it!

q49KYrts_SI8nekGHB6Ydw.review_text:
Sake, wine and artisanal beers.  Yum Yum.  Sticky stuff on the underside of the table, Yuck Yuck.  Graffitti encouraged in the ladies room - Whoo Hoo!  And it looks like a cave inside....  Lots of dimly lit areas to goof with your friends.  It looks a little scary on the outside, but just go in and have a drink!  It's actually a chill place to go with friends and I will be going back someday.
  And believe it or not, I went to high school with the prior reviewer, Mick F.  Don't NocNoc my effin spandex, man.

XMeRHjiLhA9cv3BsSOazCA.review_text: The Noc Noc is the bar I always bring out-of-towners to, because it's pretty darned unique. Cavernous. Small. You can sit on the floor. Every now and then you can smoke inside.  Plus the last time I went there was a man dressed like Moses drinking beers. Not so cool, but I appreciated his presence. And the owner had set up a FREE Mediterranean buffet. He encouraged us three times to "eat some food!" Very cool.  The thing is I never feel very comfortable here. Maybe it is the incredibly unique interior and darkness. Maybe I just get weirded out too easy. Regardless, I am glad this place exists.  And free food! Man that was a nice touch.

yE1xX4Lhto1E_Beoai7XsA.review_text: The best damned bar modeled after a Ukranian fallout shelter this side of the Greenwich longitude line.

adJKXHJ-5P1IPSdyEq2avA.review_text: Noc Noc has the crazy cozy mind-enveloping ambiance of a coffee shop in Amsterdam, and I'm always just wishing I could smoke a bunch when I find myself here.  It's pretty much all that I can think about.  I mean . . . I guess it's a pretty good spot for getting drunk too, since smoking is not going to happen.  booooooo.

FSObPhGF43f8I1h3cTW6uQ.review_text: The story of Noc Noc...  Late one night in 1986 a small passenger plane filled with the cast of Fragle Rock crashed into a mysterious cave in the Lower Haight neighborhood. In the wake of the disaster, obscure furniture and decor was left behind. The remains were salvaged and later turned into a bar. The result... outstanding.

NoHJb7x8IEakUJTx6_vGTA.review_text: This is my new favorite place to take my friends. The bartenders are so responsive and kind. The people that come here are fun and hip! The place is cozy, but with fun little spots to sit down - you can't go wrong. The place I sat down with my friends was a tight little nook in the main area, was a bit uncomfortable, but made for great memories. :)   I'd go here again - just show up early to get good seats - coming later into the night, forget it, you'll stand or sit outside. :P

DiiyWCoTG_urZBffTsvx-Q.review_text: I'm biased because I used to just live down the street and go here all the time way way back in 1992...yes, I'm aging myself just a bit. So maybe it's the nostalgia talking, but last time I dropped by, my friend Steve was still working there as the DJ and I was welcomed home with a big hug, so that gets five stars right there.     This was always the best bar because you always saw a friend....yeah yeah yeah...I need to get over it! But I can't and I won't.....  I will remember paying $275 a month for a room down the street and meeting Goths in the shadows for a snakebite here and pretending that we were never going to grow old and get real jobs....well, it was fun while it lasted....  Does every single bar in the world have to fit a singular, fascist standard!?? NO...NO...NO!!  Long live Noc Noc!

fLxIRzJYG6eyrAUCIlxegw.review_text: I have nothing against Noc Noc, it's just not my kind of place. With a dead-on Tim Burton theme inside and a bar that specializes in hard ciders, it's was just too... creative (?) for my tastes. A couple next to us at the bar was playing a card game that somewhat resembled Magic cards (remember those?) at the bar! It was called Flexx. The woman explained, "You change the rules and objective to win as you play. It's like computer programming."  Awesome. I'll have an Anchor Steam.

LLqAoLOOZu35wdI1QU9VlA.review_text: noc noc is very dark, and the inside looks like a cross between the bar in star wars and something from beetlejuice, or any tim burton for that matter.  they have a happy hour everyday and pretty good wine.  i love how every seating area/table is different. this bar has a lot of character.  noc noc is my favorite bar on haight street!

mbNdZyY2LdUFf8AXOzRu6A.review_text: If you're looking for a quirky, unique bar this is it! The interior has an intriguing funky vibe and there's a solid beer selection, plus the bartender was very friendly and ready to make recommendations. If you're into sour beers, Noc Noc has a ton of options. If you're up for trying something different this place is great!

MhVvtOGpFbJ1w-fIWB7z7w.review_text: What up Haight Street! Not the tourist friendly upper Haight but the Hipster friendly Lower Haight, word! Noc Noc is a labyrinth/cave of a bar where people drink in the dark and and do bar things. They got good beers and they typically have a a sausage fest going on. I've here several times and I never meet anybody that I want to know in any capacity. It's not a bad place but it's just not my place. If I were troglodyte I would be so down but I am a surface dweller so I prefer a different vibe.

JVS4DQ9of_4bQs_s0XVayQ.review_text: Looks like a cross between a cave and a spaceship on the inside.  Small, usually relaxed atmosphere.  Perfect to take a date out to, or a great place to drink before going out on the town.  Its a great neighborhood bar, with super cool and friendly bartenders.

GEPKTij9uiwm7uRxfz5WzA.review_text: It's been said that Noc Noc looks like what happened when the Flintstones met the Jetsons.  That sounds about right.  This is NOT your typical bar.  Doesn't look like it, doesn't feel like it.  And those ubiquitous domestic lagers are conspicuously absent ("No Bud, No Miller, No PBR" announces the tap list).  Instead, you will find umpteen imported and domestic beers, ales and ciders on tap, and a nice selection in the bottle, including a number of Belgian and Belgian-style ales.  Wine and sake are also available, but no hard liquor.  The furniture, the bar, and just about everything else are works of art and craft created by various folk from the original Japanese fellow who opened the place, to friends and family of the present owner.  Noc Noc is a work in progress.  The vibe here varies depending on the night of the week.  On weekend evenings it can get quite crowded and the crowd is mostly young and hip.  During the week, the regulars dominate, but for the most part, they don't bite.  If you are open to a new adventure, come on in.  Then again, if you are the sort who gets nervous in a place that doesn't resemble anyplace you've been before, maybe you're not ready for Noc Noc.  There is a live DJ every evening (from 9-ish, but the starting time may vary, as does the type of music).  Caveats:  Art as furniture may not be comfortable for people with back problems or other physical limitations.  The place is accessible, but accessible and comfortable are two different things.  Street parking in this neighborhood is extremely challenging (see my reviews of other local businesses for more), but it's well served by the Muni.  DISCLOSURE:  I am not and have never been employed here, nor do I have an interest in the business.  But I am a long-time regular and a neighbor, and over the years I've become friends with the owner and some of the employees.

kckq3f7A9Guh4l1dUpEhvQ.review_text: nice bat cave, or maybe the classic starwars bar...........  funky........  and then, let bavarian suds rule........  decent tap selection, much much more in bottles.........  gotta love the decor.......  enjoy.....

DYyD1OUCZj3Lo4zW-coeZg.review_text: We normally go to the Toronado but we decided to give this place a chance on a Friday night.   I love the Toranodo but Noc Noc has so much more character. And better seating.   We had a group of 10 or so and we were able to move around comfortably and didn't have to wait very long at the bar. Those are my only two requirements for liking a bar so this place wins.

lLvNgtTSDah6XTdziRey6Q.review_text: So, when I was a kid my Mom never liked me eating candy, or watching rated R movies, or staying up late. She cooked "really healthy", which meant I ate twigs and berries.  So one day, my buddy Jeff calls and asks if I could spend the night, I asked my mom if I could have a night off from our little prison camp.  Surprisingly she said "OK".  She took the heavy chains off and instantly felt liberated.  I grab my sleeping bag and tooth brush and hit the mean streets of Poway and walked a few blocks to his house.  His house was awesome, his parents shopped at a place called "Price Club". Which meant they had 500 of every kind of food ever made. And if that ran out, there was more stored in the garage.  Anyway, his parents went to sleep, we stayed up all night long eating Airheads and Sour Skittles, watching all sorts of horror movies, with aliens, blood, guts, you know the good stuff.  We planned on staying up all night, but eventually the sugar high wares off and all those frozen pizzas we ate start making me heavy, as well as my eyelids.  That night I had the worst nightmares I have ever had. Gnarly shit, like aliens, blood, weird fucking places.   A lot of years later I enter Noc Noc, and it all came rushing back to me.  Its like a really bad dream, but fun and they serve beer and wine.

FABFyv4yMCxVDbpzjG3jxg.review_text: I will start of by saying that I absolutely love this place. However, I will be objective in my review, which includes some drawbacks.  The Location: The best location being in the Lower Haight. It is around a lot of other bars and food joints. Also extremely easy to access by pubic transport and car.  The Space: I am in love with the interior design. It's very dark, with an add-shot of new-wave, a dash of punk, and a hipster topping. There's a lot art, the furniture is great--specially the bar stools.   The Ambiance: Good, interesting people. It's the type of place where if you're there, you probably have something in common with the person next to you. All the people are alternative in some way--punk, hipster, goth, mod, nerd you name, it's here.  The Service: Very casual, just how I like it.   The Drinks: This is the part that makes me sad. They only serve wine and beer here. I need my Martini. I'm sorry, but Martinis are a necessity. The drinks are also overpriced.   Overall, this is totally my neighborhood hang-out place.

vhDsTttoL-KVPb6ODvFGXA.review_text: The beer selection is decent. I don't want to say it has a good draft selection, but I don't want to say it's bad either. They have a big selection of bottles, but I prefer draft beer when I go out to bars.  Happy hour is EVERY day from 5-7, which is quite convenient. Everyone loves $3 pints. To be honest, I pretty much only go there during happy hour.  The atmosphere is dark, broody, and themed to be reminiscent of a cave. It's usually empty. This is exactly the kind of atmosphere I LOVE, but it's not for everyone. The music they play is cool, a lot of electronic and metal type stuff. I've heard Nine Inch Nails there before also, so that's a plus for me as well.  In short, stop by for happy hour... great way to "pre-game" while you're already out.

tmxIsLKcNd9qG6nbL6ONbg.review_text: I really like  this area of the Haight and Noc Noc definitely is a fun small bar to bop into. Make sure to bring your black light clothing because you'll fit right into this place. I really like the quirky design and details. The beer menu is small (especially because Toronado is right next door) but nothing on the draft list will disappoint. In fact, they have lots of good offerings that make a stop into Noc Noc well worth it.

nNdmIXK6B85SuZQ1R3O8HA.review_text: Friendly bartenders. Cozy, not too loud at happy hour with good prices. Allows dogs. If you're lucky enough to get the front corner booth, the window opens.  Great alternative to Tornanado.

J52_6MJ_a9v0n2y3qv4zYA.review_text: There's this town in Washington that's feels like a walk-through elevator, swimmingly clean streets and sterile folk - the bricks were built of Borders and Fitch. Digression aside (and do excuse my snide), the town has these speakers attached to each street corner, spewing out the most inanimate elevator music an ear could hear.  Skipping cities and borrowed parts, I couldn't help but think we'd all be happier with an Okkervil River in our Haight. The comatose silly with his head in a knapsack would drift off - needle to vein, dollar in nose - humming idly to the melody of 'For Real'... "And I don't want to hear you say it shouldn't really be this way, because I like this way just fine..."  I walk and wonder, from Fillmore I stray.  A decorated brother whips past, stroking his street kid stereotype. He walks with a heavy leg and shoulders weighted with the memory of a broken home. His wording breaks open the footpath ahead, sneering whites both virile and forlorn, "But if I could tear his throat, and spill his blood between my jaws, and erase his name for good, don't you know that I would? Don't you realize I wouldn't pause, that I would cut him down with my claws if I could have somehow never let that happen? Or I'd call, some black midnight, fuck up his new life where they don't know what he did, tell his brand-new wife and his second kid."   And so we arrive, my lover's and I - happy for our town, it's streets and a quirky stool with showered friends.

bTFZ-cepM91pdS2PFpvJiA.review_text: Very chill atmosphere, my eyes were constantly entertained with the decor and wall art.. and their pear cider was awesome. Nice location of too, because after getting a buzz we walked across the street to grab a light dinner at Memphis Minnies (go ribs!).  It's only a short distance away from the main shops on Haight, so you can park, shop, then head over for some drinks. Check it out!

Rdesw9ekWdVNbvHfLYjQdQ.review_text: You know the video for "Lovesong" by the Cure?  Where Robert Smith, looking an awful lot like Edward Scissorshands, sits in the cave, among the stalagtites and stalagmites, and stares at his fingers while singing the melancholy lyrics?  Noc Noc is pretty much that video in bar form.    Also, great selection of beers.

qPGhjScyxtuHrWXN4A8VXg.review_text: Welcome to this intergalactic chill spot. There's gravity and beer here. Sit, drink, and think to yourself, "Loli has been here."

jvKbyxYrovlUt7UqWMiRCw.review_text: Chill place with a unique vibe and good beer selection for cheap.  I met a couple friends here randomly, and if I lived closer, I would definitely hang out here more often!

WOUK9qfrrSFla0exkNcumg.review_text: Definitely one of my favorite bars in the city.  It's like Tim Burton designed it.  And the DJ booth?  So cool you can barely see the DJ, that's the way it should be (and I'm a DJ).

JFLTI42KbX0mfPnG9rsGtQ.review_text: i kind of dug it.. it was chill and relaxed and a bar and it wasn't really packed inside at all.  sure it was kind of run down and past its prime, but i still think its worth checking out.   the people were there to hang and drink with their friends and weren't really interested in much else.  lots of little nooks and crannies to get lost in (ok not LOTS, but a few) with a boy or girl.   you can get cozy and talk and get to know each other- or just drink and make out.  i thi

tDFXlFFt6c4kYYoD1cGv2g.review_text: My favorite bar in SF. I'm a weirdo. Good drinks (beer, sake), quiet, unpretentious vibe, and pseudo-Gigerian architecture. I feel right at home.

aKvgrGuIreJ7wjUoHpuHlA.review_text: Noc Noc has absolutely no shame about being thoroughly weird and awesome. The interior is straight out of the Flinstones - it seriously reminds me of the cave train ride at the boardwalk in Santa Cruz... I feel like I'm part of the scene with all the cavemen getting drunk. Is that ride even around still? I have yet to come across a bar as unique as this one. In fact, if you know of any, please tell me!  This is a beer only bar, but luckily not a shitty-beer only bar. Every time I've come here I've had a great time! It's perfect if you're looking to go somewhere and just hang out with some old friends who you haven't seen in ages. Always low-key, but totally fun! Definitely the coolest bar in the Lower Haight.

M9PmJw0TBs4cueJp75dvGw.review_text: Noc Noc isn't necessarily the type of place I would frequent regularly, but it's worth visiting at least once.  It's weird, and dark and cave-like and doesn't serve hard alcohol which seems weird for such a weird place.  If you're around before 5pm waiting for one of the many restaurants in the area to open up, head to Noc Noc with your friends for a glass of wine, beer or sake (lush) and prepare to trip your balls out, you stinky hippy.

hKozw4Wo1DAXtBomsqRCxQ.review_text: The decor was already outdated and not cool anymore in 1995 and it smells. The patrons are either 17 (not kidding, I've been in there maybe five times in the last 14 years and every time it's full of high school students) or still upset because they didn't get into that gallery show back in '97.   Yet for no explicable reason, they think they are the cat's meow.

Q8wYuai8yHw6fw5GG9Rgig.review_text: Kooky Spooky Environment.  That is why I come here.   In fact, that environment must be ON PURPOSE to scare off many other polished or sport-barsy-people.   Good Beer (Belgian, some of it in bottles but still.)  Guiness and Hefe on tap.  That is why I come here.   Good electro(sometimes) music (always).   Small bar feeling.  That is why I come here.   (negative side is , not a full liquor license but what can we do)

LnZUtFx6qTWs8NV6lAARxQ.review_text: The place is decorated so strangely that I can't help but bring my out-of-town guests here. The beer selection is great and you can usually find a seat.  (Is it just me, but was this place inspired by the movie Beetlejuice?)

S0yLkzB9QHC3Q4BpfM_iCw.review_text: I dig this place. The first time I went here was for drinks with some friends who were in town. The second time I went here was an hour later after grabbing food and realizing this was our best option to continue drinking. They've got this weird sort of acid-caveman theme thing going on, but it works for them. There's an "alley" in the front by the door that has a bench and seats at the end -- it looks like a weird place to chill but it grew on me. Only downer was a bartender that was trying to do something impressive in front of us and shattered a glass on the floor.

m-q18lAVSe6rKVLCpmebSQ.review_text: Feels like a dirty Tim Burton nightmare in there... It's like some of the chairs might be made of human skin maybe? Is that harsh?  I feel like there's some history about Noc Noc I don't understand. Unfortunately, a lot of my friends like to frequent this place, but I'm not sold. They do have awesomely cheap drinks and sake (I like), and it's always a relief to sit down in a bar in that area that's *not* packed... maybe someday Noc Noc will win me over... someday.

5JuCdFRZ80Kt6D7KsIcPCA.review_text: This place is soooo amazing. It is a great place to go on a date.  So many cool places to sit we kept getting up and moving to try more out (it was a slow night.)   The best part of this place is the amazing decor. My friend pointed out that it's like being in the Flinstones. Every where you look in there you will be surprised with more bizarre stimuli. One of the best parts is this cool little nook where the DJ spins (really cool down-tempo electronic stuff when we were there.)    And, true, its a little surprising that they don't have hard alcohol, but I think it's awesome that they serve sake cocktails. Some very creative forces behind this business.  This place is indescribable. Just go there.

Gh7a3aAOlB2zMRocFzGEZg.review_text: If "Nightmare Before Christmas" and the Johnny Depp version of "Alice in Wonderland" got it on and made a baby, ...and that baby grew up and lived in a fuckin RAD-ass cave in the Haight it would be Noc Noc.  I don't know where I was going with that analogy.  The point is, nothing is ordinary here - from the assymetrical, oddly shaped chairs to the colorful walls with murals of aliens and shit.  At one point I wondered, "Is this what being on acid feels like?" And then I remembered...I was being all ballsy and had ordered the Hop Stoopid IPA because it had the highest alcohol content (9.1%).   Oh. That explains it.  Happy hour gets you $1 off drinks until 7pm, which is fine by me cause drinks were cheap anyway. The downside is they only do beer and wine, but their beer selection (on tap and bottled) is fairly solid.  Noc Noc: You ain't in Kansas anymore, motherf*ckers.

Ky246fmAVSPWw48ZYTvUTQ.review_text: If you want to escape to a land of wonderment and bizzare, hang here...it's completely a Tim Burtonesque kinda place....if you're on a date and don't really want to see what he really looks like, go here, as it's dark, dim and daring

UZllshlr1thOz-mxePmLzQ.review_text: This is the neighborhood living room. Live DJ, beer, wine and sake only. Great, cave like interior--like an amsterdam coffee shop. The graffitti in the bathrooms usually proves to be 1. prophetic 2. a product of wastedness, or 3. Prophetic when you are wasted.

PHPov4VvN3WvNee4Ycs90w.review_text: I am moving away from the lower Haight and I already miss my stumble home bar.  The reviews have been great but notably lack mention of their delicious sake bombs. This bar has always reminded me of the Flintstones if they died and went to that Beetlejuice purgatory.  One night, near closing time, but no time near Halloween, a large group of zombies in tattered clothes staggered in looking for brains.  Zombie 1: "Look at her, she's hot, she's beautiful. If only she were alive!" Zombie 2: "No, no, I like her dead." This is a good place to get drunk for cheap and meet interesting creatures. I also like that it's so dark that you almost can't see.

9nuv3DsQJFjApI3UgHvgxQ.review_text: Great decor!  Everything's all zany and crazy and wild. Plus they let you bring outside food in! And they are able to accommodate big groups like whenever the couch-surfers want to hold their weekly meetings there (couchsurfing.org). But it can get a little tight. I didn't drink anything so therefore I can't give (or take away) a star. Dutch doors!  Love it! Didn't like getting hit on and feeling uncomfortable as a group of guy (who did not come from the bar) followed me to the bus stop.

rUktcQgb1_fnBjwdsbKjHw.review_text: This place is really unique.   They have a great selection of beer on tap and the area is great.   They also serve sake for the more eager late night drunkards.

6y4f5IcaZYtT4_kgk94Y5g.review_text: went here last Saturday,they have a cute set-up.i ordered beer from the older Bartender he charged me $8 for a Beer and Rootbeer, the next time i ordered i ordered from the younger Bartender and guess what he only charged me $7..so i dunno what's up with that i ordered the same thing.but the experience was not that bad.the people we're friendly.will definitely come back here cause they have good beer

HfQPdwaCfrFO1GDPYnPbNw.review_text: I got a few things to say about this place:  Firstly, GREAT alternative to Toronados a few doors down.  There were plenty of places to sit, but more to the point, there are a bunch of nooks and crannies to sit in, kinda making this a nice and private place to bring a date to.  I knew this place stood for qualify looking at the imported beers in the refrigerator then glanced over a the printed menu to the right to see the words "No Bud, No Coors, No PBR" printed across the top, love it!  The patrons of Noc Noc appeared to be more mellow and interesting than those at Tornados; they came to have a drink or few and have a conversation.  Thought the music was a taaad too loud, but a forgivable offence since it they were at least good tunes.  The decor has clearly taken someone or a team of people years to work on.   Given the choice between going to Toronados or Noc Noc to meet some new friends, there is no choice really, of course I'd go to Noc Noc to see who's there.
