vn8nPLA7J_GkHEiW5vEmbA.review_text: You know what time it is!  It's the beginning of June 2011 and that can mean only ONE THING!  Bar Study time!  Yes, while I try to push 15 topics of substantive law into the cheese grater of my mind, the earth whirls happily around me.  Twirl twirl twirl.  It's not enough that I've said goodbye to simple pleasures, but I've also left my sanity on the bus somewhere.  It's not at the lost and found.  It's not coming back until after it's over.    Marina rescued me for a little downtime between godsmack multiple choice practice tests.  There ain't nothing so bad that a fried corn dog can't fix.  Thus we got our carnival treats at Metro Caffe, but where to eat that would permit us to sit down and have a beer?  Well, we would both sit and eat but only Marina would have the beer.  I have to keep studying.    After being intimidated by the dark, grubby, loud interior of Toranado, turned away by Mad Dog in the Fog, we sough shelter in Noc Noc's nooks and crannies.  We were able to sit, talk about hairy men, and eat corn dogs in a suggestive fashion.  Dim lights, freaky patrons, uneven wall murals and the like.  It was surprisingly calming on the nerves which have been crawling with bar prep insecurity.  The environment meshed perfectly with the Twilight Zone of my mind.    I hate bar study.

e7SBIPdqMEvfADDIcdYwYg.review_text: this was my first under aged bar experience. my bro and sis brought me there after hitting up some indian at naan and chutney. its pretty creepy inside, like everything is distorted, dark, smokey, and cavelike, and the bathroom is riddled with writing all over, pretty claustrophobic. kinda weirded me out, but now that i think of it its was pretty tight

pCCNrvJiX3qJm6ZSLDk2FQ.review_text:
I've got a friend that really likes this place. Me, I'm not crazy about it or anything, but I can't help but admire the decor. The interior is cave-like, with molded walls, crazy paint, and absurd furniture. It gives off a haunted-house vibe.
  They've got a surprisingly good beer selection for a place that I'd think would be complacent to thrive on the novelty of their interior. I also have found the clientele to be surprisingly diverse and the space uncrowded, even on weekends The ample furniture and the music at a decent volume makes this place decent for conversation too.

VP5If_-BFG2-bpJY4aLygQ.review_text: This place is for sure from another world... i love the beer selection The bartender Samson is a real nice guy and he can recommend some great brews.   oh and they dont have booze but they do have saki!

UeJwKSwqsKyeGLgRWAwjYg.review_text: The tatooed sat. night female bartender was the most onboxious person I have ever met in my life. Not only was she a monster but she gave away tons of free drinks to her friends. She needs psychological counseling and a different profession.

A1VBtSUa50rM1OVNdQrBFg.review_text: I have fond memories of the Noc Noc...it was one of  my favorite neighborhood haunts.  The interior looks like a cavern with stalactites, stalagmites and cave paintings all over the walls. Just find a nook with your lovely friend(s) and chug some cider beers.

oDhqiFEuVsq2a2IBd1HkdA.review_text: A fun place to hang out and drink beer.   It's sort of like hanging out in the bat cave.  They had beetlejuice playing on a projector and some great music.  It's sort of like hanging out in the bat cave.   There's a good sandwich place a few doors down, and another fun bar which is called Tornado. I like the bartenders, too!

0i1z0_K9_2PMWIISzgg-fw.review_text: feels like a bar that a band of cavemen took over  highlight: if you dont like beer (i know i know i'm not human) try the P&P - pyramid & pear cider! yum

u4df9jjhSsjnrz1wEqFjJg.review_text: This place made me feel like a trippy Flinstone. It's basically a cave with cool tribal art and glow paint. The beer here was pretty diverse and I got a really great cidar/ale mix. I think this bar is perfect for people walking around Haight just trying to get a feel for the neighborhood. It's definitely local, but the bartender was friendly and customer focused. It's the kind of place you don't mind wasting a night in. Not too fancy, really unique, and full of people ready to just chill and have a good drink.

6QN6BdpcDKXNS9Xq_7pECQ.review_text: last time i was here they allowed smoking...well not anymore.  this is actually my favorite non full service bar in the lower waste, cheap happy hour drafts and a good selection of imported booze.  kinda feel sorry for the bartender though when it's slow. :(

u1EF-dXyYkNJNZ4D3j_hzg.review_text: The thing I like best about Non Noc is their refusal to stock cheap beer. No Budweiser or Miller can be found. They have a great selection of beers on tap, even some ciders for the wife. Just do not expect any hard alcohol. For that they only have sake.   The best part is the happy hour, only 3 dollars for a beer. Happy hour happens every day.  The decor is a little odd but it has been that way for years. Lots of metal and sharp angles. The chairs at the bar do make you sit straight up!  I know that this is not this type of bar, but one TV would be nice to watch some football on Sunday.

ermgOO9meehk-dfG0Fsfhw.review_text: i have no idea how to describe this kind of place.  I went here pretty messed up last night and thought i was either really drunk or dreaming. It's the kinda place you walk in and think that peter pan will pop out and give you a hug, but after awhile it's kinda fun just sitting there chillin and drinkin.

eK5u7FePpvTTQpK5vijZcw.review_text: This couldn't be more "Tim Burton" than if he designed it himself.  A wonderful, unique beer & wine bar with intimate seating and a hidden DJ booth. My first experience in the Lower Haight and it was perfect. You walk into a different world when you enter the Noc and it is a fantastical place.

bG6DkJKwhKMMQ0Z3GSOpmA.review_text: One day many years ago, somebody took a few too many psychadelics & went a little crazy on a bid for a replica of the set from 'Beatlejuice'.  Noc Noc was the result.  It's every bit as unnecessary as 40 subscriptions to Vibe, but way more fun.  You will have a good time at Noc Noc. It's mandatory. But be warned, this is a covert smoker's hangout.

0Tv2dl2O0TEQD-VGbPqwug.review_text: We stopped in here after having a burger at Nicky's. When you enter yes, it feels like you are inside a cave and I felt like I stepped into a Flintstones episode. The vibe was relaxed. It was a lounge and the menu offered some interesting beer selections. My friend chose a sour beer, and I chose an Uncle Pat that is a cider with Guinness on top. Never tried that combo but it was surprisingly good. The music isn't loud enough to drown out your voice. So, if you're looking for a change of pace away from televisions, go here.

2MPTbMgbVCwUClgCKP75MA.review_text: Fun bar to visit in lower Haight with an amazing beer selection. Came here after bar hopping around lower Haight and was pleasantly surprised. The bar itself looks like the inside of a cave which was a change. Decent amount of seating and space socializing, did not look like a bar that any dancing or craziness is going on at. Prices were fair as well, my friends and I have been wanting to try the sculpin grapefruit from ballast point brewery and have not been able to find it anywhere, this place had it which automatically gave it a + in my books. No liquor here which would be a nice addition, overall fun bar to chill at and enjoy a good beer.

RqUJo6tjD8m4JEuZ37VN5g.review_text: probably my favorite dive in the city.  totally weird and awesome ambience:  it's like walking into a cave with blacklights.  the music is great (mostly ambient/electronica), and they don't care if you smoke....  it has a great beer selection (although being a couple doors down from toronado tempers that high point somewhat).

9AcsYItNpO1p7pSXPl1RUg.review_text: Nice! I was there last night with a friend. Been there before, back when I lived in the hood. It's small, not much room to sit, but still artsy in that hipster way. My belgian beer with 10% alcohol "Paate" something was $7. A bevy of young girls came in, none of them had ID, the guy working turned them away, and I was so happy to not be that young anymore... and thanks to the week-old stubble/beard. Now all I need is to look rich.

HCE8jqNwwycYsAus48mkzw.review_text: Honestly, I can't remember when I was here. I think it was sometime around spring break of this past year, just back from the effing frigid temperatures and Obama-mania of D.C.  And honestly, I looked the place up on yelp. After BARTing in from the East Bay and determining what Muni we'd have to catch to get back and not get stranded in SF, we dragged our asses into Noc Noc.   I loved it. It looked like some sci fi bar with serious Blade Runner or Mad Max vibes. I kept expecting David Bowie to pop out from one of the dark cave corners and thrust his lycra-clad crotch in my direction while singing "dance magic dance." And to me, this is always an excellent vibe to get from a bar.  My friend and I sat on the ground, drank what I remember was some pretty decent beer, and watched (from what i remember, once again) fish swim by on a giant screen.  I figure I had a great time because both my friend and I blacked out and have no clue how we got back to BART. I may have very well paid a homeless man to piggyback me the whole way, as far as I'm concerned. Regardless of missing hours of my life, the hours I do remember from Noc Noc I enjoyed, even if Bowie never did serenade me or buy me a beer.

zUGNL2kbzomjtB9YMzpY6g.review_text: I spent several years of my life in this cavern sucking down chimays and smoking camels. Wait, that's grad school I'm thinking of. In any case, if you find yourself in the lower haight and would like to step into a post modern art nightmare complete with a bomb hanging in the middle of the room with a gas mask on its nose then Noc Noc is up your alley.   This is the kind of bar that takes all kinds. Seriously, all kinds, from practicing magicians, to dog lovers who bring their four legged friends along, to aliens with antennae that stick up off their heads, and yes aspiring writers and grad students. The menu is filled with good beer and sake. They don't serve the harder stuff, just beer, wine and sake. I'd say get here early, park yourself in that great cubby hole where the neon sign for the bar hangs and then stay a while, a long while because in a single night I've heard William Cargo, The Incredible Bongo Band and Carl Orf come floating out the speakers. The bar's music is as eclectic as the scenery on the walls, lights and friendly staff.

c8qFkI_VusWo0xZvkjfBWQ.review_text: It's like the Netherworld from the movie Betelgeuse inside the Noc Noc, with plenty of tasty beers and pot smoke to add to the ambiance.

-1NnB0KNSHNmru-BHPOy1Q.review_text: Single-handedly makes up for every other spot in the city  that has been labeled "devoid of character."    Better suited for a small group meeting and discussion than late-night carousing.  If you are claustrophobic, or turned off by the movies of Tim Burton, keep walking.

0pb7fWD194iTqPMFAG5Oxg.review_text: There's not much more that needs to be said about Noc Noc than has already been written. It's trippy in a cool way, the drinks are good and the people are generally pretty cool. It's worth a visit.

DfWF5fnzufqzP9smf4oaHA.review_text: This place is like an acid trip without taking any drugs. So that in and of it self is pretty awesome. The beer selection was small but pretty awesome. I loved the decor and crazy chairs that you can sit in. The dark low lit and fluorescent lighting going on gave it a weird club vibe without the obnoxious club tendencies. A nice change of atmosphere from the other bars in the Haight area.

lqfCumXC24HofGKkgn1Uiw.review_text: I would have to parrot Alex M's review.  It does seem like a bat cave.  The decor is definitely unique and they have these chairs with a funky high back to them that looked it was taken off the set of the TV old show, "The Adams Family."  The lighting is dim.  Not too dim, but it makes it a bit more of an intimate setting.  Good place to kick up some good dialogue with friends or a date.  The peeps in their last night were all low key.  I would say it draws a bit of an eclectic crowd.    I think the prices of the beer were usual for the area, although these really cool people from Spain bought my beer so I wouldn't know on the Guinness comparison.

3zyBvSsgLEWYsPpnFIxV2g.review_text: Noc. Noc.  Enter. Mr. Downtown Brown Mr. Boont  Mr. Chimay  Mr. Racer 5 IPA  Mr. Anchor Steam and Miss Anchor Liberty Ale  Miss Sierra Nevada Pale Ale  Miss Pyramid Hefeweizen Mr. Fat Tire  Prince Newcastle Brown Ale  Captain Full Sail Amber  Senior El Toro Poppy Jasper Hippie Humboldt Hemp Ale  Pimp Speakeasy Big Daddy IPA   DJ Hours of Vibing Tracks Princess Pillow seats and Duke Decor   Do Not Enter, Wrong Way Mr. Bud Ms. Miller Mr. Coors  Miss Hard Alcohol

DpiMuxg2g4urzClzjykUHg.review_text: It's weird, paint job wise. I felt at home here. I like it.   Beer and wine only are served here.

u3xVUab_KTM_ddu7ifeJhw.review_text: good beer selection, especially the more rare varieties.  the decor is funny, odd almost, but comfortable.

RYVt_pJpPvnEZos6mHnHrw.review_text: I love dive bars, but this place is gross.  It is dark, dirty, and full of skinny junkies.  How old is the half-baked decor?  Will some one please clean this place, it is the worst bar in the city.  It blows my mind that people actually go here.

wEqETrWwpsujK2r8ZueOFw.review_text: Its what I always imagined what a bar would look like in San Francisco - some sort of hybrid arrangement of Tim Burton, Salvador Dali,  and Antoni Gaudi fueled on mushrooms, acid, and red bull. It has such an intriguing and beautiful interior - I just wish it was a bit bigger with a bit more cubbyholes where small groups of people could hide in.

C0el0SuXLmzMzlPbUdSozg.review_text: good cheap, clean, divey bar to get a drink and hang out.  Good location, drinks were good - what else can you ask for?

l3HfLnoT5j9WLHe461MAwA.review_text: Giving it five stars for the decor and the nice bartender who told me they don't served mixed drinks, only beers, and Suggested across the street to a different place to get cocktails.  Thank you.  Will come back when in the mood for beer.  You are awesome.

duymKKwUruH8GwbvcaFd0w.review_text: Not sure why I never reviewed this place.  This was like the second bar I went to when I moved here in 1997 after the Elbo Room and Cassanova. Er, I guess that makes it the third.    Anyhow, my favorite things about Noc Noc are that it's got all these crazy nooks that you can chill in.  Some on the floor, some with seating and it's like a little cave/crashed airplane vibe inside.  They don't have a huge selection of alcoholic options, but what they do have is pretty good.  A great place for a clandestine rendevous!

qPCUIYg0GzZAXPTGAr8iRA.review_text: As usual we were doing our bar hoping and decided that Noc2 will be our final stop.. Fun place.. looked like we stepped into Flintstones bar with caveman kinda drawings, florescent lights and awesome drinks.  Loved the apple cider.. neat..The place was happening on a Friday night and people kept pouring in unlike at other bars.. Must check-out if you are in the neighborhood.

24fUv2wNa-4ycL4ib_dS_g.review_text: There is a very nice beer selection and a very nice atmosphere. It is kinda dark and weird but in a good way.

38zhUVIh6t_-mpcmbWYmiw.review_text: Always a scene, rarely a good time. Has kept the same Tim Burton decor scheme for so long that it's starting to get creepy. Had it's glory days like 15 years ago.

OTcKsnEQ1Fm0EJ5YsSSgZw.review_text: What's not to love?  1.  Fab. staff and weird, but oddly comforting, decor  2.  $3 pint of beer during happy hour-- this is enough to make me seriously consider making alcohol another food group-- but I'm holding myself back.  3.  Nice mix of people after work.  Not too loud, so you can still talk, and not too crowded.  Even late night on the weekends this place has a pretty eclectic mix of people (although definitely skews younger).

jZaW5XEiEuZo_JhpxMBDSQ.review_text: Cool spot, I went in here because the reviews were good and someone said it looked like a Tim Burton Movie... Well I disagree with that guy. It is definitively Kitchy, like a lot of bars you would see in the beach regions of Thailand.  Happy hour was awesome with my $3 pint of Trumer pils, my fiance wanted a cocktail and we realized that it was just beer and wine after we were someone committed.  All in all it was cool, definitely divey, and trying to do a lot with a little.

bM1vovFIegj7naEzhIRIDg.review_text: This place is very cool, indeed. It's like drinking in a weird Tim Burton movie.  The drinks are affordable, the staff is very nice, and the music is usually really good. They have DJ's in this tiny little booth thing you can peak into, and they mostly play various types of electronic music. They take cards, too.  The only caveat is that they don't sell liquor. Only beer, wine, and sake.

0KACxE-2K4msX7Juw8TEqQ.review_text: Place is a crazy ass Space ship, I feel like I'll have to learn Klingon from just stepping in.  Don't be fooled or scared, this place is really fun, with lots of tables and good beer selection.  A great place to listen to some dub-step, synth pop music and have a drink with friends on a table that looks like the motherboard on star trek

KS-iygmyLw66hGi5sWMpzg.review_text: Walking into this place is like stepping into someone's peyote hallucination. For a minute I thought I was going to start seeing the shapes on the wall morph, a-la "Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas". It makes for a great conversation starter once you sit down with friends over beers.   A couple of friends of mine and I stopped in during the day and, lo and behold, they have a pretty solid happy hour. Anchor Steam pints, among others, were $3 until 7PM - perfect for Sundays.   Add to this the fact that they're a dog-friendly establishment and you've got a great hole-in-the-wall spot in the Lower Haight...certainly a memorable one, for sure.

pobp48oJjL6Em6vge3QUQg.review_text: TL:DR; Comfortable place. You can talk to people and actually hear them talk back! DogfishHead 120 Minute on tap.  AMBIANCE Cool, dark, but not too dark. Comfortable, and it's easy to find your own little nook. So it can be quite intimate.  The stools at the bar are a bit of a pain in the ass though, They don't move, so you have to squeeze in to sit in them.  It isn't too packed, because I think most people are going to Toronado, which is fine, because I think you'll find more locals here at Noc Noc  THE BEER Definitely not as many beers as the bar next door, but they do have quality. Dogfishhead 120 minute for $5 for a 6oz pour. It's a sour beer, but it's also 18% and awesome.   BARTENDERS Seem to be pretty nice, it's a relatively small bar, but it was easy to order the beers, and I think I saw one of the bartenders actually providing assistance to a young lady asking about which beer was right for her. And that's on a Friday night!   VALUE If you drink craft beers, you know the score. Beers range from $4-$10 or so. All depends on what you want. For me, this is the local haunt I'm happy to invest my money in.

S7h_qimW59DmxtN-MXujsQ.review_text: The selection of beer is good, and they've got some of those nice cider/beer mashups people enjoy too.  The place looks like the Flinstones meets Tim Burton inside which is also a nice little mood stimulator.  Being neighbor to the Toronado means that should you ever prefer a little more quiet with your beer or wine the Noc Noc is the place for you.

DpwIBe02eLTuRKjNH7gLFg.review_text:
3.5
  One day I'm going to go here dressed like Mad Max to go along with the post-apocalyptic decor.  I like this place during the week.  Relaxed atmosphere and good tunes.  However, I can't stand this place on the weekends.  Horrible techno dj's (mind you, I love electronic music) and not so great of a crowd.

g-wssBxG2znpJVKZE2N-lA.review_text: We tried to go to Toronado, but it was packed so we walked over to this place where there was plenty of seating.  I really enjoyed this place; the decor is fun, they have a good beer selection and the bartender was very friendly. I'd really like to visit again!

g6-iRRJZCunTiyIWnyt-6Q.review_text: I think I just walked into Tim Burton's mind and ordered two of the most delicious beers I've ever had. This space is so cool, hammered copper tables, slightly above ankle height, green and red lighting,  and orange and black stripes painted on support beams.. and friendly service to boot. LOVE IT!

Ll_jDY55b3U8QdGu4As-2A.review_text: I went on a first date here, and it was great for that. They have a decent selection of good beers, creative spaces to get cozy in, and a unique interior. The bartendress was friendly. It was a little awkward maneuvering around the Alice In Wonderland chairs to get up to the bar and order though.

1y2dLZg2l3dtLc1nzU2qzg.review_text: Whimsical is probably the word most associated with Noc Noc, and it fits. This place is like Fraggle Rock meets Wonderland meets Caveman chic, then dabbled with a bit of acid. Weirdly shaped seats, colorful lights, bizarre murals, little nooks that feel like private fake Disneyland forests... it's all here at this extremely strange and unique spot.   Oh yeah, this place is a bar... their beer selection is pretty great as well. Maybe not as deep as Toronado's, but there are plenty of good selections, with many local pints available for just $3 during happy hour... and they're adamant about the fact that they don't carry Bud, PBR, or Coors. Because life's too short to drink the weak stuff.

L4uvL5rsvJAKD1uSCRksWg.review_text: Great little bar, cool music, and very tasty pear cider.  We came here specifically for the ambiance, hoping for a dark-horse place to celebrate my 21st instead of some sweaty club. I loved being surrounded by the looming cave paintings and cool furniture- reminded me a bit more of Jim Henson's "Mirrormask" than of Tim Burton, but I see the comparison. However, I must warn the true crazies out there that if you're going to travel more than an hour just for an experience in creepy decor, you might not be AS blown away as you think. It was much smaller than I had imagined based on their website pictures, and maybe my threshold for weird is just too darn high. I think I hyped it up too much in my mind.  All the same, nice attentive bartenders and a room that is a work of art. I'll be back!

eu19K9KfnvvubzWuv4l6Wg.review_text: Black velvet and that little boy smile Black velvet with that slow southern style A new religion that'll bring you to your knees Black velvet if you please.  ...If you please If you please  That's what i say to the bartenders whenever i go to order my drink at the Noc Noc.  OK...not really, but a Black Velvet is my beer/beers of choice.  They have a great selection of beers you pour with a spoon, like Snake Bites, Black and Tans, and Black Velvets.  Multiple flavored ciders also help make me a happy girl.  Lesson for those less knowledgeable than I:  Black Velvet = Stout and cider (i guess its supposed to be champagne, but nowadays cider is the common replacement.) Black and Tan= Stout or porter and pale ale Snakebite = Lager and cider, and  according to wikipedia... this is properly referred to as a Poor Man's Black Velvet.

CdBjwxAy25Rs_Am_ckwm2g.review_text: A cool, funky place.  Great vibe.  Bartenders are passionate about beer.  Lots of little nooks and crannies to sit and chat.

4ZaqBJqt7laPPs8xfWvr6A.review_text: A fun, laid-back bar in true Haight fashion.   Where can you find a lady wearing face paint and fairy looking headbands and drink a beer next to a small dog? - Yep, you guessed it. You can do that here.   Not too crowded on a Saturday night & plenty of seating. Best part? They let you bring in pizza from next door. Yum!

oxl--iAcvMX2RWSqGZXcfQ.review_text: Love this place. It's been on my 'must check out' list for awhile now and I stumbled in with a friend late Saturday night. It wasn't packed when we got there (midnight-ish), but all of a sudden all these people piled in near last call. Great selection of beers (on tap AND fun bottles) and super friendly bartender and owner. Chatted with someone at the bar and he said that it's usually packed on the weekends, but it's a great weeknight neighborhood bar. If only it was my neighborhood :(  The decor is dark and kinda random and I love it. Reminds me a little of one of my favorite places in DC - The Big Hunt...I think I have a thing for dark and cavernous watering holes...

9CtpTM4fWaTbeMBsUIrptA.review_text: This place is a trip. I feel like I'm in a cave somewhere in another galaxy when I'm in here. There are black lights, dark corners, and cushions on the ground a la an opium den. The music is always pretty good, happy hour is your typical dollar-off 3-7pm deal. Never too crowded. Everyone is laid-back and the bartender is cool with you bringing in food.

CF2r1hlXLQifyDwpWFJ7rg.review_text: I like this bar. No liquor is why I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5, but when I sit in this bar I'm reminded of Beetlejuice and it never seems to be that crowded. Although, I usually avoid all cool places on friday and saturday night so maybe that isn't so valid. Good beer, music, and pretty funny decor.

9OyPEDQ0N6i0rWv9S-XjgQ.review_text: I just had to share this little tidbit :   Came here last night for a couple beers. As usual it was a pretty chill night - music playing in the background, a decent number of people there, but definitely not crowded or rowdy. We were sitting at the high half-table on the side when my date says "Umm so there's a lady dancing on the bar...". I turn around, and sure enough, there's a shirtless woman (bra still on, don't get TOO excited), doing a "sexy" dance for the guy(s) sitting at the bar. It only lasted about 3-5 minutes, but it was definitely a sight to be seen. I sure have been known to do some pole/bar dancing myself, but I uuuuussually save that for clubs.   I have to applaud the bartender for allowing her to stay up there. It made Noc Nocs even more endearing to me.  FYI we drank: $4 Hefeweizen and $5 Rodenbach Pilsner.

s3D3oghMaX10JpvpAQIHig.review_text: The little part of me that's still 15 really liked this place a lot.    However, the bigger part of me that has other tastes in drinking places was kind of ambivalent.  The music was so-so fun when I was there and the people in there weren't all the interesting to me either.  The kind of place I'm really glad exists, but I don't know how often I'd drink here- a good place to see once though.

A2mx9xsHoIDNnd81_lxiFA.review_text: This a cool place to have some beers with friends. Worth a visit if you're in the area.

6VPfQlQl0YINLmFkfzh0HA.review_text: One of my favorite bars of all times.  Sake, wine and beer only.  The atmosphere is tripping, egyptian writings on the wall.  Music very ambient.  Allow you to smoke cig, 420 in there also.

vTugBdYg34rX4KvGpzBrNA.review_text: Love their gluten-free beer! Super tasty and rad that they have one! :)

pYnOLcg4-cgQjSLUiaSg4Q.review_text: Came here on the art walk and what a great place.   Being already buzzed, coming here was like walking in a deranged "Alice in Wonderland" type of place. I LOVED IT. Super chill and fun to come hang with friends. All the bartenders were super nice too even though they were super busy!   Props guys! Only bad thing is it was unbearably loud :/

ImVfDOri1NG5UE5MEmqHJg.review_text: 9 years ago, when I was a cancer patient, me and a fellow patient couldn't find where our Qi Gong chinese healing class was one week, so we blew it off and ended up drinking sake all night at this place till we were soaked silly.  If Yelp existed I woulda five-starred it ez.  Having not seen my ole friend for a long time, we decided to hit Noc Noc's for old time's sake. Hadn't changed a bit of its fuzzy little navel. Still just beer, wine and sake. Great sound system and DJ (we were treated to a night of brit pop). Well populated with locals, not just lower haight hipsters but a good mix.  We got soaked again, but kept enough of our faculties together to stagger out with good memories. Same time. next decade.

Ybr4mtjJyjAFt9wbAHwEVw.review_text: This establishment has to be designed by Fred Flinstone himself. It's dark , it's dreamy. Prevous reviews debate if this place qualifies as a 'dive bar', i say not. It commands its own label - this is a dino bar, that has a killer selection of beer, especially begian, READ - STRONG. Also they have this organic beer, i kid you not. No hard liquor, but you can just go across the street for that. And on thursdays - this place has cool music, electronic and shoegaze, and garage stuff, lots of nooks and crannies to hide out in fro privacy.

uJoICA4r7bZ_35VoVPdhtg.review_text: Noc Noc. Who's there? Oh, that's me, in the funkiest, super trippy bar is SF. I felt like I was Alice in Wonderland. Small venue, dim lighting, and you can sit on the floor seating and look around at the decor. They have a small fish tank behind the very friendly bartender.

pQMbjcDfr7A1aKtU_ls00w.review_text: I heard the owner was on acid the whole time he was decorating the place...  ...I mean that in a good way.

X4KP6ZK0ST-jF46KpAhxzg.review_text: Island tribal meets Lower haight.  Highbacked driftwood barstools and dark, spotlit cocktail tables greet you at this bar.

Ud6j2HN40qEhycq2PuwcBA.review_text: Very interesting/bizarre bar. Alternative, hippie, different, fun all blended into one space. Good selection of import beers. Our Belgian friend and his gf brought us here one night since he knew Noc Noc had his favorite selections....had a nice time until his gf had quite a few to drink and decided to get "hot and heavy" on him by landing him huge kisses all over his face and mouth, hence we decided it was time to go.....Guess she couldn't "wait" to land him the big one! :) Woohoo....

2BACEPsx5rLBHw3kYVUCuQ.review_text: This place reminds me of the bizarre theme park right outside of the Grand Canyon called Bedrock City.  Or maybe it's like being at a post 80's cyber punk Disneyland.   The interior is truly the marvel of this place. There's so much to look at.   Beer selection was pleasant, and well balanced. Something for everyone.   I wish this place had photo albums of its events from over the years. It seems like a real staple of the street, that evolves with its clientele.

t1NmJ-g09NijXqycgF-evA.review_text: I don't know what the hell is going on in here but it's f*cking awesome. It was literally like drinking inside a cave or inside an animal. Also, they serve drink combinations like cider with guinness - two of my favorite types of alcohol. The people that come here are friendly and open to random conversation. I would love to see it in the daylight. A+

z8Ui6GaeQgzxQJVVpKwC-w.review_text: This used to be my living room.    I mean, technically, I lived across the street, but this is where I'd come to eat dinner (ooh, Love'n'Haight, your fake meat is so good!), have my usual Red Chimay for dessert, and teach a few fools the fine art of backgammon.    The chairs are ridiculously uncomfortable, but the hippy-space-lounge atmosphere speaks to my soul and friendly neighborhood folks come out in force.  I head back here every few months to run into old faces, and it's always a blast.  Oh, and in addition to the regular beer, wine and hot sake, they've got a good selection of fancy bottled beers.  You pay what they're worth, and they're worth every penny.

pGY8eJMh5m4MjHDfZ5aoKQ.review_text: f you've been here, you know what I mean.  When I walked into this place, I thought for a second I had cracked my back and released some of the latent LSD living in my spinal cord. .....

7OfrRi-xGESQsBpJFrlfLA.review_text: really dark with a sort of "nightmare before christmas" tim burton vibe.  and they have benches with these wee little tables that made me feel like a giant, rawr!!  from what I remember they only serve beer, wine, and sake.

gzlQAs7UApVvh_XexTT-SQ.review_text: I feel like I fell into a movie set from the Flintstones!! But more psychedelic.  This was our first stop on a a friend's birthday bar crawl. They had a great selection of beer (meh, not a huge beer drinker) and EXCELLENT pear cider that I was able to enjoy (and only $5). It was a great little place to start off with, but as more and more of our group trickled in, it got harder and harder to fit us into the small hallway of a booth next to the window.  I'd come back with a smaller group just to grab another pear cider.

QKbq76KuUHLRZjWXDtbwWQ.review_text: I love this place...  It's great to go with a group of friends for the hot sake shots...  Trust me, you won't need anything else to drink.  Although, if you plan on hanging out there all night, it would probably behoove you to get there a bit early since it's a small place and fills up fast.

0tUcFr3FJDtfRA0uyytKpA.review_text: Ok I must admit I am really surprised by the 4/4 review. The owner of this bar is one of the nicest and most open people I know and I have been coming to this bar off and on for years.  yes there is no hard alcohol but it is a good beer selection and i totally disagree the prices are outrageous. there is a 2.50 happy hour for chrissakes and the prices are only higher for imports and inline with everywhere else. as for the person who was a "regular" who was homophobic i can't think of any of the regulars who would be and believe me I don't stand for that nonesense.

1JCtBPZMwwmycImhwWNShQ.review_text: The NocNoc is hands down my favorite bar in California. A friend and I were roadtripping across the country and stumbled upon it while on a stroll down Haight.  It feels like you have walked into a scenario from "Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas," as though some kind of acid-trip is causing the walls to melt off and you are tunnelling into a trippy entrance to a psychedllic cave.  Every chair is unique and different, the best ones are the ones on the floor against the rough wall to the right hand side of the bar. Everything in "the cave" is one-of-a-kind, and it has a neanderthal-noir feel with animal print patterns floating around, crazy lighting(which fortunately for some, is rather low), and a DJ mixing an ecelectic mix throughout the entire journey.   It is also fantastic because if you come as a group you can sneak into an enclave to claim a niche near the window.  It is just the right size, located on the far east side of Haight near the park, and mainly locals roll through so it does not get too crowded. It is a great place to experience and I definitely will be back again.

gjh6da4yHahEpQ73O6DX_Q.review_text: A bit trippy and sort of eclectic in decor like a trip down the rabbit hole on acid, Noc Noc is an off kilter alternative to Toronado next door.  It looks really dark in there all day and it's easy to lose track time when you're inside.  Our hero has been there twice now and has enjoyed the laid back ambiance of the bar.  There's quite a variety of seating, it's perfect for catching up with old friends or pretending you're on drugs (when really you've just been drinking).  PROS: - It's got a really cool ambiance and it's definitely a nice place to hang out with a good noise level for conversation.  CONS: - Slightly less of a selection of beers compared to Toronado and sometimes a bit pricier. - Seating might be awkward for parties of more than 4 people.

nKRiCYgpz16FBeb-ZHkXEA.review_text: The interior has a funky Beetle Juice feel, the seating is totally unconventional and the music is a little too loud but none of that really matters because Noc Noc serves TWO GLUTEN-FREE beers!  So awesome.

KJWxMNwOirNIdXEsYGQnyw.review_text: The place feels different with cold sake. Get it.  Update: I'm worried because I find myself almost every day here. So I'm either an alcoholic or a fan. Anyway, if you happen to come here and you find a melancholic guy drinking sake in a brown fake leather jacket, come say hi. Love this place.

y_zSEmjcAiMzZVeMKa7KQA.review_text: I've never been a big drinker, but I always jumped at the chance to go to Noc Noc when I lived in the city and my friends wanted to go out.  They're never too crowded because they're a few doors down from a much more popular bar.  The decorations inside are wild.  I really would love to see this place in the light of day.  Last time I was there, we were all fooled into thinking there was a peep hole-esque window from the bar into the restroom.  Haha, it wasn't what we thought, so don't be concerned, the bathrooms are private - it's just one of the many quirks of the establishment.  I like that they have a really yummy pear cider on tap and a constant stream of fun music.    Several years ago, they hosted a speed dating event that fell through when the event coordinators failed to inform the participants who signed up that they were canceling due to event gender imbalance.  I would venture to say this is not a great venue for an event like this because the lighting is so dim, but a bunch of us stuck around and hung out because we were entertained by the ambience.  This is definitely a unique bar.  Even though its selection is limited, it compensates by creating an atmosphere that really can't be duplicated anywhere else I've encountered.

fW971v8bt2_dzbiUCZ_7UQ.review_text: It's a bar, it's a cave, and it's got great beer.  The music is always superb thanks to whoever mans that hidden DJ booth...And it's got more nooks and crannies than a damn English muffin.  Its close proximity to both my place AND a pizza place as well as the fact that it's the one place that my two roomies and I always agree on for drinking in our neighborhood seals the deal.  Five stars for you, Noc Noc!

qOejmuwUNap8ceateyaJMA.review_text: Okay...I'm not your typical Noc Nocer...or Haight Street hangout girl, but this place is awesome. Good for a drink or two before or after your night.   You can bring pizza or tacos in from the places next door if you are hungry late night...which I often have!  Fun place...interesting atmosphere...you don't have to be a 'hipster' to enter, but it does help.

EXqRybkIKj2b3YpAVq91_w.review_text: Like every other bar around here, there is a good beer selection.  The decor makes the experience!

4v9NX1EzLUH7inkmgHwUxA.review_text: It's always nice to share a bottle of cheap champagne among friends while sitting amidst recreations of cave paintings. Uh, say whaaaa?  Nice bartenders, fair prices, and a stroke-inducing paint job in the restroom.  HOWEVER: the weird and sort of unsuccessful concept of the Noc Noc's interior will definitely be reconfigured when (when, not if) Joanna and Robbie get their acts together and start Fraggle Night.  Yeah, you see that, Joanna? GET MOVING.

eNn5YANO-vSxSlVjs34Ivg.review_text: Come only for weird atmosphere and decor.  Not much else makes this place worth the trip.  And if so, just go to Tornado.  Might be fun at night on L, or other shit. Some decent beers, but only worth a one drink round

nqb5kKa4nHQtVq6zQZtnxg.review_text: My friend and bf were trying to decide if the theme was tribal or japanese? I nodded and said "Yea, whatevs."  It's just a chill dive where everyone one is welcome - sit on the floor pillows, odd booths with mirrors or on top of the "high back" chairs and grab a beer or sake.

wtS7PoB7D4eKESTHFW-90g.review_text: First impression is wtf is this place ? But as soon as I walked inside and looked at the place I felt very comfortable and admired the decoration and the character  this place have , to be honest I'm not even the type that like unconventional places but this is just a nice spot that I'll remember forever !!!  Way to go noc noc , very cool place !!

qKY70-70mhZQmZQl50TAcA.review_text: Just the right amount of evil.

1d5LxdI00F7YaiLyHnCQlA.review_text: Walked in Noc noc on my first night in San Francisco. The crazy, out of this world decor blew my mind off. It's a very small bar, but nevertheless with friendly staff and DRINKS SPECIALS. Try their noc noc specialty drinks, (usually around $5) they definitely knocked my socks on.  Noc Noc is not that pretentious kinda lounge where chicks wear skin tight dresses and dudes looking desparate. Expect a very laid back and eclectic crowd. During my visit, my crew shared our table with 3 other super cool guys.  Bottomline...decent price with unique drinks and very diverse, fun crowd.  One down side...no liquor served. :-(

-dOKdehUr5Xn18WBWqitVg.review_text: This is my default place to bring dates, because this place has gluten-free beer, which means I can linger over drinks if the date is going well; and this place is loud with trippy interior design, which means I can stop listening and paying attention if the date is going poorly.  I'd love to see a wider selection of GF beers, but they do also have cider, wine, and sake in case I tire of Redbridge.

XHuNSjrPA3Vyi7n4iVhZaQ.review_text: Why does everyone have their panties in a fit about the decorations? Do you guys only drink at the Clift or something? Maybe I'm just a fucked up individual (uh, i am) but this is basically what a bar should look like. Why even go to a bar if it resembles your yuppie crate and barrel living room? Just drink there - it's cheaper. Why not take the opportunity to drink in a bar that resembles Stonehenge?  Anyway, Noc Noc: awesome.  I'm just glad I no longer have to endure being verbally abused at Toronado to drink some Belgian beer.

xEc6S6ZTbFeNekKgWTZP9A.review_text: I went to this cute little bar with a friend last night.  It's definitely trippy looking in here.  The music was chill, the bartenders were super friendly and the drinks were cheap.  It was a Friday, fairly early in the evening (around 8 or 9) and the bar had enough people to be happening but it wasn't packed & annoying.  The allow dogs in here and there were some really sweet pups there.  Overall, a cool chilled-out place to have a conversation with either a group or one other person.  I'll definitely be frequenting this place....

UH6RCH9K1o2VW3CU8PY5iQ.review_text: Love this dark, dark, dive bar! So dark, I STILL don't know what the "decor" is like inside lol. It's smoky and dirty and danky but it's got such a good vibe and character that I can't help but always wanna grab a beer when I'm in the neighborhood. I'll stop now cuz there are plenty of other reviews that'll give you an idea of how cool it is.

zDltf7SGyDANcA6ndZkF7A.review_text: This was my first time going out in the Lower Haight and Noc Noc was our suggested destination. I arrived at least 15 minutes before the rest of my friends did and so I had quite a bit of time to take everything in. My first thought was that it was like nowhere I had ever been before. It had a dark, hippie, rave vibe to it which to me seemed like one giant oxymoron. Some how it kinda worked for them, though...  I walked up to the bar and realized quickly that they didn't serve anything outside of beer and wine. The couple next to me weren't quite as quick to catch on and kept asking for a vodka Red Bull. The bartender repeatedly screamed at them that they they didn't serve vodka Red Bulls which went way over their heads. "What do you mean? Just pour some vodka and Red Bull together and accept this cash!"   That was more entertaining than anything else but the reeealllly annoying thing about this bar were these giant, built in, wood backed stools that were ridiculously inconvenient. If you weren't sitting in them they were like a monumental obstacle standing in the way of you and your future beer. Bah!

TzV-eFbM5vTLDMqI-5xClw.review_text: Back in the late 80's I'd come here all the time, the only thing I ever drank was sake, plum wine iced or beer, back then that's all they served I believe, those were fun times. I don't get to the lower Haight too much anymore but the last few times were still enjoyable,and I am glad it's still around.

l20MTXXZq6ydgig4cPBK3A.review_text: Noc Noc's decor may be borderline creepy- but luckily that's something I find endearingly adorable about this small bar on Haight...curious and curiouser?  With a neighborhood feel and a friendly vibe, I find that Noc Noc is just the right amount of relaxed and creepy for me to stay interested. I like coming here late at night with a good friend and tucking away into one of the many corners. For this outing....leave your unimaginative and humorless friends at home....

lqEshkGlPoDWQqedICadGw.review_text: i picture everyone rolling in after decompression looking for an ice cold brew and a seat. but really, this place has pretty awesome music and brews. i kind of wish they had a full bar, but i think it would ultimately take away from the atmosphere.  i think i should go a few more times before deciding on it as a destination point but i definitely dig the vibe.

dAzvgrwL-2r7TYSSAuID5A.review_text: Noc Noc has delicious beers and beautiful bartenders (so tip well). FYI - IF the music is too loud just ask the DJ to lower it because oftentimes they are in the booth and cannot come out to hear what it sounds like because they are distracted by their beautiful music. So it is helpful to go in there because they ain't mindreaders for chrissakes, and they are there to heighten your drinking experience. $3 happy hours are perfect for poor ass hipsters. This is my local bar but I'm REALLY biased, been going there for 8 years. They have a great Belgian beer selection, I highly recommend the Piraat to make you feel all piratey and less of a landlover (or landlubber can never tell what really was being said). So enjoy the beers early before the crowds get too thick...and revel in the Lower Haight experience!

OFi92Xc2QyIr787GNKtgZA.review_text: Oldest bar in Lower Haight, it's got a pretty divey atmosphere as expected. The fact that they have a table made out of a former milk crate should clue you in on what to expect, and the design on the walls.. I don't even?  Happy hour is till 7pm and the cheapest beers start at $3. I was surprised to see Stone's RuinTen on tap here, but it kind of clues you in on their fairly progressive craft beer selection. During SF Beer week Noc Noc also plays hosts to a lot of tap takeovers so a nod to the bar owner.  Not usually my first destination for catching beer in the neighborhood but it's fun to show people around the diversity in bars in Lower Haight. The bartenders also aren't grumpy & they take credit cards unlike the popular craft beer bar two stores down.

HbJtkfXOqPvuYWlnP290xQ.review_text: One of the most creative dungeons to hang out in San Francisco. I can never stick around too long because it's another one of those beer and wine only bars that can only keep my happy for so long... I feel like I am in the Flinstones when i am in there! The bar next door should be a Jetson's theme and then life would be perfect!

KgHnLyAtS-MXEZ3TZviskg.review_text: Love the place. Super friendly owners and bartenders, great Belgian beer selection, great music ; it's home to me! Love you guys.

D-rKFBb1s4_4vpDA9Wjiog.review_text: good beer selection, usually has a place to sit, very odd decor.

F2_ws6cyfz7EvlpISMRHQA.review_text: Greatest Bar in the lower haight, always something a little off here which makes it the Noc Noc. Maybe the music, the bartender, the stranger offering you something. Great place to meet up and start er off.

n-eYeIpSTiKhoDeubO1mmA.review_text: This place is like Disneyland, in that once in a long while, I liked to go there, be amused by the total immersion, and left with a fun experience. You start going too much, and it gets old. Fast.   Like the amusement park, though, it's the perfect place to take your out-of-town friends that you rarely (want to) see. That way, they can tell everyone back home, 'I dunno about Omid, man. He's, like, really weirded out over there in Frisco. He took me to the most freaked out place, ever!' Next thing you know, you don't have to indulge their impromptu trips to California.   Now I gotta find a place like this in France.

Sy_Gbxx6KcFWUisSXzmngw.review_text: Great little dive bar. Funky decor, plenty of seating, good tunes and friendly bar tenders. Always a standby when in need of a dark divey establishment providing alcohol.

aea3PTk1cMMV7UTh9HXINA.review_text: Call me crazy, but this is probably the last place I'd want to be when "The Big One" hits.   If I died at Noc Noc during the earthquake, my obituary would read:  Sassy S. was a feisty girl and a bit of a lush, who was speared through the chest by a throne-like spiked chair with a cold Stella in her hand and a look of confusion on her face.  I'm not sure which is scarier: intruding on somebody else's used Tampon floating, unflushed in the women's toilet after you just ate a sausage at Rosamunde's and are feeling the frightening aftermath on your digestive system, or turning the lights on in this bar.  This place reminds me of the tactile dome, not only because of the strange decor and many touchable oddities, but because during the daylight it probably resembles Saddam Hussein's cave, with the addition of a dusty drain, chairs that are bolted to the floor, and a bar where the bartenders look at you like you ordered a tuna hand roll when asking for a Diet Coke.

36MiqVe8V1zsp_FmqhCEBw.review_text: meh... just not my kind of scene.  it was dark, loud, eerily decorated, and for a thursday night it was completely empty.  my friends like it, but it's just a different flavor than i'm used to.  pretty much went in to show me what it was like, and i was ready to leave immediately.  kind of like being in a haunted house, and i was waiting for a mummy to jump out at me.

TQzDqaxDDEeJcnWjTUe7Gg.review_text: Went here Friday night. What a strange place. I like it and even my ADD self was not bored because there was so much to look at.  I think this place is like a cave-goth-laser tag joint. Except with drinks instead of lasers and sweaty teens.

HJEn04iudiXFDhUpe4rXEQ.review_text: So on my MAC & CHEESE MARATHON, we brought some to go in from across the street and decided to drink and relax inside since my group is now getting a lil rowdy...the bartender was SUPER cool!!!!  We were there sunday during the day, but i can't remember his name but anyway, he totally rocked...he ran across the street and got stuff to make us Mac & Cheese and served it in a big chimay glass...it was AWESOME!!!!!!!!! We gave him and the Mac & Cheese fives stars and plus a firework...for going above and beyond to join in!!!!! Thank u! thank u!!! thank u!!!!!!!!!

UsXqCXRZwSCSw0AT7y1uBg.review_text: If Tim Burton's 'Beetlejuice' and Jim Henson's 'Fraggle Rock' had a baby, and that baby grew up to be a bar (a lot of hypotheticals here, I know), this place would be it.   Inside is like a creepy-in-a-good-way cave, though you should prepare yourself for it to be packed to the gat damn gills on Saturday night. Like, we ate beforehand and kind of wished we didn't because we had to use all our strength to suck in our guts in order to fit into this place.   Back on my home planet, I don't really go out on the weekends because I'm "not great in crowds". I don't dig lines, being shoved, fighting to get up to the bar only to be semi-ignored for another 15-minutes, not having a place to sit or stand, and not being able to hear anything the people I'm with are saying... which was basically the deal here, but the decor and vibe are so interesting that I actually didn't mind it much at all.   It was dark and I'm getting old so I chose something off the only menu I was close enough to to be able to read... which was a beer menu and likely what I would've ordered had I been able to see the greater selection anyway. All the beers that looked interesting to me were crossed off the list, unfortunately, so I settled on a beer I probably could have gotten at the liquor store just door's down for half the price, but whatever. That's what i get for being late to the party. My beer for sure tasted kind of off, so much so that I didn't actually even end up drinking half of it, but again, I did not care because attention was being paid to the decor above all else, while my friends and I focused on re-enacted every scene in Beetlejuice that involved a Harry Belafonte song or Michael Keaton grabbing his nuts.   All in all, a nice ass night at Noc Noc.

hVNNkmgcIsTvSjmaa_Vqbw.review_text: Felt like I was drinking a beer on the set of the Tim Burton/Michael Keaton classic "Beetlejuice." Cool people, trippy vibe, a few good beers, and a great location.

hQ8To_s10kfhi2rc4js5cg.review_text: What I love about this place:  the crazy Theodore Geisel (that's Dr. Seuss for the uninitiated) feel.  Ambiance is what the Noc Noc is all about.  They're not interested in having a bar that can hold as many sweaty frat boys they can shove in -- they chose a bar that feels like another world.  What I don't love about this place: the fact they don't sell hard liquor.  I'm not always a huge beer man, and I like to mix it up (yes, that's not a method for the amature).  But you can't fault them that much, given that in a two block radius the only bar selling hard booze is Molotov's.   Go here if you want a place that's cozy and quiet enough to actually talk to your drinking compadres.

zFtFgeIpiAWQW7Gzbz9hfg.review_text: I've been here twice...and I really liked it both times. I mean, come on, they have Racer 5, Speakeasy IPA, Fat Tire, and Sierra Nevada PA on tap? That's my entire evening right there. Very nice beer offering, and the bartenders are cool, they let you sample before committing. Sake available for those who do not consume beer. Then there's the decor. Totally bizarre and kick ass. The crowd is pretty local, people show up in bigger groups and tend to keep to themselves.

FSDj4JOrZxd5Z-ax15Klgg.review_text: I came here the day after Christmas, early evening, so it was super quiet. But the music later on, kicked in, and with only about 4 people, the sound waves resonated through the bar's stainless steel, early Flintstones decor. I was a nice place to chill on a lazy Sunday while sipping on a couple of glasses of pilsners.

5aCEquYmXUIsWmpUp1gqxA.review_text: Beetlejuice beetlejuice beetlejuice!  I came here dressed as a Santa Claus and drank beer without using my hands - no wonder my face is now breaking out.  I left an umbrella I stole from an earlier bar here.    We ordered several beers just cause we liked the logo - I found bottle in my purse this morning.  Good times.

-PoCbyNa4xc4yvReuj5pqw.review_text: Already drunk when we rolled in, not fancy but no nasty glares from hipsters.  Also not crowded which is a major plus with me.

X-ao_GLTWrMVhW0MIP9Pzg.review_text: Waaaay, way better than the surly khaki-infested atmosphere next door at Toronado. Man I hate that place!  I was afraid of Noc Noc or the first two months after I moved to the Lower Haight, but once I got up the balls (sufficient blood alcohol level) to wander in, I realized I'd found my Cheers. I like that the bartenders yell out to tell everyone when happy hour is ending. Sometimes when I get off the 6 or 7 at Haight/Fillmore I find myself unable to resist the magnetic force pulling me towards Noc Noc instead of home like a good girl. Lucky for me, the beer is cheap!

VSoB82qyIQxsYs-uDkALtg.review_text: A good refuge well served by Muni / no TV (a good thing). Could use more craft beers.

aJbXWA8OuA4mx0B67dXwNw.review_text: I like all of the Chimay, and the decor isa good conversation starter. My first underage bar, for real.

7V-_PpeQfrD6PyEklSwEdg.review_text: I was at the noc noc last night and my date and I liked it. I  I remember it having a cool vibe. We found a seat on the floor in the corner with a ton of pillows and a some hot sake.  Although I was uninterested in making out with my date, I could picture myself making out with someone comfortably there over a bottle of hot sake. I'm for sure going back!

ZrXUauJw1f4QYpklfCLZPw.review_text: in his early days before starring on the hit television show, The Flinstones,...Fred created a bar that him and the guys could hang out in, eveything was up to the latest styles, cave paintings, faux animal skin stools, dark lighting...perfection. this place is a total trip, weird looking inside, but i mean that in the best way possible. beer and wine only..but beer imported from all over the world....cool people, 1 hott bartender as i have seen so far, and an all around sweet place.

ZzFCeP3bB_V1F7DsQ7hWNA.review_text: For what it is - an eclectic dive bar in the Lower Haight - this place does it well.  Although they only have beer and wine, there is no shortage of drafts and bottles to choose from, be it you like the dark stuff, the light stuff, or even a mixture of the two.    The real reason to go here is atmosphere. It's dark, intimate, covered in art and other fun things to look at, and has the most comfortable cushions to cozy your ass up on the floor with.  Which are also by the way are great for people watching, be it your thang is hipsters, the occasional wide-eyed Marina transplant, or your fellow neighbors in the hood.

8EC-Pz9CHihfkzCfnne64g.review_text: Intimate, dark, and really cool decor.  They have an awesome selection of sakes and some really good black and tan recipes.  No liquor here, but a great place to relax and have a conversation over some beers.

8xs7R4KDW95c3wFjJUnwQQ.review_text: Bartender was super friendly and the place is very cozy.

Or-5choooobXikcd02etTA.review_text: This place has it all: good beer, good service and a really, really rad atmosphere.   I've never been in a bar decorated with this amount of creativity before. It's like being in an artsy, colorful cave...with random objects mosaic-ed together, broken bottles hanging from the ceiling, and rotating art on the walls from time to time.   I can't put a finger on the music they play, because it seems to be different every time...and there was a techno dj the last time I was there, so I know I can't tell you what to expect. (I do know that that night sparked a random dance party in the joint and the regulars were excited...)  The beer selection is solid enough for a bar that doesn't specialize in that genre, and the price is right, indeed. I think it's $4 a pint?   Noc-Noc is part of the Lower Haight rad-bar-sphere. It just adds to all that is tight in the 'hood.

djWl0HKJwEwWlY-0vo7oRA.review_text: Cool, chill bar with trippy decor that makes you feel like you're in a spaceship in a star trek movie. They only serve beer/wine/sake. Super cool bartender, but I forgot her name unfortunately. They even let us bring in pizza from next door to eat because we were hungry.

CgHbSPnkpCBn-EJkwJeghA.review_text: Noc Noc?    Who's there?  *the sound of a pin dropping*   uhm, well apparently not many people...  The last time I went to Noc Noc, on a Wednesday, there were 3 dudes who looked like they probably spent every Wednesday there and a young couple who were practically mauling at each other on one of the ground level couches (a cushion on the floor).    I'm not going to hate on this place, I simply won't.  I'll just go knowing that there may not be the most interesting crowd but a decent beer selection, and when it's a local dive you want, that's about all you can really ask for, right?  I knew it was time to go home once the "floor couple" stumbled out in a lip lock and one of the 3 bar men fell to the ground.  That SHOULD raise my rating a star, but it doesn't.

fhk-dAh8Ab0-9DKmBqUzbw.review_text: Ohhhhh Noc Noc, you are so silly to me. This bar is like Beetle Juice on crack. It's one of my faves because they always have good music, it's pretty cheap, and you meet the most random people. Try the Christmas Ale..it's like Santa Claus in your tummy. Yum.

MiQr7921e6ewplyyGkMPnA.review_text: Friendly bartender and a good beer selection for someone who likes dark beer.  Decor is eclectic, lol.  Really eclectic.  We liked the music.

BVOek4y7v5-B-tpCB2AcQg.review_text: now ive never written anything for yelp but i felt like this should be my first. THIS PLACE IS THE SHIT!. i mean live music everyday and the atmosphere is perfect! yeah it was owned by some japanese guy before but now its totally different. the atmosphere it great, just some place you want to chill with a couple of buddies. the bartenders are awesome and really chill when you get to know them. basically they serve the best Belgium beer and if you need a break from Toronados, hit up Noc Noc's and feel like your at home with the super inviting staff. 5 out of 5 stars!

cOh5jn7OuGywVBp_hU3_ow.review_text: I came upon this place while hopping around new years eve. When you walk in, you'll feel like you've walked into a cave! Looks like a bar but they only serve beer and sake.  I was in here with 3 of my friends and we got first a bottle of hot sake (8 bucks) then a bottle of cold sake (10 bucks). The bartenders were nice because when 2 of my friends were....a bit tipsy...they offered water and everything.  Lastly, for a bar, they have a really clean restroom (i know its a pet peeve). So overall, this place is a nice place to chill but not the best to get drunk (being that they have no hard liquor).

_ueX3a8lqk7WPklhrH6cyg.review_text: Probably one of the worst bars I've been to. How will I ever forget the asshole with no shirt on that decided it would be funny to fall all over me, or the girl that passed out on my other friend, or the $9 drink I got (when the full bottle is usually that much, not a half...) Oh, and it was just kind of.... creepy. I don't know, not into it.

W0TobKzkaqtOZpIe0CrENQ.review_text: Um, crazy artwork & alcohol sometimes mix too well.   Was this a dream?

im5OmfN98urUNol28HwX4w.review_text: Wonderful atmosphere relaxed dim lights, remarkable decoration, I love it. nice beer selection and friendly staff. Should have spent more time here :)

3lUkFxUQKeMUYH7-z_kmjg.review_text: This bar is funky, eclectic and just the kind of place you want to stumble upon.  A little psychedelic and cave-like.  It's dark in here too.  It was late, and I think a weekday that we visited, and the place was nearly empty.  Since we wandered for awhile for a bar, as tourists I didn't realize we were in the Lower Haight which doesn't attract as many tourists.  I don't understand why, this is the kind of place you want to have a drink - and a place you'll remember!  We attended a wine tasting prior to this, and we were wasted by the time we left.  I almost broke my husband's camera, and we got into a fight in here, and then we got lost and couldn't find the bus.  But we still remember this bar, and all the murals on the street, so if I can say "you'll get into a fight but it's still awesome," then that should say something.

7S-tZWfgx8UUX9JDnQ0F8g.review_text: From the moment I walked in, I felt ridiculous and knew I was making a mistake. The paper mache structures were embarrassing, and I felt like a total ass sitting atop a medieval mushroom stool surrounded by stained velvet throw pillows that were strewn across the sticky beer-soaked floor (to suggest what, that we should somehow want to get low and comfy with a special someone? Gross.) . Who would want to lounge around on the floor besides a date rapist looking to roofie their intoxicated victim? My Fat Tire, which should have been the highlight, tasted like it was strained through a mildew beer tap, and the music was an uninspiring mix of 90's alterna-crap and predictable fading hipster trucker hat rock culled from the pool of trends of 2003. This place epitomizes the "hip" yuppie douchebag vibe that is ever-present in the Lower Haight. Noc noc or being hit in the face? I'd go with the latter.

Q2Iest8oggBub6nVBFEcNw.review_text: If you're tired of look-alike bars, give Noc Noc a shot.  Not only does it have a bizarre tribal/alien ambience, even the seating and layout is extremely creative.  We wound up at a table that was essentially tucked into a hole in the wall.  Good beer selection, including something I'd never heard of, "El Toro presents Jasper Poppy" or something like that.  Is it really poppy-flavored?  Possibly.  At any rate it tastes like little else in the SF beer canon.  Essentially, Noc Noc and it's neighbor Toronado should form the backbone of any good Lower Haight pub crawl.  Just remember there's no hard liqour here.

oA4ompknoW6XrONKYXQ_jQ.review_text: I am that girl.  You know the one who looks like she stumbled out of the Marina, pointy shoes and blonde hair, and decided to slum it up in the lower Haight in hopes of meeting a dirty hipster boy to show her how the other half live.  And by live I mean give head.  Last night Sammy, her manmeat and I decided on Noc Noc for a quick drink.  Coming off a 24 hour bender, I decided to be their non-alcoholic Marina Chode for the night.  And just like an obnoxious Marina girl I ordered my non alcoholic drink of choice; Diet Coke with Lemon.  You could have sworn that I was speaking Finnish to the bartender.  She gave me the most quizzical look.  Like no one in their right mind would order a Diet Coke with Lemon at her bar, and I just had.  She was so confused.  In a glass?  Yes.  With ice?  Yes.  A lemon wedge?  Mother of fucking god, is it that difficult?  So I am sipping my Diet Coke, looking around, and swear my shit was drugged, because we had been magically transported to Hades.  The devil was laughing at me and my Diet Coke.  I heard him.       The whole scene is straight from a Tim Burton film circa 1995.  And not in a good way.  The chairs bolted to the floor at the bar seriously haunt my dreams.  Sammy had to hold me and pet my hair as I frantically kept repeating, "Beetlejuice, Beetlejuice, Beetlejuice".  Oh, and thank god they don't allow smoking inside anymore.  Last time I was there I thought my eyes were going to start bleeding.  Which, no doubt, would have made the devil pretty happy.  Happier than a blonde Marina girl drinking Diet Coke laced with PCP.    Which IS pretty funny.

b0fp-eS8_MKTg4tcZsCNqQ.review_text: Don't remember anything special about the drinks, but I don't really remember much about this night at all... Could be a good or a bad thing depending on how you look at it?  Go here and check out the chairs at the bar. The inside is REALLY neat. Lots of wonderful artwork and really cool lighting. It doesn't look like much from the outside, but the inside is trippy and beautiful.  The place gets a little crowded and loud on weekend nights but it's still pretty chill. I don't think it's open for happy hours or during the day, but definitely worth a trip to Lower Haight to check it out.

3XtMlMcY4k1Rop3aCUrn6Q.review_text: Noc Noc?  Hell yeah.  I've been going to this cave for so long I don't even see what people are talking about anymore.  Cave?  Psychadellic? Dark and Loud?  I keep forgetting why I liked going there in the first place.  I guess there's a reason I've been going there for almost five years without fail on what was almost a daily basis, then weekly, and now that I'm out of the neighborhood, about monthly (and why my room is so dark and cluttered and booze-filled).  But it's worth the ride on the bus.  Nothing like stinking of Liberty and smoke rolling back into a neighborhood in which I might be shocked to find someone trying to steal my sparkplugs right out of my bike then have a "good natured debate" on classicism and the ideologies of ownership.  It's wierd, baby.  But I'll be back.  Just like how you can't keep a good dog in the grave, I'll come crawling back just to see the joyous old faces of yonder years that'll outlive me, no doubt, because I'm stupid for having ever left a part of myself there.

5MFYDd60uO_LNQH_PL0qXQ.review_text: If a cyberpunk and a gnome had sex while on mushrooms, this would be a great place to do it in public. In other words, the interior is trippy.  Nice selection of quality beers. No hard liquor, which is just fine by me.  Uber friendly staff.  Dark, mysterious, fascinating decor,  truly a mushroom trip come to life.  Step into the rabbit hole!

K9tmia6na5p4bbnJcQ4qRg.review_text: It feels like you are an extra on the set of a so-bad-it's-good 80's sci fi movie. I read one article in which they boasted that they were one of the first places to play acid jazz back in the day. Things are making a bit more sense now. The lighting is insane, it looks like you are in a cave. For the most part, our bartender was playing some odd as hell tunes from her phone, which I enjoyed. We couldn't hold a decent conversation that night, but as extras on set we did a great job of looking like we were having fun.

Xj59f8t-nmAlRhrCUsTX6Q.review_text: Cool and unique joint. Good variety of beers--the couple I tried were tasty. The bartenders were friendly and helped us in selecting some beverages that fit our taste buds. Gets a bit crowded, but if you're lucky enough to find seats like we were, then you're good to go.   Come here for beer and a fun atmosphere... Not for wine (wasn't good) and a quiet place to hang (it's loud).

Urdqr1dnt1wZ66BZltnToA.review_text: goood beer HAYWIREE HEFF my favv love the haight and right next to a pizzaaa shop yumm yum yummm!

VP5sp8r6uOYlBhOeMdbkMw.review_text: "Spaceship Lands in Cave on the Lower Haight"  Dark ambience, great microbrews on tap and some truly otherworldly decor that recalls the Star Wars cantina. A must-see on anyone's list in the Lower Haight.

vN5fBsWdKkJPbFJVAxzZ3A.review_text: This is easily one of my favorite neighborhood bars. Sure, Moltovs is across the street, but if you're trying to avoid the grungy man slurring as he says, "wanacigarede?" then head over to noc noc. It has a dingy, dark, cave vibe that's perfect when you just want to meet friends for a couple drinks and catch up.

XUSHu2fpTJUCY55CyhC7sg.review_text: Great beer at a reasonable price. I always come here for a great time with great friends! I heard it was a Dr. Seuss bar, but I dunno..

A2y4lQt9hOsBHuQJMqIrHg.review_text: Great selections, knowledgable and friendly bartenders.   Couldn't remember the name of it and was describing it to friends and I said "Kind of a post-apocalyptic Flinstones place", both of them immediately replied "Ohh...that place is great."

MifuzEx1J_Evsym19W70hw.review_text: I've been bringing my out of town friend here for years... Haight is like Fishermans Warf for the Gen Y crowd - what can I say?  It's crazy dirty funny cool... but could use some cocktails. Just beer is so 90's.

jy_RGAeAvNeCv5BxZsUWFA.review_text: I haven't reviewed this place yet because for some reason I can never think of what to say about it. I love this bar but Is that enough of a review? Would "I love this bar" as a review in anyway do the awesomeness of Noc Noc any credit?  This is the first bar I ever had a Belgian beer; Chimay in '88 or '89. They used to be only half the size they are now, the area in front of the bar all the way out to the door. I can't remember exactly when they expanded into the space to the right of the bar but I was suspicious that things would change.  I've always thought Noc Noc looked like what people think a cool bar should look like, more like a Hollywood set for an SF bar scene. This is my favorite place to take people from out of town, they always get a kick out of it.

RDU27joptNn9rPx4DfGgUw.review_text: Definitely a dive bar atmosphere; it's rather small and very dark/dingy.  Went here for early evening drinks and was pleasantly surprised by the prices (only $4/pint),  I personally prefer a brighter/up-beat atmosphere, but despite the fact that this bar has the complete opposite environment, it was still rather enjoyable with friendly staff and laid-back patrons.  They don't serve hard liquor; only beer & wine (includes saki).

ZcWWm3ACxu8OLc3v6Xl4Eg.review_text: it was quiet but we were there pretty early...hello happy hour!!!!  the beer was good and the bartender was awesome. I love that it was dark and dingy despite being light out side.

Rrmb6UQUR-U3an6wy2h9wA.review_text: Although I'll always think of this place where I drank a beer with a date gone wrong, I liked it. It reminded me of a cafe/bar in Placerville that really is in an old gold mine/cave. It's funky, eccentric and the bar dude was playing some tech reggae/dub. I mean, how often can you get a Downtown Brown for $3 pint during happy hour with some music that's not electroclash with a bar dude who's also happy. And not because you're just spending your money there.  Yup. It was Friday at 6pm.

25e0gmne7_5pSBFR1sFakg.review_text: I dig it. Dark, cosy, funky, interesting ambiance, ... it's a cool place to hang.  On the bad side, no hard alcohol and LOUD!! If you actually want to hear what the other person is saying, might not be the best spot. If you don't, perfect. You can just nod and say "yeah" like to are totally into what they are saying.

Fg1ZhF_2pHcRwgyq_6yUiQ.review_text: i walked and was like "what kind of nightmare-before-christmas-ass-shit is this?"   it's like the walls, furniture and fixtures are coming alive to envelop you in shadows. it's tim burton's version of hell.  [but thankfully everything just sits there while you drink your beer]  kooky as it is, it isn't a bad bar. just don't try dinging "feliz navidad" once inside. or yelling anything regarding the oakland A's.   [we were hounded by a polka-dot-tie-wearing-viagra-gulping-old-­businessman with his wannabe-bouncer-from-jerry-springer boyfriend for doing so. it was an interesting evening regardless.]  the beer selection works well for most unless you're snotty [note: snotty folk need not apply here], and the crowd can use some work, but with the right people you can turn this little hovel into your own personal dungeon of delight.

GRh1cG-w44ALvVl0CpMw1w.review_text: This bar is a weird little cave-like place that sorta reminds me of the inside of lame haunted house rides at fairs.  However, since it's not that, it's actually kinda neat.   They have a decent draft selection, though not great.  They have a bunch of Belgians in bottles too.  They have a few fun cider/beer mixtures that never would have occurred to me to try.  My main complaint is that it was SO COLD inside.

d19VWxkXk3glukbSsE-VUw.review_text: I used to be scared to enter this place, mostly because I had never seen the inside and usually drinking establishments with zero windows  = sketch factor++. However, after getting inside once and finding out that they have a respectable selection of fine brews and that not everyone in there looks like an alcoholic or meth addict, I started to feel a little more at home. This place is great because it has a feel completely different from the other bars on this block, and since I live nearby, I need to break up my drinking styles a bit from time to time in order to stay on my toes. It's a great place to chill and converse with someone in a bit more of an intimate setting. The funkiness of the interior shouldn't shock any of you, you live in San Francisco, for fuck's sake. Get weird.

Dp9vtkpgNti0BuG3202PGQ.review_text: Four stars for uniqueness and intrigue.  This odd little beer and wine bar in the Lower Haight is a must-see.  If Fred Flintstone were alive (and real), this is totally where he and his buddies would kick it.  It looks like a dark cave with weird melted rocks everywhere.  Even your seat is a weird melted rock.  Nothing else is that exceptional...but it's worth a visit for the experience (kinda like Country Station Sushi).  The crowd was an eccentric mix of hippies, hipsters, and weirdos - with lots of overlap between all three categories.  They have some interesting beers that I haven't seen elsewhere too.  Why do you need to do shrooms when you can just cruise to the Noc Noc.\?

Ig2ttf1xX2Ihlm0nsykaTw.review_text: if you end up on lower haight go here! its trippy and fun and cool staff and affordable! wild man,t.v.'s in the walls and crazy shit everywhere,gets surreal after a while. :) niiice:) caught the clap from the bathroom once.:p

wda1o9GgtHNc3z-dOKV8kw.review_text: I'll admit, the bars on this strip of Haight do not jibe well with me. While Molotov's holds the distinction of being the first place I've ever seen cocaine, I've found most of the establishments in this area very forgettable. However, Noc Noc seems to be at least trying to be memorable.  You've probably heard people coming up with ways to describe their interior. My favorite: A spaceship crashed into a cave. It is unique and is likely the main draw of the place. They claim it is an art installation and in one of the corners you can read a placard about what the artist was going for. Oddly enough, the phrase "Fraggle Rock" is not mentioned.   The selection of beer is actually pretty good, emphasizing some Belgian bottles. I have always found the staff working the tiny bar area to be really friendly, so that's a plus. Space is tight and seating sporadic, which can make it difficult to sit back and enjoy a drink with friends.  So, while I try to avoid going out in this area, sometimes my friends insist. In those instances, I try to make the best of the situation and go to Noc Noc.

iI5hC_uNUBGkkvtWrBIaZQ.review_text: Decent little place for a Saturday evening beer.  Serving beers in a pitcher format would be a little better.     The decor is hit or miss.  I really like the over the top and ridiculous chairs, but the underground rave theme from the movie "Go" can be a little weird.

OnagJ2dnPjfRRT4a_CgKCw.review_text: This place scares me. The only thing that seem real is the Tamale lady that comes in around mid-night...

2xeAGKBW3Fhb2iwUr--9FA.review_text: Cool spot! I'm a sucker for the underground UK vibe, and this place has it. Noc Noc stands for "Nocturnal Nocturne", appropriate for a bar that plays a healthy amount of drum and bass and jungle. Dark, black light, zebra stripes kinda place. Reasonably priced brew too!

VpREWOjt5Pna6OIgXI9Jcg.review_text: Small and cave-like, with a familiar, non-disgusting smell of beer and alcohol, it looks and feels like an old punk club. It's cozy, in a really weird, different way.  Music blares from the speakers, so it's a tough place to talk, but a fun bar with interesting metalsmith decor and cheap beer. Don't get dressed up to come here, seriously. The only times I've been were, appropriately, for last-minute, "Hey, I'm in the Lower Haight, want a drink somewhere" nights.  Anyway, worth it if you're already in the 'hood, but perhaps not worth a trek from the other side of town. Not a bad walk from the Mission on a nice night, though.

NlrmR5RgQutT1Nngb-Driw.review_text: Once upon a time, before everyone had a broadband Internet connection -- before most people had any type of Internet connection, really -- before the mid-90s tech boom, before the dotcoms, before the truly obscene rents and housing prices -- there was SF Net.  SF Net was a dialup BBS (it had public terminals, too -- you could log on from the Horseshoe, across the street from Noc Noc) filled with socially awkward types of people from all walks of life with many things in common, including an unquenching thirst for beverages alcoholic. At some point, long before I arrived on the board, Noc Noc became an official bar of sorts for the SF Net crowd. I understand that this had much to do with the Orbit Room down on Market uninviting the group, but that's not my story to tell.  I loved this place from the start. Loved its melty kind of Star Wars cantina look. The bar staff who made me fall in love with black & tans. And snakebites. And many other forms of alcoholic goodness that could never, ever be called cocktails but always good goddamn drinking. Always liked the varied seating, except for the floor stuff.
