Never liked the floor stuff.  Noc Noc has always had a mixture of people, from the Lower Haight denizens to the slumming Marina types and everyone in between. Favorite memory came the night two sorority sisters walked into the bar, one delightedly saying to other "Oh my god, didn't I tell you this place was FUNKY?" This was the cue for two female friends sitting across the table to grope each other and scream "IT'S A LESBIAN BAR! A LESBIAN BAR!"  Well, SF Net is long gone and I don't go to Noc Noc that much anymore -- maybe a couple of times a year as opposed to every Friday night -- but it hasn't changed much over the years. Still sort of friendly, sort of strange, and sort of crowded. In San Francisco, that's probably as close as you can get to long-term stability.

o9Ez0unDH1XninHhs3h2Fw.review_text: ATTN ALL YELPERS:  I am not cool.   I don't do drugs.   Therefore I don't like Noc Noc. Not only did I have to stare at weird monkeys and torpedoes with gas masks and feel like I was in some psychedelic version of the Bat-cave, but I had to listen to "headache music". This bar makes The Clash look like Posers.   Great beer selection though. They serve St. Peter's, which I love.   Luckily I survived the drug induced Bat-cave experience when my Chris O'Donnell Robin whisked me outside to the dirty curb filled with cigarette smoke and people wearing shirts with "blood" spattered all over them.

Qk3i2aD5N91tS_L8xh-SUg.review_text: OK bear with me for this somewhat silly analogy. You know how in SF there is endless debate over the authenticity of taquerias?  Like "Papalote is good but not authentic because they don't make tofu mole in Mexico" etc. etc. This bar is the authentic hipster dive bar.  Noc Noc was doing its dark and funky thing back in the days when only three people had fixed gear bikes and people from Walnut Creek didn't wear skinny jeans.

GaM-gkeJnI-NV_jNvXAHIg.review_text: Really great ambiance.  The Tim Burton comments are pretty true, but it's more a weird stylish euro vide.  Pretty great beers on tap, though expect to pay ~6 a pint.  They were playing the latest Burial album, which automatically gives 4 stars.

awmRirDC7WWig6R07XZ_oA.review_text: I felt like I was back on the playa at Camp Noc Noc.   Nice getaway from the real world!

XCW5pJCDhvlW76XTSUEkIg.review_text: If you could make a bar out of the house from the movie Beetle Juice.  This would be the place.    I kept thinking that the song "Day-O" was about to start and we were all going to start uncontrollably singing along and dancing to it.  This is totally the type of place my husband and I would frequent if we lived closer.  The only bad thing I noticed is that they only serve beer & wine.  I would rather have a funky cocktail here than a glass of beer.  Though, the beer I did have was called "The Big Black Daddy."  It was fun just saying that.

gga3t9HGp_xTUbkdGSPmtg.review_text: Gosh I haven't been here in such a long time and I don't need to repeat all the other reviews. I will say that just from one of my friend's mentioning this place in a FB post today, it's inspired me to plan a trip to SF so I can stop by and relive the past. So, there. I'M EXCITED.

_c50WkYV9C2XieD8blXBUA.review_text: After eating, drinking and socializing at a restaurant our group gathered ourselves to this small dark bar, which I had avoided before because I could never really see inside, but I'm glad I finally went in.  I liked it, the music was cool, the crowd was fun, no annoying, pretentious human beings and my drink was strong enough, can't really ask for much more.

WFGLQTWfEChPy-PpRplqKg.review_text: Is this place for real?   I suggest doing what we did and start off at Toronado's and then enter NOC NOC during their wonderful $3 happy hour with a good buzz already going. You will either fall in love, be overwhelmed and uncomfortable or just have a really damn good time but at least you will already be drunk so it will be extra special.   This place is a trip and I will definitely add this to my "go to" spots in the City whenever I visit. San Fran you have my heart and NOC NOC you just just helped renew my love for a great city and a great area to hang.   To quote one of my favorite people who lives there and frequents NOC NOC he said "It is a tweakers dream"

mgi2o_hPAQHszqmlEg7xig.review_text: Great drinks for a cheap price. This bar is fun, its got an old school psychedelic vibe. I hope these gems stay around in the city. Across the street is Memphis Minnie's for some delicious BBQ.

J9b9YUP1bWSkO3T7XS6uYA.review_text: It takes a special mood to feel like going to the Noc Noc.  You walk off of Haight street into a cavernous room, decorated in what I can only call "very odd."  I like that they won't serve crappy beer, and they have some good beer on tap.

e77JyltArqckcdBl13bVbA.review_text: I've been coming here on and off for almost 20 years.  I'd put this first on the list of bars to check out on your Lower Haight bar crawl.  The decor is right out of the Flinstones, and they have an excellent draft beer selection.  Pull up a rock and have a seat.

3xrJvBPsqY7spQbyLe0edg.review_text: The perfect place, representing the lower H. in SF. Place to sit, beer, great electronic music relaxing atmosphere. A little dirty to add charm. I feel a lot better there than any "clean bar". Manny other places get "very dirty" with attitude and puke  as the night progresses after the drunks exceeded there limit.   Where is something like this in Chicago ?????... Help if you can.

VW22zRpkRXZd_5g_bo7Fnw.review_text:
As the reviews indicate, this place has a polarizing effect on people.
  The good:
 1. Good import beer selection
 2. Bar staff ranges from AA members to drug dealers
 3. If you are enough of a drunk you can drink on credit and pay it off on pay-day (or when you sell your mom's TV)
 4. Safe place to meet someone you are having an affair with
  The not so good:
 1. Safe place for your GF/BF to meet someone they are having an affair with
 2. Fighting off crack whores while smoking cigarette or pot (recent inconvenience as you used to be able to smoke inside)
 3. No one will wake you up if you pass out 
 4. No vodka or whiskey (drink the sake instead)

ENxjPutN8QnIY0CyvXJUFQ.review_text: This place is great.  It kind of looks like a cave, but on drugs.  It's dark, dingy and they have cushions so you can sit on the floor.  They don't serve liquor, but have a solid selection of good beers.  No cheap domestics here!  The sake here is delicious.  There are lots of little cubby holes if you want some privacy.  They have nice selection of board games behind the bar if you want to play some chess or Othello while you have a beer.   You used to be able to smoke in here, but alas, no more.  No cigs and no doobies.    Bonus point for being the bar where I pulled my first ever threesome and also for meeting a girl there who was willing to have sex with me in the bathroom, happily using her face as a doorstop :-)
